1.content:
After what seems like an eternity of tossing and turning, you walk up in a cold sweat. You then quickly rush to the bathroom mirror fearing the worst, fortunately your reflection put your fears to rest, it was just a nightmare.

As you walk back to your bed you laugh thinking what a bizarre dream you’d had. You were at the club having a blast until you had a little too much to drink and slapped the ass of the wrong girl. Well apparently she wasn’t having a good night because she quickly turned around and stared you down, and then the music stopped and everyone around you froze in place, except for her. Then she starts walking towards you yelling at the top of her lungs about how all men were sexist bastards that saw women as nothing more than sex objects and eye candy. And that you were going to have to pay for it. They she starts babbling something and next thing you know, everyone guy in the place is staring at you, and you can see your reflection in their eyes but it’s not you, in one you’re a busty blonde, then a red head in a micro miniskirt, then you’re black with a huge ass, and then you’re a petite Asian. Then your head starts spinning and you run out of the club and the next thing you knew, you’re wakening up in your bed.

Looking at the clock you see its lunch time, and after a night like that you could defiantly go for something to eat. So you leave your room and head for the kitchen, where you find your roommate Joey, “Morning Man,” you say, opening the fridge without looking at him. “Ah hey I’m Joey, Will’s roommate; I don’t think we’ve met.” He says looking at you smiling, you laugh turning to him to say, “Ha ha very funny….” Suddenly you look past him to the reflection in the sliding glass window, it wasn’t yours!

What do you look like?

(Keep in mind this is your roommates type of woman.)
1.title: Not A Dream (originally by Wanderer0426)

11.content:
The reflection was faint so you rush to the mirror on the wall, you couldn’t believe your eyes, especially since you had already checked your reflection moments ago. You then quickly look down, to see that it wasn’t just the mirror; you were slender and curvy with long brown hair, and wearing a black thong with a gray long sleeved shirt that barely covered your stomach.

http://galleries2.amakings.com/obsessedw...

As you stand the squirming at the thought of your current form, you get the strange feeling that you’re being watch. Turning around you find Joey staring at you practically drooling. You felt weird enough and didn’t even know how to respond, all you could do was try to cover up as much as you could and rush back to your room.

You burst through your door way closing the door behind you. You then close your eyes and sit on the floor with your back to the door trying to figure out how this could be possible. “This can’t be happening. This can’t be happening.” You mutter to yourself, “I mean one minute I’m me and the next I’m….” Suddenly you open your eyes and look down. You were back to normal, confused you stand up and rush back to your bathroom mirror. You were back to normal, but what was that, are you still dreaming, but it felt so real.

Suddenly you hear a knock on your door, you figured Joey was probably wondering what just happened. “Hey, is everything alright in there?” Joey asks, “Yeah man all good.” You respond, walking towards the door, “I don’t know what happened man, I introduced myself and she freaked and ran away.” Joey says, as you open the door, “Wait what you mean she?” you quickly think to yourself. You then look at Joey but something was different, the two of you were suppose to be about the same height but you were looking up at him, and he was looking down at you smiling, “Ah hey I’m sorry if I startled you back there…” he says, suddenly you look down to see that you were a girl again.

“What the hell!!” you exclaim rushing back to the bathroom, “Wait what did I do now?” Joey says confused as he follows you, He stands there watching you panic in front of the mirror. “Hey calm down what’s wrong, is there anything I can do, and where is Will? He asks, you then turn to him and say, “What are you talking about, I am Will!”

Joey is speechless, he has no idea how to respond, and I mean it’s not every day a person tells you they are someone else, so he didn’t know what but he assumed you had brought home a drug addict or something, “Ah hey, just calm down everything is going to be alright.” He says slowly putting his arm around you and guiding you back to the bed and sits you down. “Deep breaths, do you want some water, do u need me to call someone or take you home?” he ask, “I am home!” you exclaim, “I’m Will, I mean I had a nightmare just like this, then I woke up and everything was fine, then I go to the kitchen and I look like THIS,” you say gesturing to your body, “then I ran back here and I was me again, and then I open the door and I’m this again!” you exclaim laying back on the bed.

You then get that feeling again, you look up see Joey staring at you again. “Hey!” you exclaim as you jump up. “What?” he asks, “You know what!” you say pulling the covers off the bed and wrapping them around you. “I’m sorry! I couldn’t resist. But don’t worry, Will is like a brother to me I wouldn’t…. “He says, “Well I appreciate that man, especially since I AM WILL!” you exclaim, you can tell he’s still skeptical, “Okay I hope id never have to say this again but two years again you…” you says whispering a deep dark secret about him that he knew you would never tell anyone. Suddenly his expression goes from confused to shocked, “Will!?” he says. “Yeah man it’s me,” you say reluctantly, “But how?” he asks, “I don’t know man, I just had this weird dream last night” You say, “Well what happened?” he asks

(Give your more detailed version of the dream)
11.title: Body 1 (Originally by Wanderer0426)

111.content:
“Well what happened?” Joey asked, “Well I was at the Club Infinity downtown, drinking with some of the guys from work, and I think it was someone’s birthday so I ended up drinking a little more than usual.” You say looking at Joey as though you were trying to convince him of something, but by the look on his face you could tell he wasn’t buying it. “And by a little too much you mean way too much, right?” he says, You then slump your shoulders in shame and say, “Yeah pretty much, so after about an hour I wonder off to find the bathroom, and on my way there I see this girl wearing these ridiculously tight leather pants, and you know a nice ass is my weakness, and I wasn’t thinking clearly so I kind of…. Grabbed it…” you say, “Wait, you grabbed her ass?” he asks, “Well it was really more of a slap and grab but yea…” you say, Suddenly Joey busts out laughing, “Wow man, I know you’re an ass man but I’ve never seen you that drunk but let me guess, she turns around and slaps you?” he asks, “Well actually no, worst. She spins around and she’s some kind of hard core gothic chick, you know lots of makeup, piercings, pentagram necklaces.” You say, “Wow even in your dreams you have the worst luck.” He says laughing

You glare at him for a moment, “Well point is then it gets weird, the music stops and everyone freezes in place, like time had stopped. But then she started yelling at me saying, ‘That’s it! I’m tired of chauvinist pigs like you thinking that women are nothing more objects for your amusement! You think I like being objectified just because of my physical appearance? Let’s see how you like it!’ Then she started babbling something and next thing I knew every guy in the bar was staring at me. And I could see my reflection in their eyes, but it wasn’t me, I was a girl but it was a different girl for every guy. Then I looked back at her and she was laughing, and I looked down and my body and clothes kept changing. So I ran out of the bar as fast as I could, next thing I knew I woke up in my bed back to normal.” You say, “Well that was one hell of a dream, and normally id tell you not to mix your alcohols but since in at least four inches taller than you and you’re wearing a thong I’m pretty sure there was a little more to it than that.” He says

“Wait didn’t you say you were going downtown last night?” Joey asks, “Well yeah I think so.” You say, “And I think you did say something about Nick’s birthday last week.” he asks, “Yeah” you say reluctantly dreading what you knew he was getting at. “And isn’t this the shirt you were wearing last night?”He says picking a shirt up off the floor, “Yes!” you say finally realizing that it was no dream.

“Okay now let’s think about this, what does it all mean? Okay you pissed off a some girl, and time freezes.” He says, “Yeah and then she yells at me about how men objectify women because of how they look.” You say, “And then she starts babbling something then you turn into a girl and all the guys are staring at you.” He says, “And then I wake up normal, but when I go to the kitchen I’m a girl again.” You say, “So what did happen because you left the room?” he asks, “Well I know I changed after I left, but then when I came back I changed again, but now I’m in my room and a girl.” You say

The two of you pace for a moment to think about everything, “Wait, I’ve got it!” Joey says, “What?” you ask, “Let me try something.” He says as he walks out of the room and closes the door. Suddenly you look down and you are back to normal, “Did it work?” he asks from the other side of the door, “Yeah it did what did you do?” you ask, “I left the room.” He says walking back in causing you to turn back into a girl. “Oh come on!” you exclaim, “Sorry about that, but I think I figured out the problem here” he says, “So what being around other people turns me into a girl?” you say jokingly. “Well not exactly, I’m pretty sure it’s just men.” He says. “Why do you say that?” you ask, “Well think about your dream... I mean memory I guess, you said every guy in the room was staring at you. So it looks like being around guys makes you turn.” He says

You pause for a moment to let it all sink in; whenever you’re around a guy you’re going to turn into something pretty for him to look at. You can’t go out into public like this, and what about work, you can’t even walk around your apartment.

(What are you going to do now?)

Suddenly you hear your cell phone ring, you walk over to your night stand but as you reach down you see your now feminine manicured hands, you look to see that it is your friend Nick from work, “Hey Joey mind stepping outside so I can talk in my real voice?” you ask, but he doesn’t respond, he seemed to be staring at you, “HEY?!” you exclaim, “What, what?” he says, “Go outside so I can talk.” You say, “Oh okay.” He says as he leaves the room, though still looking over his shoulder at you smiling.

As the door shuts you return to your male form, “Ah much better.” You say as you answer the phone. “Hello?” you say, “Hey man, its Nick, how you feeling?” he asks, “All good man, how about you?” you ask, “I’m great man, we were just worried about you, I mean after drinking that much and then disappearing like.” He says, “Oh no.” you think to yourself, it really wasn’t a dream, “Yeah don’t worry man I’m fine, I guess I lost y’all and just decided to head home.” You say, “Ah that’s good, well thanks for coming out with us last night, I haven’t had that much fun in a long time” He says, “Anytime man, what are friends for?” you say, “Thanks man, hey do you have those reports, I need them to finish my analysis.” He says, “Yeah I’ve got them right here.” you say.

Nick then walks back into the room, turning you back into girl. “Ah hey how about a little warning when you do that.” You say stretching to adjust to your new proportions. You then go through your closet to find something to wear and wondering what kind of clothes will what you pick turn into.

111111111111.content:
"You haven't taken a sick day yet. You've got like seven of them. You could use them." Joey says.
"Defiantly an option." you reply. "Although I did want to save them in case something serious happened."
Joey gives you a strange look, not knowing if you're joking or not. You think about it for a second and realize you don't even know if you're joking. You try and throw off the awkward stare by laughing. Joey laughs too, although you're convinced it is out of politeness.

"Okay, I might be able to make this work." you think out loud. "I work in a busy office building, and have to walk past a female secretary. If the curse only works when guys are around, I can pass her as Will and she can back up that I'm at work."
"And what if one of your co-workers walks by?" Joey asks.
"I tell them I'm Clair, the new intern, and was asked to help Will." you explain.
"And what if your boss hears about this?"
"It's not a perfect plan. -- Maybe I can walk in the office, and sneak out. My car will be parked underground, so the cameras will show it's there. With the secretaries help, I might be able to pull off getting paid."
"And going to work looking like you do now might just get you laid." Joey says.
You punch Joey in his arm. It hurts you more than him.
"I couldn't resist." Joey says, rubbing bicep.
"And if you can't resist that image in your head, imagine people who don't know my condition would think." you say.
"Do we know how the curse works in cubicles? Would you be a guy if no one is looking at you in there?"
"I changed in the car. But there were windows, other drivers were obviously eying me. But it was an enclosed space."
"Okay, I'm going to try something." Joey says, as he turns around and closes his eyes.
"What are you doing?" you ask.
"I'm not paying attention to you. Are you a dude again?"
You can still feel your hair coming down to your shoulders, the weight on your chest, and a bit of a draft from your skirt.
"Still a chick." you say disappointed.
"So no guy can be looking at you, and you need to be in an enclosed space for the curse to stop." Joey concludes.
"Very good Sherlock." you say.
"Cubicles aren't an enclosed space." Joey explains to you in an insultingly slow tone.
You look down at yourself, despite minor changes, the clothes you have on now look an awful lot like they did at Nick's place, very sexy-librarianesque. Well, at least the clothes are somewhat consistent when you change into other girls.

You catch Joey looking at you looking at yourself. "Stop it." you say as you snap your fingers in front of his face.
"Sorry." Joey says.
You want to be angry at him, but part of your knows this isn't his fault. You've become the perfect female figure for him. If a girl you thought looked perfect sat beside you, you'd probably stare as well.
"So what happens when a girl sees you transformed? Does she just see a dude? Does she know you've changed?" Joey asks.
You think about it and realize that you haven't talked to a girl today.
"I don't know." you say.
111111111111.title: Establishing Rules and Options

choices: She sees you as a red-headed woman.
1111111111111.content:
"Okay, it's Sunday, work is tomorrow, where are we going to find a lot of women?" Joey says.
"The mall." you say with a sigh.
"Let's go SHOPPING!" Joey says in an over the top voice.
"I HATE you." you say in a droll tone. Joey is having fun at what a cliche this could be. But still, the mall is a safe place and there are lots of women there to test the limits of your condition on.

You grab your purse, feeling incredibly femmie as you do, and walk down to the parking lot to hop into the car. But before you can shut the door, Joey steps behind you.
"What do you think you're doing?" he asks.
"What, are you sexist against female drivers?" you ask.
"I'm against people not covered under the insurance of the car driving it." he says.
"But I am covered!" you tell him.
"Show me your license." he says, and you reluctantly hand it over.
"This isn't a picture of you." he continues.
"What do you mean?" you ask as he hands over the license.

Then you see it. This is your old license, for a man named Will. Not one for whoever you look like now.
"Can you imagine what would happen if a cop pulled you over?" he asks.
"It might be a female cop." you respond.
"Or it might be a male one, and what do you think he's going to want in return for not reporting this?" he tells.
You hang your head in defeat and shudder. A lot of grotesque images of overweight prudes in their 50's enters your head.
"I'm driving." Joey says as you get out and hand him the keys.

You're silent most of the drive down. You look at your reflection in the side-view mirror as it rapidly alters itself as the cars go by. Joey doesn't seem to notice. The parking lot seems half full as you drive up to the mall.

"Can you let me off here?" you ask politely. You feel like less of a man for asking it, because your voice lets out a little coo with the request, and you can tell there is no way that Joey can refuse you.
"Where do you want to meet? he asks.
"I'll just be waiting inside."
You get out of the car. (Your heels weren't that long, but you didn't want to walk a long way in them.)
You look around and see there there is no one directly in your line of vision, and vice versa.
The wind blows and you can tell your still female, but as Joey turns the car around the corner, you feel the sudden change come on, and you look down, you're a man again!

It looks like if you're 100 yards away from someone, they can't cause the curse to change you.

It doesn't last long though, as you open the door to the mall, you immediately run into a guy, and feel yourself shrink. You must be about five feet tall, with raven dark hair falling all the way to your waste. The weight of the hair forces your head to tilt up and see a six foot tall man in front of you.


You can feel him eying you, but surprisingly, his gaze stops at your finger. Your ring finger.
Excuse me miss, after you." he says in a gentlemanly voice as he holds the door open for you.
You can feel the blood rush to your face. Your not sure if you're blushing, or it's just because of the transformation.
"Thanks." you say meekly as you quickly walk inside and head towards the desk.

You can feel yourself altering again as the man shuts the door and walks outside. But you're not a man.
You see your reflection in one of the store windows. You're about five and a half feet now, sporting short red hair and freckles. Your skin is almost snow white, and you're much curvier than before.

"Who did this to me?" you think in both exhaustion and horror, and as if fate were reading your thoughts, a man walks up behind you.
"Excuse me, miss." he says.
""Hi." you say nervously.
"I couldn't help but see you there and think to myself what a pity it is for a woman such as you to be alone. Would you mind my company while we wait?"
"Who talks like that?" you think to yourself. "I'm already waiting for someone." you tell him firmly.
"Ah, well, yes...okay, understandable." he says as he tries to maintain his composure.
He starts licking his lips.
"Well, if you're interested later, her is my number." he says pulling a card out of his pocket.
"Thanks, but I don't really..."
"Please take it." he insists. You slowly put the card in your purse and walk away.

Slowly, you start to distance yourself from this guy. Some sort of intuition is telling you to leave, now.
You walk past a grocery store, some women are looking at you, you don't feel yourself changes by their presence. But you still can't figure out if they see you as a guy or a busty red-headed chick.

You duck into a woman's clothing store, knowing that the guy will have no reason to follow you here.
"Hi mam, how may I help you?" the 20 year old sales lady asks you.
"I'm just browsing." you say, touching the sleeve of some designer coat you never heard of.

"She called me mam. She sees me as a woman" you think. But this store has a glass front and an open door. You're pretty sure the creepy guy with the card is still peeping at you from somewhere.

You grab a blouse. Is there a place I can try this? you ask, just trying to get out of the strangers line of sight.
"We have a change area at the back." She answers.
You quickly walk towards that back of the store and duck between some swinging doors.
For a second, you are unseen by anyone, but suddenly there is another woman in there, who just walked out of one of the change booths.
1111111111111.title: To The Mall

11111111111111.content:
The lady screams as she drops her items and points at you.
"I'm sorry." you say in your noticeably masculine voice.
You squeeze through the swinging doors and find yourself back in the store with the sales lady and one older woman looking at you.
"I'm sorry, honest mistake." you tell the sales lady.
"Who are you?" asks the sales lady.
"Sorry about everything, I have to go." you say panicked.
"Sir, I'm going to ask you to stand at the back here as I call for security."
"Really, that won't be necessary." you assure her, you walk out of the store.
You feel panicked, as you make your way out of the store and immediately change.
You see your reflection in the store window that you're that red-headed lady again. "Crap, that guy was waiting for me." you think.
You quickly push the blouse into your transformed wallet, as you feel the eyes of the mall look at you.
You look around, and see there the nearest guy you can spot is just over 50 yards away. You can't spot the one that gave you his card, but you're sure he's there.
There are many woman and children, but the you notice that the little boy pointing at you hasn't caused you to change. Maybe the curse is only effected by men who have gone through puberty. Thank goodness for the little things.
You look at the store as the sales lady comes out. "Did you see a guy run out here?" she asks you.
"Yes he went that way." you point in a random direction.
She goes inside and gets back on her phone. "Security to store 23. Security to store 23." you here her say.

You start walking away from the chaos, as two guards jog towards the store, causing you to temporarily change as they go past.
You walk past fashion store windows, looking at your reflection in them, noticing that you haven't changed yet. Were men really so hard to find at the mall? Or is that one guy stalking you?

After about a minute of walking without changing, you feel a bit scared.
"Screw it." you think as you follow another woman towards the bathroom. She opens the door to let you in with her.
"Thanks." you say as it closes behind you.
11111111111111.title: You're a man again!

111111111111111.content:
"Crazy stuff." the woman says as she walks over to the mirror.
"Yes, totally." you say, kind of surprised you haven't changed.
The woman looks at her reflection as she applies some lipstick.
"Is this your first time in the mall when a robbery went down?" she asks.
"Yes, kind of exciting you say as you open up a stall door and slip inside it.
You look down at the disgusting toilet seat, with piss stains everywhere. "Weren't women supposed to have cleaner toilets?" you think, as you shut the door.
But to your amazement, as you shut the stall door, you revert back to being male, and the purse around your shoulder reverts to a wallet that falls onto the floor.
The woman keeps talking to you as you grab a bunch of toilet paper and place it on the seat. Although you can now piss standing up, you're afraid she'll know by the sound that something is off.
She tries talking to you as you artificially heighten your voice as you pee. You stick with two word answers. She asks if you'll be alright, and you tell her you're going to be a while.
"Poor thing. I know that feel." she says as she leaves.
You don't even bother to wash your hands, you just pick up your wallet (leaving the blouse that encompassed it,) as you head out.

As you make it back to the main part of the mall, almost become relieved as you morph back into that strange girl you woke up as.
"Joey!" you say upon seeing him.
As Joey is about to respond, you see your reflection start to change again. You now have a noticeable tint of red in your hair. Your skin looks more pale too. Of course Joey doesn't notice the change.
"Let's leave." you tell Joey.
"But I just got here." Joey complains.
"Now!" you tell him sternly, as you see that creepy guy out of the corner of your eye.
"Fine." Joey says in defeat.
"Hold my hand." you tell Joey.
Joey looks at you like he thinks this is as set up for some prank.
"Dammit, hold it and look like you're enjoying it." you tell him with your phoney smile.
Joey doesn't need to be told again, he takes your right hand, and you take his left as you walk towards out of the mall.
On exiting, you look exactly like the girl you woke up as, the red tint is gone, and you feel safe, knowing that the guy stopped following you.
"You can stop holding my hand now." you tell Joey. Joey ignores you.
"You can stop holding my hand." you say again. as you look down at your interlocking fingers. You wish you didn't look that way. You can see a not so subtle bulge coming from around his waist.
"Ew." you think.
"Sorry. My mind was elsewhere." he replies, as he lets go.
As you approach the parked car, Joey walks ahead and opens the passenger door for you.
"You don't have to do that." you tell him.
"Right, sorry, I wasn't thinking."
"Chivalry is dead, and appearances aside, kind of gay in this situation."
Joey shuts the door and drives out of the parking lot.
You start changing again as passing drivers look at you.
"So did you find what you wanted to know?" he asks.
"Yes. Woman can't change me. But if they see me as a girl, they'll keep seeing me that way until I'm out of site in some sort of enclosed space. If that happens, I'm a dude again.
"What happens if one sees you change?" he asks.
"I'm not entirely sure, I think one girl noticed, but either didn't believe what she saw, or maybe she didn't see me change. No one looked shocked at the mall, like they saw something supernatural."
"Learn anything else?" he asks.
"I don't think boys can effect the change, only men."
"That's probably for the best."
"Probably." you say.
"Otherwise, you might end up looking like some cartoon character."
"We can stop talking now." you respond.
111111111111111.title: You're still female!

1111111111111111.content:
You get out of the car, and walk up to the apartment. On your way up, you pass Ben, who gives you a quick wink, and makes sure his hand brushes yours as he passes you. "With all that happened, I almost forgot about him." you think.
Joey unlocks the door, and lets you go in first. You immediately, go into your room, and close the door behind you.
Your male form returns, along with the clothes you put on before you went out and met Nick. "It's so good to be me again." you think, as you look at a mirror.

You lay down in your bed, and change into some less businesslike attire. A grey shirt, and baggy black pants, held up by a belt. The lazy man's fashion. "If they get altered, they shouldn't turn into anything too sexy." you say to yourself.

The next step is to think of ways to try and find that woman who did this to you. Or at least figure out what she did to you, and how to reverse it. Preferably before you need to go into work tomorrow.

You figure that finding one answer will probably get you a lead on the other, so you take out a laptop, and open a search engine.
You type a number of searches:
Goth chick spells
Eye candy curse
TG curses
Local Goth hangouts
I was once a man

Ah the internet, one of humanities greatest achievements. Almost everything you searched lead you to soft-core porn, or pages trying to sell you soft-core porn. For a second, you almost think about getting your mind off your situation by looking at porn, but you keep looking at the door, thinking how odd it would be if Joey walked in on you while you were occupied with it. Also, you want to get as much research done today so that you'll have more options tomorrow.

After about two hours of searching, you're about to give up. All that's out there on the subject is lousy fan fiction, and porn.
You figure you'll give it one last try before you find something else to do.
1111111111111111.title: Back at your place

11111111111111111.content:
Finally, just before you feel like giving in and calling it a day, your eyes comes across a link to something that translates to 'eye-candy enchantment.' Judging by the pictures on the page, this looks like it could be helpful. You see an illustrated picture of a girl playing the tambourine, and an arrow that points to a completely different looking girl in the same pose, also playing a tambourine. As you scroll down the page, there is a drawing of a guy in some traditional dancing uniform and a tambourine, with an arrow pointing to another picture of the girl from the first illustration.

You immediately click the translate button. The text translates to English, and you are treated to this description:

Origin:
The eye-candy enchantment has been traced back to the Menhitians tribes in Guatemala. It was cast on young women as a right of passage, so that they were better able to attain their desired husbands. The practice was started after refusal of one chief's ugliest daughters as a gift by the rival tribes son almost caused a war. Thinking that it was her looks that caused him to reject her, she ran to her local <untranslatable> to make her look more appealing. The spell succeeded, and the Prince immediately took her hand in union. It was said that the prince couldn't refuse her, and that her advise led to the golden age of her two tribes.
It's original name long since forgotten, the description 'eye-candy enchantment' was associated with the spell after researchers started looking up information on the Menhitians in the late 70's.

Effects:
The enchantment instantly allowed the woman to look like the ideal mate to the eye of whoever gazed upon her. At first, it seemed as thought it was only an illusion, since the woman didn't seem to look at any different after the spell to any one man. It was only after their deaths that the women's daughters admitted that their mothers told them that they shifted into a new form whenever a different man looked their way.

The End of the Practice:
A few problems arose with the curse, the women who had it would almost always produce daughters. There were rumors that once hitting puberty, their sons would occasionally switch gender. Some of the daughters would be altered to look like the ideal woman for the first male to have a crush on them, and stay that way.

The practice was finally ended by the Menhitians when a chief's <untranslatable> son cheated on his lovers, and they paid the <untranslatable> to put the enchantment on him. This caused the proud chief to now have a daughter, and in anger, he ordered all <untranslatable> executed.


There is some more trivial stuff put after that, but there is no source on the information, for all you know whoever posted this was just making it up. However, you can't help but feel that it's too similar to your situation to be fake. There is no mention of a cure. And nowhere is the word 'curse' mentioned. More importantly, you don't see the word 'cure' pop up at all either. There is a little link to the person's email at the bottom, but before you start to write it, you realize that you don't actually know if he/she can read English. If you send a letter in a foreign language, they might just block your account, thinking it's junk mail, and you'll lose the best lead you've gotten so far.

You bookmark the page for later.

Feeling pleased with yourself, you decide that it's time to get something to eat. You brace for the transformation to take effect as you open the door.
11111111111111111.title: You found something!

choices: Tell him that you have an idea to make it work.
Tell him you'll call in sick.
111111111111111111.content:
You walk out of the bedroom and immediately feel the sudden shift of your clothes. Your socks have turned into nylon stockings, but you barely notice them, since your baggy pants are now a long, flowing, (but heavy,) skirt, that seems to show off your ass. Not that anyone would pay attention to what's below your chest, since you're apparently wearing a bra that makes your boobs look two times bigger under your tight grey shirt. Which has now transformed into a blouse, showing just the tip of your cleavage to allow them to breathe.

You can't find a reflection to see your face, but judging the length of your hair, you assume you look the exact same as you did when you first changed in the morning morning.

Joey is already cooking noodles for dinner, which now make up more than two thirds of your diet.
"We're richer than this." you say.
"Well one of us needs to learn how to cook." he answers.
"It should be the one who is barely working."
"It should be the one with the tits."
"Fine. Here's a knuckle sandwich." you say punching him in the arm.
Here barely flinches, it obviously hurt you more than him, you don't show it though. You don't want him to start thinking of you as frail. Plus you are kind of mad at him for suggesting that, mainly because if it wasn't for your current condition, you might also agree that the woman should make the meals.

"Did you find anything online?" Joey asks.
"Yes. I found something, but it's not much of a lead. A small website says this curse I have, wasn't always considered a curse. Girls got the enchantment put on them to help them get men."
"Ya, you wouldn't find any problems getting a man looking like that." he says.
"Long story short, almost anyone who knows anything about it got wiped out about 500 years ago." you say, trying to ignore his last words.
"That might be a problem."
"Thank you Doctor Obvious." you reply sarcastically.
Joey finishes making the noodles.
"Do you still have your pass to the university library?" you ask him.
"Sure, all alumni get to use the library."
"I need you to look up the Menhitians."
"The who?"
"They were small Guatemalan tribes. Apparently they started this curse." you explain.
"And what's in it for me if I go and do this for you?" he asks.
"A roommate who won't act like she's having cramps for the next week." you tell him.
Joey looks at you like he's expecting something more.
"It'll give you an excuse not to look for work." you tell him in a deadpan manner as he hands you some noodles.
"Fine." he says. "The things I'll do for a pretty face."
"I'm not afraid to hit you." you say.

You both sit down and watch bad TV sitcoms.
"So what are you going to do about work tomorrow?" he asks.
111111111111111111.title: Dinner and a conversation

1111111111111111111.content:
"I think I have an idea to make it work." you tell him.
"Really?"
"Okay, the first part of the plan is like I told you, I wait until the lobby is clear, then I walk past the secretary, and head towards my cubicle. But here is where I make it work. I email the boss tonight, tell him that since we're short handed because of Mr. Donald's trip to China, I'm going to bring in an intern to help us out tomorrow, and he can just call me in the morning if she can't come."
"Is that your entire plan?" Joey asks.
"Well, Mr. Donald had a fancy corner office, it has inside windows, but the blinds on them close. If I need to change quickly, I jump in there. It hasn't been used for a week."
"It still sounds risky. So many things could go wrong. What if the boss wants to see you and the new intern together?"
"It's a bit risky sure, but this is an important week, I need to help Nick with the presentation, and there is a huge potential for bonuses and promotions if we pull this off."
"You really want to be around Nick in your condition?" Joey asks.
"No. But I do want to pay the rent. Meanwhile, you'll be looking for the cure, or the girl who did this to me." you say.
Joey stops and thinks about it for a second.
"Okay." he says.
"Really, you're with me on this?" you ask.
"Realistically, I cant find a good job right now. And I honestly don't have a better plan."
"So you're going to help?"
"Sure, I mean if I fail in this it's no big deal. You're the one who will be walking into the wolves den. It's your ass on the line. Plus I know you'd do the same for me." he says, and you catch him looking at your ass.
"Eyes up here." you say, putting your finger in his line of sight, in a pointing upward position.
"Sorry mam...Man." he says.
You just sigh. "I'm going to write that letter to my boss." you tell him, as you finish your noodles, and walk towards your room.
1111111111111111111.title: The Plan

choices: Your plan works and you make it in.
11111111111111111111.content:
You wake up at 7am to the sound of your cell phone ringing.
"Hello." you say in a drowsy voice.
"Will. I got your message this morning." says the voice on the other end.
"Good." you say, trying to make your voice sound even more tired and muffled than it actually is. This way, if the boss rejects the intern plan, you might be able to convince him you're sick.
"Will, I don't know if we can afford to introduce a new intern this week. We've got three major projects, and I don't want training a new person to slow any of our people down."
"She's a really fast learner, sir." you say.
"Would you vouch for her?" he asks.
"Sir, she won't do a thing in that office unless I tell her to."
"Fine, she's your responsibility." he says.
"Thank you sir."
"One more thing, this girl had better be everything you claimed in this letter." he says.
"I'm sure she'll be everything we want her to be." you tell him.
"I'm holding you to that will." he says as he hangs up.

You sit up and look at yourself in the mirror. Your posture is awful, and despite being in alright shape, you can see the early signs of a pot belly. You shake your stomach, it doesn't jiggle much, maybe this whole curse has just got you becoming paranoid about your actual looks.

You look down at the clothes on the floor of your room. "Screw it, I'll just wear my casual business suit again." you think, holding up the clothes that you drove to Nick's in.

You quickly get dressed and walk out of your room, fully expecting to change. Nope, you're safe, Joey isn't awake yet. You quickly make some coffee and drink it down with a bowl of cereal. Ah, the bachelor's life.
You get into your car, and immediately start to change as you pull out into traffic. You're starting to get used to the constant morphing, and are feeling less and less inclined to look at yourself in the rear-view mirror.

You finally make it to your building, and punch in your employee code on the keypad to open up the underground garage door and let you in. Parking in your regular spot, you get outside of the car, and realize that you've been male ever since you've entered the underground garage. It's about a five minute walk to the elevator, and you hope to get there before someone else shows up.
Suddenly a sports car speeds up the ramp and you feel yourself immediately change. It double parks near the elevator, and Greg, the asshole accountant jumps out.
He's about to run towards the elevator, when he hears your heels clicking across the pavement.
"Oh Crap!" you think as he spots you. You don't even want to know what you look like, but your breasts look like they're at least a size C.
You have golden locks flowing to your shoulders, and even your lips feel plumper than usual. "How much of a whore do I look like?" you think to yourself.
You keep walking, but Greg doesn't budge, he just holds the elevator open, waiting for you to come in.
"I'll take the next one." you yell as you walk closer.
"I wouldn't have it. Parking garages can be dangerous for girls. I couldn't have you in danger if I can help it." Greg replies in a sleazy manner.
You walk up to the parking elevator and he lets you in.
"Thanks." you say, trying to be polite.
"Do you work here?"" he asks.
"It's my first day."
"Oh, if you get a chance, I can show you around."
"Oh, it's okay. I've already know some guys here."
"But you said it was your first day?" he inquires.
"I know them from outside of work." you reply matter-of-factly.
Greg stops the questioning, he knows he screwed up a making a good first impression.
"So what floor are you going to?" he asks.
"Floor 11." you say.
"Oh, what a coincidence, me too." he lies.
"I meant floor 13." you reply.
"Oh." he says as he gets off on his floor.
The doors shut, and you return to your original form.
You get out on your floor, and see the door to your office shut as someone walks in.
"Okay, I need to time this right." you think as you approach the door.
"I'm 15 minutes early. Janice the secretary arrives 30 minutes early. Most other people don't arrive until 10 minutes before the day officially starts. If you walk in now, you'd probably have 4 minutes to chat with her and go to your cubicle. But why did that door just close? Is someone else here early?

If you want to pull off your plan, you need to pass through those doors in the next two minutes.
You take a breath and are about to open the door.
11111111111111111111.title: Getting To Work

111111111111111111111.content:
You open the door, and brace for the worst, but feel that you haven't changed. A quick look at yourself confirms this and you head over to Janice's desk to make yourself as visible as possible.
"Hello Janice." you say.
"Hi Will. My, you're early today." she responds in a somewhat nasally voice.

Janice has been here longer than the boss, and is in her late 40's. She knows how things get done around the place, and if she says she saw you, no one will question her.

"I'm trying to get a head start on some work." you tell her.
"Oh, yes. The three projects everyone is focusing on this week." she says.
"Oh Janice, I'm expecting a new intern today, if you see her, just send her to my cubicle, one of the guys can show her where it is."
"A new intern, of this week of all weeks? Did the boss sign off on it?"
You want to have a more casual conversation, but through the door, you can hear footsteps coming down the hall. It's still a bit early, but you can't take the chance they'll open the door.
"Yes, I told the boss this weekend, anyways, I've got a busy day, I'm going to start all my stuff." you say, rushing through the lobby doors and into the cubicle space, your heart rapidly beating.
"Have a good day." Janice manages to say as you shut the door.

As you enter the cubicle area, you notice that you're still a man. You look over some of the cubicles, and see the tops of some hair covered scalps popping out of them. But no one is looking in your direction. "Maybe the curse isn't triggered unless they know I'm here." you think to yourself. You head towards your cubicle, figuring that it'll be better to walk there in your current shoes instead of the heels you'll be wearing if any guy sees you.

Just before you sit down, you look at the office across from you. Mr. Donald's office has its inside blinds down. So far, so good, you should be able to jump in and out of there with almost no one seeing you. You go to try and open the door...and it's locked.
"Crap." you think. Only three people could possible have the key, Janice, the janitor, or your boss.

This day just got a little more complicated.

You hear footsteps coming and immediately duck into your cubicle and turn on the computer. Then it hits you that it doesn't matter what you do, the second someone passes you, they won't see Will, they'll see a gorgeous woman helping William set up.

The footsteps stop behind you and you try and prepare yourself for the change.
"Hi Will." says a voice.
"Hi." you say in a high pitched voice. You cough again, and say it in a lower tone. "Sorry, my voice just cracked." you say, coughing.

The woman in front of you is Beth. She was one on your rivals here about two years ago, but you've since outperformed her on every occasion. She's become more submissive in the workplace since. In fact, you're not entirely sure why the boss still keeps her around.

"Working on the the Denver Project?" she says.
"As much as I can." you reply, your voice hinting that she's interrupting you.
"Alright, have fun." she says, taking the hint. You have a feeling she's been trying to angle a workplace fling with you or one of the other guys here, but the truth is, no one really finds her that attractive. And most workplace romances you've heard of end in disaster.

About ten minutes go by, and the workplace starts to fill up with staff, who fill up the office and surrounding cubicles. Oddly enough, you haven't transformed yet. Maybe if you keep your head down, you can get through this week without turning it into a convoluted mess.
111111111111111111111.title: Starting The Day At The Office

1111111111111111111111.content:
The phone on your desk rings. You look at it and the number on the display matches the bosses office.
"Hello, sir." you say, you follow that by leaning over and giving a fake cough.
"Will. I want to see you in my office." he says.
"Is this about the intern?" you ask.
"Of course it's about the intern." you tell him.
"Can I just send her over sir? I'm currently on the line with an important client." you say.
"This regarding the Denver Project?" he asks.
"Yes sir."
There is a quick moment of silence.
"Fine, send her over. I'll check on your work later." he says.
"Thank you sir, she'll be down in a minute." you say.
You hang up your phone, then pick it up again and leave it off the hook. This way the line from your cubicle will seem busy on the computers, and if anyone walks by, they'll think you've just left for a second.

You take a deep breath, and pull a non-disclosure agreement out of the desk, you sign Clair's name and then sign your own as the witness.

You get up, and walk towards the other end of the office, once outside the cubicle, your body instantly changes. You're wearing inch-high heels, knee-high grey socks, a skirt that almost comes down to your knees, and a white blouse that it more than a little revealing. You weren't wearing these when you were at Nick's. But then again, maybe you accidentally grabbed a different pair of clothes.

Your hair, skin color, and body size are all rapidly morphing, as the collective desires of every guy in the office are competing to be represented on you. The sizes changes almost cause you to trip once or twice over your heels. But you go right back to maintaining your composure as you walk towards the bosses office.

You knock on the door, and wait for a few seconds for him to respond. Those seconds feel like an eternity. You can feel the eyes of every male employee looking at your ass. "Come in." your boss finally says.

"Hi Mr. Gardner." you say sheepishly.
"Please, call me Jerry. Oh, and shut the door." he tells you.
"Yes sir." you say as you quietly shut the door.
The moment you do, you morph again. Your breasts inflate, your hair lengthens out to around your years, and you notice that you're about a foot and a half smaller than Jerry. You quickly look at your hair, it looks brown. Jerry likes Brunettes, that's useful to know in the future.
"So you're Clair. The intern that William was talking about." he says.
"Yes sir." you say in a soft voice. You're playing it passive, because you know that Jerry doesn't like any competition to his authority, and if you screw up here, you will be paying for it for a while, even after (and if) you get rid of this curse.
"William wrote me last night saying that you attended the same classes he did in University."
"That's correct sir."
"So why haven't you applied for a job sooner?" he asks.
A moment passes, and you try desperately to think of a lie that would justify your absents from this profession.
"My father was ill for a long time, after my mother died, I had to take care of him until he passed away." you say, pretending to hold back from crying. You recompose yourself. "After that, I did some sole searching, and traveled the world for a year."
"So you no longer have family obligations?" he asks.
"I have some cousins, and a sister I never hear from." you lie.
"No boyfriend, or husband, or kids, that sort of thing." he asks.
"I'm not sure if you're allowed to ask those questions." you say, but at the same time, you lift your left hand so that he can clearly see there is nothing on your ring-finger.
"Of course. It's going to be a busy week, we can't have people abandoning us now. There are a lot of presentations that we need finished."
"Yes sir. Understandable, sir."
"Call me Jerry. -- So William is showing you around?" he asks.
"Yes Sir...uh...I mean Jerry. He was on a call when he sent me here. But he made me sign this before he came in today." you say, handing him the non-disclosure agreement.
"Good, nice to see he knows the basics in covering his ass." Jerry says, taking the paper. "So how long are you planning to stay here?"
"I was thinking we'd try for a week, then if you guys liked me...I mean, like my work, I could try for longer."
The boss thinks about it for a second.
"Okay." he says with a smile. You can tell he was jokingly trying to make you think he might say no. But you knew better.
"Thank you Jerry." you tell him.
"So you know William, he'll get you caught up on what he's doing. Prove you're an asset, and maybe you can intern for one of the bigger boys." he says in a voice that comes off with just a hint of lust.
"Thank you Jerry." you say as you leave the office.

You sigh again. So far your plan is working out alright, but you can't shake the feeling that something is going to blow up in your face. As you close the boss' door, you sense the eyes of all your co-workers staring at you. You try and brush it off as your imagination, but you can't as their competing desires cause you to change shape and color, over an over, until you manage to quickly duck into an unoccupied office and shut the door. You shut it and quickly convert to male.

You wait a minute, silently open the door, then crouch beside the cubicle walls as you make your way back to the cubicle. You take one last look at the locked office across from you. "This is going to be a long week." you tell yourself.
1111111111111111111111.title: The Boss calls you

choices: The Rest of the work day is unremarkable
11111111111111111111111.content:
Somehow, despite all odds, you manage to get some work done by the time Lunch finally rolls around, three hours later.
Knowing the crap you'll endure, you almost decide to skip lunch, but a rumbling in your stomach won't let you. You look in your desk, and realize that you didn't pack a lunch today. With another defeated sigh, you get up and walk towards the restaurant as your wallet instantly becomes a purse. (And you hate the feeling of carrying a purse around, it just feels wrong.)

The restaurant is on the main floor of the building, and a trio of men are kind enough to hold the elevator door open as you walk towards it. Funny how they never did that when you were a guy. You ask them to press the button for the main floor and they instantly obey.
The elevator is hot, and you feel like a lamb surrounded by wolves. Although you try not to make any eye contact with them, you can just feel them scanning every inch of you over, although you're not even sure that they're aware they're doing it.

You get out, and your heels click across the marble lobby until you reach the restaurant. "Egg salad sandwich." you say to the guy at the counter. Three minutes later, he brings it to you on a cool plate. "Enjoy." he winks.

Looking at the clock, you realize you still have 20 minutes left, so you sit down to better hide your frame as you eat. Picking a corner of the place were it'll be harder to see you, and sit down at a table for two.
You're eating your sandwich slower than usual. Your note sure if it's because you're female, or if you've got more on your mind to ponder about than usual.

"Can I sit here?" some guy you've never seen before says.
You look in the window's reflection, you look the same as you did when you entered the lobby, there must be no new eyes on you. You then look around the restaurant and see that all the other seats are taken. It's probably a legitimate request to sit down.
"Sure." you say, trying to sound like you brushed off the question.
"Thanks. My name is Darrel." says the guy as he sits down across from you.
"Clair." you say after finishing a bite of your sandwich.
"You're new here." he says.
"First day." you tell him, trying to focus on eating your sandwich.
"I've only been here a month myself." Darrel says.
For some reason, this causes you to stop and examine Darrel. He looks like he's 20. You probably look like you're a teenage to him.
"I can give you some tips on working here." he says.
"It's okay, I think I'll be fine."
"Okay, sure." Darrel says, as he finally starts to eat from his tiny bowl of soup.
You feel Darrel's feet start to rub against yours, but as soon as they start, they stop.
"It was probably an accident. This is a small table. There's not much room under here." you think.
"So what department are you working in?" he asks.
"I'm interning. I'm not going to be here long. I'm interning in Promotions." you say.
"I wanted to do Promotions, but my uncle made me go into accounting." Darrel says.
"Your uncle got you this job?"
"My Uncle Thomas."
You rack your head for a bit, thinking where you've heard the name Thomas before...then it hits you, Thomas is Nick's boss.
"Well, they seem a bit short staffed in Promotions. Maybe after I leave, you can join there."
"Maybe." Darrel says as he finishes up his soup.

You both silently end your lunch and walk your separate ways.
11111111111111111111111.title: Lunch Time

111111111111111111111111.content:
All things considered, the rest of your work day is pretty unremarkable. It follows a cycle of getting some work done, co-worker hits on you, getting some more work done, another co-worker hits on you. You've somehow managed to convince everyone that you were there all day as Will and as Clair.

You decide to stay a bit later, after most the guys left for home. This makes you look like you're working harder, and gives you the added benefit of being less likely to run into them in the underground parking.

As you leave the cubicle area, even Janice is gone. You shut the door, and stretch your limbs again as a man. It feels good to be out of those heels. But as you enter the hallway, you feel your feminine frame come back as your skin turns darker, and your long wavy hair suddenly appears. You're a bit plump, and curvier than usual.

"Hey Senorita." the Janitor says. "You new here?"
"Yes." you say walking up to him. "I'm Clair."
"Nice to meet you Clair. I'm Eugene." he says as his giant hands shake yours, then slowly pull away.
"You're just the man I wanted to see." you tell him.
"I am?!" he says in mock surprise.
"Yes, I need you to open Mr. Donald's office. There is a paper on his desk I need for my boss."
"Well, I probably shouldn't." he says.
"Please. It'll only take a second." you plead.
"Well, okay. I can not say no to a such a nice chicka."

He takes you to the office, and opens it for you. You walk in, grab a random paper on the desk, and close the door behind you.
"Found it." you say happily.
"That's nice."
"My boss will be so pleased." you say, trying to distract him so that maybe he'll forget to lock the corner office.
"Yes, it's a nice paper." he says.
"You want to see where my boss works?" you say cheerfully.
Eugene obviously doesn't, but you can tell by his mannerisms that he wants to stare at you some more, so he follows you away from the door.
"It's here!" you say trying to sound cheerful and excited.
"Senior Will." he says. "You work for senior William."
"Yes!"
"He's a good man." Eugene says, causing you to blush a bit.
"I like to think so." you respond in earnest.
You drop the paper next to your phone, and lead Eugene out of the cubicle area.
"Thank you SO much." you say, as you try to remember how girls sound when they're pretending to be authentic.
"Anytime chicka." Eugene says with a smile, before getting back to cleaning the floor.

You head to the escalator and revert back to your male state. You led a guy on. You totally led on a guy you had no interest in, just to get him to do something for you. You feel like you need a shower.
111111111111111111111111.title: Wrapping Up The Work Day

choices: No Rush, You Can Talk To Ben Later
1111111111111111111111111.content:
You park the car and go up the stairs, changing shapes twice as your neighbors pass you. You're starting to instinctively give out polite-but-nervous smiles as you pass them. You finally make it to your apartment, and open the doors to see Joey sitting down at the couch with a pile of books beside him.

"You actually went to the library." you say is disbelief.
"Don't act so surprised, babe." he says, emphasizing the last word.
You throw your purse at him. "Ouch." he says.
You then realize that the purse will turn into a wallet the second you go into your bedroom. Quickly taking back the purse, you head towards the door and change.
You realize you're a bit on edge, and you're taking it out on Joey. All this acting passive, and meek, and getting guys to do stuff for you is just so wrong and unnatural.
"I'm a man." you say as you look in the mirror. "I'm a confident, successful, heterosexual man." You stop right after saying this, realizing that your hands were in the position to try and straighten you now non-existent boobs.

Then it hit you, today is the first day you've been a woman longer than a man. You notice that even your walk is a bit off. "Okay, I can get through this." you tell yourself. You toss your work clothes aside and toss on a t-shirt and some cargo pants.
You prepare to go out and talk to Joey. There is always that rare chance that he might actually have found something useful.

"Hey Joey." you say, as you walk out of the room. Your T-Shirt instantly morphs into a tank-top. and your pants remain pants, but cling to you like a second pair of skin.
"So now you're being nice to me?" he asks.
"I'm sorry. You have no idea how hard it is to work as two people at once." you confess.
"I can imagine." he says.
"No, you can't." you correct him.
"Fine, I'll tell you what I've found, but you have to promise not to throw your purse at me anymore." he says.
"Fine." you say without hesitation.
"I've found next to nothing." Joey says.
"WHAT?!" you say, in surprise and disappointment. (If you had your purse, you'd so throw it at him right now.)
"Look, most of these books just say the same thing, Menhitians were a primitive tribal society with some strange superstitions, that were basically wiped out because of infighting and the Spanish Conquest.
"There's got to be more than that." you say.
"Well, I did pick up an old book on spells in the region."
"But..." you say.
"But, it's in Equantian."
"Equantian? Never heard of it."
"It's a rare language, not to much people speak it."
"So it's useless."
"Not necessarily."
"So you can translate it?"
"No, I couldn't translate it."
"Then quit being coy and tell me how it can help!" you say pissed off.
"Ben knows Equantian."
"Ben knows Equantian. How do you know that?"
"He told me before."
"Ben mentioned this useless skill before?"
"Hey, if it's so useless, I'll return the book."
"No, no, no!" you plead. You know he's joking, but you're scared.
"He mentioned it to me when he was chewing me out for not paying the rent a week ago. He came by today, saw the book, and when I told him I was doing research for you, he changed his tone, and asked me to tell you to come over to his place if you wanted to talk about it. He even stopped mentioning the rent."
"Well, I'm glad my condition makes your life easier." you say sarcastically.
He laughs. "Even when you look like THAT, there are still times you're SO Will."
"Shut up." you say, and he does.
"Fine anything else at all that could help me?" you ask.
"Nothing." he answers.
You both stare at each other for a bit, knowing what your next course of action is probably going to be.
"You have to talk to Ben." "I have to talk to Ben." you both say in unison.
1111111111111111111111111.title: Joeys Discovery

choices: Insists that he gets it done quicker.
11111111111111111111111111.content:
You grab the Equantian book, throw on some shoes and walk out the door.
As you get into the hallway, you're completely male again. A female from down the halls kindly waves at you as she takes in her groceries.
You think for a second what apartment number belongs to Ben. 1188, keeps playing in your mind. You figure that must be it, and head down towards the door.

The building is pretty quiet for a Monday. Occasionally you hear a radio or TV though the wall, but no one is in the hallways. Not that you're complaining, it's always good to walk as a man.
As you get to door 1188, you knock, hoping that you remembered Ben's number.
"Who is there?" he asks.
"It's Clair." you say, forcing your voice to go artificially high.
Suddenly without warning, you change. Ben must have been looking through the spyhole on his door. Your tennis shoes turn into heels which prop you up a bit after you shrink down. This, along with the change of muscle mass on your arm causes you to drop the book in the hallway.
Ben is greeted by your ass staring up at him as you're bending over trying to pick up book, while being weighed down even more by your expanded breasts.
"Here, let me get that for you." Ben says as he leans down and picks up the book.
"Thanks, I can be such a klutz." you say trying to laugh off what just happened.
Ben takes a second to respond, hes obviously looking at your rack. "Oh, hey, totally." Ben says snapping out of it.

"I was talking to Joey, and he told me you could help me read this book." you say innocently.
"The Equantrian book, ya. Is there a passage you want me to read?" he asks.
"I need you to look at a chapter for spells and blessings." you tell him.
Ben opens the book, and looks at the first few pages. "According to the index, the whole book is about spells." he says.
"I kind of need you to focus on one spell." you say.
"And that is?" he asks.
"The eye candy enchantment." you tell him.
"The Eye--Candy--Enchantment." he says.
"That's not a real name, that's a slang name university professors gave it. Basically, it's a spell that causes a woman to look perfect for any man." you say, forcing a smile.
"And someone cast it on you." Ben says.
"What, how did you figure it out." you think. But then you notice that Ben is smiling with welcoming eyes, the line is just a flirtation.
"Oh stop that." you say playfully. You feel like your stomach is full of butterflies. You're so nervous to where this is going.
"Tell you what, I'll browse over the book for you, and let you know in a few days if I've found something." he says.
"Not tonight?" you ask.
"Clair, I'm up to my neck in reports and papers tonight. I'll do it when I get a chance." he says.
11111111111111111111111111.title: Go and Talk to Ben

111111111111111111111111111.content:
"Thanks so much." you tell him.
"No problem, I'm always glad to help people in need." he says, trying to make himself look good to you.
"I just need it sooner rather than later." you tell him.
"How soon?" he asks.
"I need to hand in the paper by Friday." you lie.
"A course paper?" he asks.
"Yes. About women, aesthetics and religion in Central America." you say.
"You know my mom was from Guatemala. It's how I learned Equantian." he brags.
"Did she ever tell you about the Menhitians?" you ask.
"She mentioned them once or twice, can't remember what she said." he replies.
"The Eye Candy Enchantment was originally a Menhitian practice." you tell him. Maybe it'll save him some time looking for this stuff.
"Okay, I'll let you know in a day or two if I find something." he says.
"Thank you SO SO much!" you say. "You're a life saver."

You turn around to leave, and Ben says something to stop you.
"Hey. Don't I at least get a hug?" he asks. His arms open, waiting for someone to embrace them.

You think about it, immediately weigh all the prose and cons in your head, and figure that a hug is a fair price to pay for him helping you out.
"Sure." you say, as you loosely wrap your arms around his ribs. It feels so weird hugging as a girl. But Ben isn't having that. He puts you in a firm lock and pulls you closer so that your breasts are pushing against him. You then feel something in his pants push against your stomach, and he sways back and forth twice. You try not to look him in the eye, as he finally lets go and you slowly push yourselves away from each other. The hug seemed to last an eternity, but in reality was only about 15 to 20 seconds long.
"Thanks for stopping by." he says.
"Thanks for promising to look at the book." you say back as you start to walk down the hall.
He closes he door right before you get to the stairs, and you revert back to being male.
You head up to your apartment, and plan to have dinner and a shower before locking yourself in your room until the morning.
111111111111111111111111111.title: The Hug

choices: Something Happens On The Way To Work
You Make It To The Cubical With No Trouble
1111111111111111111111111111.content:
You twist and you turn, as the sun comes up to through the window and shines on your face.
You toss off the covers, feeling as if you've had another bad dream. Or maybe it was the same dream you had a few nights before. Maybe it was the dream that doubled as a memory. Or maybe it was nothing. You don't remember it now.
You stretch, walk over to the mirror, and see your reflection. "Male." you think as you flex your muscles.

You look down at your casual business clothes on the floor. "Not today." you proudly say to yourself.
You grab a pair of dress pants, a shirt and blazer, and a top it all off with a tie. You straighten the tie in front of the mirror, and walk out the bedroom door. There is a meeting scheduled for today, and you're going to impress them.
"Morning." Joey says as you immediately feel a change.
"Crap!" you think. You're still tired enough that when you woke up and put all this effort into looking good, you forgot that all you had to do was stand in front of a guy, and all the work would have been magically done for you.
"Crap, crap, crap." you think trying hard too find a reflection of yourself in the room.

You have trouble moving around though, because your pants have formed into a tight knee-length skirt. You're afraid it'll rip if you bend over. Come to think of it, the skirt was still pretty tight on you when it was a pair of pants. The tie has morphed into a necklace, your shirt into a low rising blouse. The blazer remains a similar design, but now it's shorter, and doesn't show off your shoulders. You look at your watch. The clock face is five times smaller, it looks more like a bracelet, and it went from being digital to analogue. "That didn't happen yesterday." you think. You can already feel the soft fabric wrapped around your legs, you don't even have to look down to know your socks have turned into nylon leggings.

"Hey you look great. How did you get your hair like that?" asks Joey.
"Hair like that? What's he mean?" you think. Then you touch your shoulders and realize that the hair is no longer falling past them.
You quickly shuffle over to the reflection in the toaster. "My hair is up in a bun." you say in disbelief.
"I didn't know you knew how to do that." Joey says.
"I don't!" you snap back, worried.
While you lean over again towards your reflection in the toaster, you use the moment to sniff at your armpits. You cologne, has become a lady's perfume. You have no idea what type, but it's defiantly there. You don't recall that happening yesterday. Although maybe you forgot the cologne yesterday, you can't really remember.

You look at your ex-wallet, which is now hanging off of your shoulder as a stylish purse. You unzip it to find your driver's license is unchanged. It's still a picture of the male you, and has the name 'William' on it. "I guess that's good." you think. The next thing you take out is your phone. It looks similar enough to yesterday, but you could swear the buttons look smaller, and the phone itself is slimmer.

You decide to ignore the observation. You're probably reading too much into things.

"Aren't you going to eat breakfast?" Joey asks as you walk towards the door.
"I don't want to be late." you say as you grab your shoes and waddle out the door.
As the door closes behind you, you regain your male physique and clothes. You quickly put on your shoes and walk down the stairs towards your car.

As you open your vehicle's door, you suddenly morph, and almost lose you balance for ten seconds. Someone must be looking at you. You look to your side and see a guy on the sidewalk with his dog, just standing there, staring at you. But that doesn't concern you as much as your footwear. As you get into the car, you notice that your heels are twice as long as they were yesterday, measuring in just under two inches. But these were the same shoes you had on yesterday. They never morphed to look like this. "They're probably just being altered to match my outfit." you think. Trying to calm yourself down.

You take a few deep breaths, and begin to merge into the traffic. "Today will be fine." you tell yourself.
1111111111111111111111111111.title: Tuesday Morning

11111111111111111111111111111.content:
Traffic seems heavier than usual, as you sit in your car and try and ignore the gazes of the male drivers passing you. Driving in heels isn't as bad as you first feared it would be, but you are driving a bit slower than usual, and taking an extra half-second to hit the brakes. After about the first inner city block takes you an extra five minutes to get around, you make a game out of how long it takes before you morph into another shape.

You average about 30 seconds per form, and are disturbed that you only transformed into a male once during the whole trip. It wasn't so much the amount of the changes that disturbed you, but that it felt like drivers were paying more attention to you than the road.

You get into your building's parking area, and drive to your parking spot, once more leaving your car as a man.
There are a few more cars already parked though. This doesn't bode well for you making a simple entrance past the secretary.

Walking up the slope, you move towards the elevator. As you pass a van parked about five spaces away, you notice a car double parked right beside it. In under a second you feel your whole body and outfit shifts, until you're wearing what you were this morning in Joey's company.
Your higher-than-normal heels and tight skirt are not an ideal combination, as the height difference causes you to fall forward, dropping your purse and other office supplies on the ground around you.
"Ouch." you say, trying to get up off of the pavement. Then you realize that getting up isn't so simple in this outfit. You use your time on the ground to try and reach the fallen objects.

But like prince charming dismounting his horse, Greg opens his car, and comes to your aid. Was he waiting for you?
"Hey, let me help." he says as we trots towards you.
He reaches for you with both hands, and pulls you up. He probably thinks you're two weak to help pull yourself up with only one. Of course the way you look at the moment, he might be right about that.
"Thanks." you say, as he helps pick up the papers, and hands over your purse.
"No problem miss...I'm sorry, I didn't catch your name yesterday." he says.
"I don't think I gave it." You reply.
He gives you a look, like he's expecting more for helping you out.
"It's Clair." you finally say to him.
"Are you okay Clair?" he asks. Emphasizing your name.
"I'm fine you say, as you try and brush of the dust on you, even though you have your hands full.
"Here let me help." Greg says, as he immediately brushes off the dirt on the back of your skirt. You're face turns red with shame. That's the most private place any guy has ever got close to touching you.
"Can't have people see you with a dirty back, they might get the wrong ideas." he says with a wink.
"Thanks." you say both quickly and nervously, as you walk closer towards the elevator.
"I'm Greg." he says as the elevator doors close.
"Nice to meet you...again." you say in an uninterested tone.
The doors open and Greg says goodbye as he exits on his floor.
You're barely male for twenty seconds as the elevator doors open on your floor and you see a guy staring at you from the other end of the hallway.
He slows his walk, in order to make sure he enters the lobby at the same time you do.
You enter as he holds the door open for you.
"Thanks." you say as you slowly make your way in through the doors.
"Good morning Clair." Janice says.
"Hi." you say in a high pitched innocent voice.
Janice shakes her head, like she knows this world will chew you up and spit you out.
"Oh, Will should be right behind me." you say.
"That's nice dear." she says.
"Does Janice not like me...er...Clair" you ponder.
You're about to get to the other door, when the guy who followed you in opens it for you.
"Thanks." you say again. You want to tell him he doesn't need to keep doing that, but you just remembered that your hands are still full trying to hold the stuff you dropped in the garage.
"Name's Robert." he says.
"Clair." you say trying to ignore him. You honestly want to stop giving people your alias, but for some reason, you're afraid that giving them the cold shoulder will make you seem too much like a bitch.
You walk down the side of the cubicle wall. Despite it being empty, you don't change back until you turn the corner. You can't help but get the feeling Robert was looking at your ass.
"No, I'm just being paranoid." you think, remembering that Joey only had to look at you once for the transformation to stay in effect, then you needed to get a certain distance from him, or find an enclosed space.

As you walk into your cubicle, you're greeted by another employee.
11111111111111111111111111111.title: Trouble Getting To The Cubicle

choices: You Need To Do Something Else Before Then
111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You immediately feel yourself shift as you stand in front of your cubicle.
"Clair." your boss says.
"Jerry." you reply, resisting the urge to say 'sir.'
"Clair, I'm so happy to see you. How are things going with Will?" he asks.
"He's great. I can learn a lot from him."
"I bet you can." he says in a bit of a condescending voice.
"We spent most of yesterday going over the details of the Denver project." you say.
"How caught up are you on it?" he asks.
"Enough to start to brainstorm some ideas for the presentation tomorrow." you say.
"But we're past brainstorming, we've already prepared slides and a video for the clients." he explains.
"Yes, Will told me. He finished those slides last week."
"Finished them a week ago?"
"Yes sir, I placed them on your desk last Friday."
"I don't recall that." he says.
"I mean William told me he gave them to you last Friday." you say, correcting yourself before he can catch the slip up.
"Oh, I'll be sure to take a look at them." he says, half paying attention to the conversation. You notice that his eyes are spending more than a liberal amount of time looking at your cleavage.
"Jerry, William said it was important to look over those before the meeting today." you say with a hint of urgency in your voice.
"Clair, you sound like you know what you're doing." he says.
"Thank you." you say.
"I want you to come to my office, and explain this stuff to me." he tells you.
"I don't think that's nesse..." you say before he cuts you off.
"No, I insist, think of it as a test." he says as he walks towards you.
You shuffle your way into the cubicle, struggling to move because of your damned skirt and heels, then finally drop the stuff you were carrying from the car onto your desk.
Jerry Gardner is now looking at everything below your waste as you lean over to tidy the papers you dropped. You're not sure, but you think your petite steps are having some effect on him.
"Do you need help getting around today?" he asks, bringing attention to how tight your skirt is.
"No, I'll manage." you say as you turn to face him. You know the tight skirt is showing off your ass, and you don't want to give him a clear view of it.
"Let me at least walk you to my office." he says putting his hand on your lower back.
You really feel uncomfortable being touched there, but then again, you'd feel uncomfortable being touched anywhere. You've seen guys and girls with no clear feeling for each other walk like this before. It's an accepted practice as far as you know.
Mr. Gardner walks you down the cubicle wall, and with every step, you feel his hand becoming less firmly pressed against your back. You fear it might 'slip' and touch your rear end. This fear haunts you until you reach his office.
He leads you to a seat in front of his desk, where he gets you to sit. He then walks behind his desk and pulls out the file you gave him last Friday. It looks unread.

He opens it and turns it so that it is facing towards you. "So what am I looking at?" he asks.

Not missing a beat, you explain everything that is shown in front of him. All the values of the charts, graphs, the statistics, variables, strategy, and every other factor to do with the project. You go over with the expertise of someone who has written the entire thing, which not so coincidentally, you actually did.

Your boss sits back, a look of surprise crosses his face as he takes a deep breath. You can tell his heart is beating faster than before.
"You haven't work in this field before?" he says.
"No sir." you say.
"And Alex was able to explain all of this to you yesterday?"
"Yes sir, he's an amazing man."

The boss looks over the pages again as he sits there, silently.
He then looks at you.
You can almost swear you head him whisper: "All this and a fine piece of ass too."
He stops looking at the papers and looks at you once more.
"How would you like to sit in at our meeting?" he asks.
"Sir, I..." you say before he stops you, he doesn't even care that you called him 'sir', he's too distracted by his thoughts.
"On second thought, it's not a request. I want you at the meeting this morning. You don't even need to say anything, I just want you to observe."
"Thank you for this opportunity." you say.
"The pleasure is all mine." he says with a greedy smile.
111111111111111111111111111111.title: Clair's Power Play

1111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You barely have time to reach your cubicle when Robert walks by your desk.
"Boss wants you to know that the meeting is starting." he says as he pops his head in.
"Thanks, I'll be there in a minute." you say, waving your hands in a motion to shoo him away.
"Crap." you think as you look at the computer screen in front of you. You haven't had time to change into Will since you got here. He's going to miss the meeting completely, and that's going to look really bad on you.

Frantically, you think of something to do. You look at Mr. Donald's office. Maybe if it is still unlocked, you can sneak in and make a phone call from it. You have no idea what you'll say, but maybe you can improvise something.

You sneak towards the door, being as stealthy as you can in your stupid outfit. Thankfully, no one sees you get inside, reverting back to a male as you do.

"Okay, I've got one shot at this." you think as you open your cell phone and make a call.
Janice answers with her nasally voice. "Hi, can I help you she asks."
"Janice, it's me Will."you say, artificially making yourself breathe heavier than usual.
"Will, the boss wants you in on a meeting right away." she says.
"I can't, there's been an accident." you say.
"Oh no!" Janice says in surprise. You don't know if the reaction is genuine or not.
