"Some guy hit the side of my car, but he claims that I'm responsible for it. The whole thing is B.S. but he's making me wait until the cops show." you lie.
"So you're not going to make it." she says.
"Afraid not." you say.
"I'll let Jerry know."
"Thanks." you say, hanging up the phone.

You sit down in the big chair in the room and look up at the ceiling. Immediately regretting your improvisation. Your car is in your parking spot, if the boss or Janice tells anyone and they see it, you're screwed. You take three deep breaths, filling your lungs up with air.
"At least no one will have to brief me on the meeting later." you think.

With a file you prepared last week, you walk into the meeting and sit by the far corner near the coffee table. Your location was a mistake, a line up forms immediately behind you, as the men pour their coffee at an abysmally slow rate. You can tell they're scoping out your breast size as they walk by you. You just sit back and try and maintain good posture until the meeting starts.

Soon Nick walks into the meeting, and you can see your hair becoming a bit blonder as a few stray strands fall in front of your face. You quickly brush them aside, but this action might have been a bit premature. All Nick sees is Clair the intern trying to fix her hair the second she seems him. He probably reads it as a sign that you're self conscious around him. In his mind that means you like him.

The second the boss comes in, you stand up and move your way over too him.
"I just got a call from Will." you whisper in his ear. "He's been in a car accident."
"Is he alright?" Jerry asks.
"Yes sir, but he's being held up and won't make it to this meeting." you finish.
"Thanks babe." he whispers back.
You want to respond, but see the other people waiting, and think better of it.
You do your little feminine shuffle back to your seat, and aren't too surprised to see that Nick has chosen the chair next to yours.

"Well it looks as though William won't be joining us today. But I don't think we should be too concerned. His assistant Clair will be sitting in for him." the boss says, pointing towards you. "Now I don't want to waste too much of your time, so lets get down to business."

The next 20 minutes are him reintegrating everything that you went over at his desk earlier this morning. About twice during the presentation he makes eye contact with you, as a way of saying thanks.
You're briefly distracted for a moment when you swear that Nick's hand had touched your leg. You look over at him, and he's making eye contact at the boss. You notice that his hand closest to you is defiantly under the table. But when you look at it, it's resting on his lap. You quickly feel more eyes on you and you return your focus to the other guys at the table. You realize that a third of them have just noticed you staring at Nick's crotch-area.

Amazingly enough, you're starting to be able to take notes on your surroundings without missing anything important from the Jerry's speech. Is this what multitasking is like for the fairer sex?

You don't get to think about it too much because though, be cause the boss immediately stops and asks for suggestions and ideas.
A few people raise their hands, and the meeting becomes quite mundane after that.
Finally the boss wraps it up and almost EVERYONE at the table comes over to introduce themselves to you. You look at the far side and notice that Beth storms off after seeing all the attention that you're getting.

As people leave one by one, you notice Nick whispering something in Jerry's ear. Jerry seems to nod in agreement, as they look at you and position themselves near the door.
Finally, you've shake hands with a dozen people, not one of them giving you a firm grip. One old guy even kisses your wrist. As you walk towards the door, Jerry and Nick pull you over for a second, as everyone else starts to leave the room.

"Clair, I've heard you've met Nick before." Jerry says.
"Yes, briefly." you say.
"He's requested that you help him with his presentation for tomorrow." Jerry says.
"But isn't Will supposed to help with that?" you ask.
"Yes, but Will is not here. You are. This presentation needs to be done by tomorrow, and you seem to know just as much about this project as he does. If he shows up, you can brief him on it, but if not, Nick requested that you work with him." he says.
You look over at Will for a second, you can see a bit of lust in his smile, no matter how hard he tries to hide it.
"Sir, I really think I should stay with Will." you insist.

Jerry puts his arm around you, and walks you a few steps away from Nick.

"I know you might feel more comfortable around Will, but I don't think there is too much more you can learn from him. You've been here a day, and are already better at explaining this shit than he is." the boss whispers.
"Sir, I..."
"Nick is one of our smartest and most aggressive workers. Trust me, he's twice the man Will could ever be. You'll learn more from him in a day than you will from William in a month."

You feel your heart break, just a bit. Is this what your Boss really thinks of you? For a second, you feel like you're going to cry, but then you quickly shake off the emotion. You look over at Nick. Despite some of his eccentricities, he is really good at his job. He's been more successful than you in it, at least that's what your boss thinks. Maybe you'll actually learn something from this.

"Fine." you say.
"William would understand." Jerry says.
"I'm sure he would." you reply in an ironic manner.
Jerry gives some sort of hand signal to Nick to show him that you accepted.
"I'll see you in my office in ten minutes." Nick says walking by you.
1111111111111111111111111111111.title: The Meeting

choices: Call Him Later With a Better Excuse
11111111111111111111111111111111.content:
As he walks past you chills run down your spine, as Will you have known him for years, he is a good friend, but you know he is a proud womanizer, and unfortunately you now know this from personal experience. Since the last time you were alone, he left to get water and came back wearing nothing but a towel. But after all the trouble you’ve been through to keep this job, you really had no choice.

Standing there in front of his door you pause for a moment to take a deep breath. You then gently knock on the door.

“It’s open.” Nick says, you walk inside and close the door behind you, a strand of blonde hair then falls in your face and you feel your butt become tight and perky as you revert to Nick’s ideal woman.

“Hey just who I wanted to see.” He says smiling as he walks around his desk to greet you, “You did a spectacular job in the meeting today.” He says as he quickly gives you a hug before you can get out of the way, but as he backs off as though to let go his hands slide down to the small of your back, as though he was about to pull your waists together, but you manage to escape.

“Ah... Yeah thanks... But you know Will really deserves all the credit. He taught me everything I know.” You say taking a few steps toward his desk to put distance between the two of you.

“Your just modest, Will is a good friend of mine, but between you and me he could of never given a presentation like that.” He says laughing.

You then jump forward, “Yes he could!” you exclaim, but Nick just smiles, “Well maybe one day, but you can now, and I know you must think a lot of him but you need to think about your own career, stick with me and he could be your assistant.”
He says smiling.

"But I didn't even give the speech, Mr. Gardner did." you correct him.
"Technically, but Jerry told me that you went over it with him, step by step, just before the meeting started. The other guys might not know the difference, but we know that was all you." he says in his smooth voice.

You were speechless, you miss a few days of work and one of your best friends is trying to give your job away. “Wait! Your one of my closest friends... ah I mean you’re one of his closest friends!?” you say,

“Ah… yeah but this isn’t personal it’s just business. And it wouldn’t be fair to your hard work go unrewarded, and I haven’t seen Will around here making things happen like you are.” he says. “No, I… I mean he has been working his ass off.” You exclaim. “Well I’ll have to take your word for it, personally I haven’t seen him at all this week.” he says

“But… ah he…” you stutter, “Hey you don’t have to cover for him, he may have opened the door for you but you walked through it yourself.” He says slowly working himself closer to you.

But in frustration you pace back and forth to the other side of the room, you didn’t know what to tell him, you had been working your ass off and still your job is in danger, who would of thought that you would be making yourself look bad. And Nick was actually in a position, to make things difficult for your male self at work. What are you suppose to do?

(Tell Nick the truth and hope that he will help cover for you at work or Get away and call will with your male voice and convince him that you’re actually working)
11111111111111111111111111111111.title: At Nick's Office (Originally By Wanderer0426)

choices: Try and Talk Your Way Out of this
111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You contemplate telling him the truth for a few seconds. But then look down at yourself and become convinced that he'll never believe you. Realistically, Nick is only listening to every third word you're saying. Plus you look nothing like Will at the moment, common sense would tell him not to believe it. He'd might even think you're a bit crazy, and not let you near any more confidential information. Plus introducing everyone to a crazy intern would look incredibly bad on Will's part. You decide that when you get a chance, you'll call from an empty office or closet somewhere and make up some excuse as to why you, as Will, couldn't make it into work today.

"Come over here, I want to show you something." Nick says as he sits at the computer in front of his desk.
You shuffle over and stand beside him. The jerk doesn't even offer you his seat.
"It's a video of what will be playing behind us at the presentation." he says, as he clicks play.
The video itself is ten minutes long, and is set to go on a loop.
The way Nick has angled the computer screen, forces you to lean forward against the desk and bend over in order to get a good look at it.
As you watch the video, you can feel gravity pulling your breasts forward a bit. Nick knew exactly what he was doing, as occasionally, out of the corner of your eye, you can see him making taking quick glaces at your Tits and ass. Another chill runs down your spine, as you realize he's probably making mental images for later.

Plus your back is starting to hurt.

The video itself is nothing special either. It shows a lot of sky, sun, nature, and scenes from the last few projects that your company has promoted. There are also the occasional time lapsed picture of monuments from around the world. The whole thing is made to subconsciously associate your workplace with success.

"What do you think?" asks Nick.
You tell him all the observations that you made while watching the video. Nick looks up at you in surprise.
"You are good." he says. "Why have none of our competitors hired you yet?" he continues. It's his way of complimenting you, or hitting on you, you're not really sure there is a difference at the moment.
Nick then stands up. "I'm sorry, where are my manners?" he asks as he gets out of the seat. "Please, sit down."
You're expecting some kind of trap, but your ankles are getting sore from your damn heels, and you do need relief from that, even if it's just for a minute.

As you sit down, you attempt to fold one let on top of the other. You really don't want too, as most guys can't comfortably maintain that position, and you hate doing anything that brings to the attention the fact you're no longer male. Still, from your understanding, crossed legs are a woman's way of telling men she's not easy. It's a mute point though, as your skirt is so tight that you can't even fold one simple leg over the other. You give up, and sit in the chair, with both heels planted firmly on the floor.

Nick picks up on this signal immediately.

He grabs a little fold out chair that has been hidden behind one of his filing cabinets, and sits down in front of you. His chair is much closer to the ground than yours is, and he'd probably use it for letting guests sit in, for no other reason than it'd make him seem taller in most meetings. The only reason you can think of him using it now is that if he starts to lean forward a bit he could probably get a good look up your skirt.

Realizing that you don't even know what type of undergarments you're currently sporting, you quickly move your knees together. The conversation is a strange one, as the words of it take a backseat to you trying to cover yourself up, and Nick trying to take a peak at you. At one point your knees get tired, and you try and use your hands to push down the skirt to obstruct his view. It works, but not in the way you intended, pushing two hands down on your skirt your skirt causes your arms to squeeze your breasts together, making them look larger than they really were. Nicks attention shifts accordingly.

About half an hour later, you're both mentally and physically exhausted. You suck at being a woman, and are terrified that you're giving all the wrong signals to Nick. After the third time of asking for a break, Nick takes pity on you and finally lets you have a ten minute one.

Leaving his office, you can feel the slight changes happen to you as you walk towards an empty supply room. You don't even bother trying to figure out what you look like. Right now, keeping Nick off of you is the main priority. Thinking back to your interactions with him at the office, you wonder if your mannerisms told him little more than that you were playing hard to get. Your stupid shuffle defiantly wasn't helping matters.

Although you can feel that at least one guy is still watching you, you bend over and rip the seam in the side of your skirt. Tearing it a few inches. It shows a little more of your right leg, but at this point you don't care, you can move with a bit more freedom.

You head over to the supply closet and quickly open and shut the door as you open your phone. You look down, you're male again, and there is also a slight rip going three inches up the side of your pants. "Whatever," you think, "The pants were getting too small for me anyways."

You call Janice and ask her to connect you to the boss. She does so.
"Will?! Where the hell are you?" the boss shouts as he picks up the phone.
"I just came back from the doctor's." you say.
"Why, what happened?" Jerry asks.
"I was having pains after the car accident. At first I thought I was fine, but the more I walked, the more it hurt." you say.
"Are you alright?" asks the Boss.
"I should be in a couple of days. Level two whiplash. The doctor said I can't lean forward for a while, and I'll be walking funny for a bit.
"Will, you should rest."
"No, I can't, the presentation is too important." you say.
"Too important? Will, it's your health. Stay home, we won't hold it against you." he says.
"Are you sure? What about Clair, I'm the only one who knows about her...I mean knows her. I have to teach her so much about how this place works." you insist.
"Clair is doing fine. You've got nothing to worry about. Trust me, you picked a winner with her." Jerry answers.
"But sir, I..."
"I'll have non of it, if the doctor says rest, you rest. I have total confidence that the presentation tomorrow will go as planned."
"Sir...I..." you try and respond.
"Nick, we can have to struggling to walk up to a podium and rubbing your neck all through the presentation. It sends a signal that we're weak. Stay home, that's an order." Jerry says as he hangs up.

Well, your plan worked, kind of. Except now you are expected to be here for the rest of the week as Clair, and not get paid for it. Plus if anyone sees Nick walking around the office, you'll be in huge trouble.
As you turn to leave the supply closet, you see that the door had been reopened. Possibly while you were on the phone. You realize you haven't changed to Clair either.
Looking up, you see why. Beth is there looking at you.
111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Talking With Nick

1111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You look at her, and she looks at you. She was probably wondering why the new intern was walking towards a supply closet, and investigated to find you.

"Will?" she asks.
You don't even respond. If she tells the boss you were here, it would be a disaster. Panicking, you grab her, pull her into the closet as you escape it, shutting the door behind you.

You quickly bounce a few steps away from the door as you feel the transformation come over you once more. You look up, and see Nick walking your way.

He's about to say something, when Beth opens the door, looking incredibly upset.
"Where is he?" she says, looking at you and Nick.
"He?" you ask.
"Where is Will?!" she says.
"I didn't see him." you say,
"The boss said William isn't here today. Don't you remember the meeting?" Nick asks her.
"But he was just here, in the supply closet." she says.
"I just walked by the supply closet, I only saw you go in there." you mention.
"Maybe he's still in the supply closet." Nick says, as he opens up the door.
"Hello, Nick? Are you in here?" he says at the empty space.
"But I swear I saw him." she pleads, hoping you or Nick will believe her.
"Maybe you were daydreaming." you say. "Nothing wrong with daydreaming about Will in a closet."
"You ever daydream of anyone is a closet?" Nick asks you in a flirtatious manner.
You smile politely, knowing you screwed up again. You tried to make Will look good, and instead have convinced Nick you daydream about guys.
"Maybe." you say, in a nervous but playful response. You're not really sure why you said that, but it seems to work. Beth shuts up, seeing that she is just looking hysterical, and that both you can Nick have lost interest into what she is saying, but you also notice her eying you. She knows somethings up. She probably doesn't know what is up, but she knows it involves you and William.
"Does she like Will...I mean me?" you think to yourself. "Is this some sort of territorial female thing?"
You think about it for a second. You never noticed too many signals from Beth that she was into you, but then again, you mainly focused on hotter women than her, and didn't give her too much attention.

You walk back to the office with Nick, as he puts his arm around your shoulder. You let him. Not because you like it, (because you obviously don't,) but because you don't want to make any kind of scene that will give Beth a reason to follow you.

"Shit, that was close." you think as Nick ushers you to his big chair. Thanks to the tear in the seams, you're finally able to cross your legs when you sit down. The tear widens as you do this, and shows off more of your thigh. "Whatever." you think, and you and Nick go over the presentation and start practicing your lines on it. Nick tries to hit on you every chance he gets, but you have to hand it to the guy. Despite all his advances, he manages to get work done.
1111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The Beth Factor

11111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
The work day ends, with you and Nick writing down what you'll say for tomorrow, Nick leaning over you the entire time you type. You leave with a celebratory hug, in which Nick's left hand was way to far south, down your back for comfort.

Deciding to leave early with the crowd today, you manage to avoid Beth and get your car out of the parking area without anyone noticing.
As you drive home, you realize that Joey is going to have to start driving you to work. Your car doesn't look damaged in anyway, and that contradicts the story you called your boss with.

You let out another sigh, as you realize that your week is getting even more complicated because of the damned curse. You're getting angry at the slow traffic, and red lights that halt any speedy route towards your place.

Eventually, you park in the lot beside your building, and walk up to your room. You're too tired to even notice the change back and forth on the way there. Keeping Nick away took too much energy out of you.

Joey is there, watching some crappy comedy film you've never seen before.
"Please tell me you haven't been doing this all day." you ask.
Joey looks up at you. "It's research!"
You watch the movie for a minute, and are able to piece together the plot. It's about a guy who magically turned into a girl and has to deal with the chaos that ensues.
The woman in the title role looks like some sort of porn star, as she keeps getting in situations were she has to wear skimpier and more revealing dresses. "Too close for comfort." you think as some guy slaps her ass.
You don't even remember doing it, but you're now sitting on the couch, watching the crapfest, and laughing at a few parts. The movie then shortly ends like they all do, with the guy returning to normal, and learning a lesson.

"They all end that way." Joey says. "They guy learns that women are people and gets transformed back, and gets together with the girl next door.
"We don't have a girl next door." you say.
"Whatever, it's just a bad movie. Women are supposed to laugh at how a guy reacts to the stuff they do, and guys are supposed to get erections watching the hot actress look really nervous in revealing outfits."
"That's so..."
"Sexist, I know, but it makes money, and damn it, it works. Body switching is not considered a genre and not just a plot device." Joey explains, cutting you off.

"Please tell me you learned something of value today." you say.
Joey looks at you, and the pile of books beside him. "These are useless." he says pointing at them.
"Joey, you need to try harder!" you plead. "I don't want to be stuck like this."
"I don't know, it could be worse." he says.
"How?" you ask.
"It could have been me instead of you."
You're mad at yourself for walking into that joke. You should have seen it coming a mile away. Is your brain starting to act differently? "I'm just exhausted." you tell yourself.
"Fix this!" you say to Joey.
"I might not need to."
"Why?"
"Ben came by today, said he did some readings and wanted to go over them with you tomorrow."
"Ben found something?!" you say as hope returns to your voice.
"Mentioned something about telling you over dinner." Joey says, looking at the back of a DVD case.
"What?" you ask, hoping he'll clarify what was clearly a sentence you misunderstood.
"Like either of us is in a position to say no."
"But...I..." you're trying to think of a way out of this, but right now, but can't. Ben is holding the cards. At least you'll have until tomorrow to think of something.

Giving up, you go over to the fridge, and find a piece of leftover pizza in the vegetable area.
You take a quick look at it. It doesn't look moldy. You put it on a plate and heat it on the microwave.
"We had pizza?" Joey asks.
"Apparently."

As the pizza finishes, you try and take a bite out of it as you're walking towards your room.
That was a mistake. a clump of sauce falls right on your blouse. "Ew, that was one of my best shirts." you think.

You go into your room and undress, running to your personal bathroom to rinse it with soap and water until the stuff washes out.
After about ten minutes of scrubbing, the mess, you're left with just a hint of a stain in the dress shirts top-right corner.
You look at it, and back at the clothes covering the floor of your room.
You need to do some laundry, and now seems like just as good a time as any, maybe if you're quick enough the tomato sauce won't stain.

You take an empty basket and fill it up with your clothes.
You quickly throw on something more comfortable, and walk past Joey towards the door.

"You doing a load? Here babe, take this." Joey says as he dumps a handful of his clothes on top of yours.
"What a gentleman." you say sarcastically, rolling your eyes.
"What a woman!" Joey says with enthusiasm as he opens the door for you.

You walk downstairs with no shoes on. It's not that the floor isn't dirty, or surprisingly cold, but it's that you don't want to carry a basket downstairs in heels is anyone sees you.
Eventually you make it to the basement, where six washers and dryers are there for any of the tenants use.
The washer and drier should take 45 minutes each to clean your clothes. It looks like you'll be having some time to sit and think.
The washers and dryers are supposed to automatically lock once started, but the locks are so weak that any random guy could break them and leave with your stuff.
As you start to put away your clothes, you see a paperback novel on top of the machine next to you.
"Oh, the latest in the series of 'Dirk Cutling: Fugitive Lawyer', this could be fun." you think, dropping it in your basket, so if anyone else comes in to see it, they'll think it's yours.

Just then, as if on cue, the door opens, and a man walks in.
11111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Laundry Day

111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Suddenly, you feel the shift, as your shirt and pants morph into each other and form a sundress. Your hair folds down to your shoulders, and your socks shrink down until they are lower than your ankles.

You instinctively look behind you to see an older man, in his mid-to-late fifties, walk in.
"Sorry miss. I can come back later." he says.
"Don't bother, I'm going to be a while." you say as you look in the basket.

Your eyes widen a bit in surprise. Most the clothes there are female's clothes. But you weren't wearing them. You think about it for a second. You were holding up a pair of pants when the guy came in, those turned into a females' pair of the same pants. Maybe the pant leg was touching the other clothes and passed on the curse. Maybe your leg was touching the basket. You look at the basket, it's still the same color, it hasn't turned into a bright pink or anything.

Thinking for a minute, you go through the pile, of laundry in front of you. A lot of them look tasteful. Although you're not sure what were the clothes of yours that transformed into bras.

You toss them into the washing machine. More amazingly, most of Joey's clothes in the pile didn't change. The one exception you find is Joey's I LOVE PUSSY T-Shirt has had the last word changed to 'cock.' You quickly hide it in with the other clothes before the man sees it.

Finally, you start the wash, and sit back to read the Fugitive Lawyer novel. Unfortunately, as you pick up the book, it no longer looks like a courtroom paperback.

A novella is being held in your hand with a cover of what looks like a woman about to faint in bed, as she is being wooed over by a dark stranger.

"The Erotic Adventures of Emily Skythims" the title proudly displays. You look at the back and there is a picture of a woman you never heard of. The description on the back reads: Emily wakes up one morning to find her mansion gone, her husband disappeared from history, and herself ten years younger. With no money, and no experience, Emily is forced to work as a sleazy law-firm, where she learns to court clientele. Meanwhile her co-worker, the handsome Mr. Graves, lets on there might be more than she thinks. Perhaps she could get to the bottom of this mystery of what's happened, if she can just stop herself for falling for him. A tale of pride, romance, mystery, and danger; will Emily ever learn how to be a working woman in a man's world?

The description ends there.
"Yuck, do women actually read this stuff?" you ponder in your mind.
You look over at the man, who has just finished putting away his laundry. Your option is to either read the book, talk to him, or leave and pry he doesn't see doesn't look at your spinning load and see the word 'cock' on one of your shirts.

You open the first chapter. "This is going to be a long hour and a half."



By the end of Chapter 3, you start to actually get into the book. The mystery was well written, some clues were sprinkled around so you could guess what's coming next if you looked hard enough. And despite the title, it wasn't that smutty yet. Maybe the author was just building up to it. You keep reading.

And no sooner had you started a chapter when you hear what sounds like a sniffle beside you.
You want to ignore it, leave the old man with his pride and resume the book, but you hear it again and turn to see tears coming from his eyes.
Part of you is freaked out, men don't cry like this. He's probably unstable. But there's this growing desire in the pit of your chest to see what's wrong.

"Are you okay?"
The man sniffs as he wipes the tear from his face. "I'm sorry, you look just like her." he sniffs.
"Just like who?" you ask.
"Like my daughter. And she looked like my wife."
"Oh, this might get creepy." you think.
"I lost them both. I'm sorry." he says.
"It's okay, you can cry. They won't mind." you say, putting the book down and grabbing some old Kleenex from a box on a shelf. You give it to him and he dabs his face.
"I'm Mitch, I live on the second floor." he says. No wonder you haven't seen him before, you've never gone to the second floor.
"Clair." you say, almost by habit at this point, as you reach out your hand to shake his.
The man grins as he shakes yours back. "So Clair, can I ask you what you do?"
"You tell him about the job you had as Will, (leaving out that part that you're actually a man,) and all successes you've gotten from it. Ending with the presentation which you're doing tomorrow.
"Wow." he says with a look of pride on his face. "My daughter wanted to work in your field, but I told her that the system was designed only so men could advance in it. -- I'm so happy you proved me wrong."
"Thanks?" you say, not knowing how to react.
"I hope, that if my daughter had lived, she'd grow up to be like you." he says, as a sadness creeps back over his face.

Just then the washer dings, and you put all your clothes in the dryer.

You sit back down and talk to the guy as the machine does its work. The next forty-five minutes fly by.
111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Your Laundry Changes

choices: You Wake Up The Next Morning
1111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
After saying good-bye to the man, and giving him a hug, because he looked like he could really use one, you grab your laundry and walk upstairs. It was so refreshing to speak to someone who didn't want to hit on you, that you choose to ignore how potentially creepy the situation was.

You knock on the door, expecting Joey to open it for you, but as you hear no response, you enter on your own, and remain untransformed.
You then realize that Joey is probably in his own little private bathroom, and that you've got a few minutes before you're forced back to looking like his dream girl.

You bring the laundry into your room and sit on the side of your bed as you start to fold it, until you realize that Joey's mess is in there too. You grab the offending T-Shirt and place it next to a pile. You are going to show Joey what it says and get him to burn it, or maybe humiliate him by letting him know it's his.

But suddenly Joey walks past your bedroom open door. "Hey man." he says, as you instantly go from a man folding laundry into a woman folding it.
"Your laundry is in the basket." you tell him. Picking up the shirt next to you, putting it in the basket, and kicking it across the floor to him.
"It's weird." you say, "Most of my laundry changed when a guy walked in on me."
"Like you just touched it and it transformed when you did?"
"Ya, pretty much."
"And did my laundry...you know?"
"No, that's the weird part, only mine, and your stupid Spring Break souvenir." you say pointing towards the top of the basket.
"Dude, this isn't mine, it's yours." he says.
"What?!"
"Ya, I bought it for you. You just never wear it, and it was clean, so I figured I'd use it last week."
"I don't remember this at all!"
"I might have been drunk when I gave it to you." he says. "Why? What did it change into?"
"I don't want to talk about it." you say, as you continue to fold your socks. You just realized you've been multitasking this entire conversation.

"So whenever you've changed before, only the stuff you wore or had in your pockets changed with you. Now the stuff you touched changed too." Joey says after a long period of silence.
"Only the stuff that was mine." you correct him.
"But your bed didn't change, when I walked by, and you own that." he tells you. "Maybe it's only clothes or small stuff." Joey thinks out loud.
"Maybe you're right, but it's still creepy." you say worried, about what this might mean for you.

Joey thinks for a second and sees this is bugging you. He then picks up the shirt, which he claims is yours, and walks away.
He comes back a moment later.
"Don't think about it too hard, you're tired, I can see it in your face." he says. "Here, this should cheer you up." he adds, tossing the shirt at you.

You unfold it. It's still a man's shirt, but the wording has been altered by permanent marker.
Above the words 'LOVE' and 'PUSSY' is the word 'MY' written in marker with an arrow pointing down between the two other words. 'I LOVE MY PUSSY." it reads.

Joey snickers, and you can't help by smile too. "Go away." you tell him in a voice both defiant and defeated.
You close your bedroom door and revert back to male. You throw on the shirt and look at it on you in the mirror. It'll totally work as an inside joke if you ever get this curse lifted.

With a twisted smile crossing your face, you decide in a second of weakness to open the door and surprise Joey by wearing a shirt that will read "I LOVE MY COCK." Maybe he'll recall that you possess one when he's not around.

"Hey Joey!" you say as you open the door. You immediately feel the shirt shrink as your midriff becomes exposed.
Joey looks at you for a second, he mouth makes an 'O' shape and another second later, he falls on the floor laughing.

You look down at your chest. The words had altered as they originally did in the laundry room, except now, Joey's writing on the shirt changed from the word 'MY' to 'YOUR'.

Terrified, and embarrassed beyond belief, you shut the door. Leaving Joey hollering in laughter as he tries to get up.
"That was too much." he seems to repeat over and over.

You shut the door, take off your shirt, and wear three layers of clothes in case Joey wants to come into talk to you. You look down at the discarded shirt which caused this scene. "That is SO going in the trash tomorrow." you think.

The rest of the night consists of Joey knocking on your door, insisting that the incident wasn't that bad, before he starts breaking out into giggles.

You refuse to talk for the rest of the night.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Your Most Embarassing Moment Yet

11111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
It's another sunny weekday for you. You open your eyes and lift the covers. The morning is good to you. You get up, stretch and walk around the room, farting, stinking, burping and saluting yourself in the mirror as a man should. It saddens you to know that you've been spending more time this week pretending to be someone named Clair than yourself. You try and be honest with yourself about this, most the day, you really just miss the power you possess as a guy.

You throw on your casual business attire. You at least knew what it would look like transformed, so you shouldn't get any surprises with your wardrobe today. You slip on the socks you usually wear with it, and immediately see two holes in them. Your mind thinks about how those holes might transform the socks into torn nylons, and you figure it's better not to wear them at the moment.

You yawn and walk into the living room. Your bare feet stick to the floor as you put on some coffee. Looking at your digital watch, you remember that Joey is supposed to drop you off and pick you up today.
"Joey." you say as you knock on his door. "Joey."
"In a minute Joey." yells as you hear a thud on the ground. Joey must have fallen out of bed again.
You look at your watch once more. You still have a good ten minutes before you really need to rush things. You pour yourself a pot of coffee, drinking out of one of your many white wholesale coffee mugs, as you lean against the counter.

The second your lips taste the drink, Joey opens his door, groggy and barely dressed. He's wearing a shirt that's at least a size too small for him, and wearing nothing below his waste except a pair of tight boxer shorts.
Joey isn't even looking at you, and already his pants are bulging straight out. "Whatever, it's the morning, he's entitled." you think, not wanting to actually thing about it.
Joey then looks at you and his boxers point higher.
"Okay, that's uncalled for." you think.
"Joey, I'm setting a new rule if you want to still live here. Whenever a lady is present, you wear pants."
Joey raises he hand and opens his mouth like he's going to give some smart ass remark, and you immediately realize that you just referred to yourself as a lady. You can put two and two together here, and decide to cut him off before he can say anything.
"If someone looks like they could possibly pass as a woman enters this place, you wear pants." you continue to say as you calmly take another drink.
You think Joey is going to have a snappy remark planned, but he just stops and examines your face.
"What?" you think.
Joey still just looks at your face. Something is off to him.

"What?" you finally say, as you're about to put your cup down. Then your eyes dart to something on your cup, a red smudge on the rim.
"Yuck." you think as you're about to pour out the coffee and get a new cup.
Then it hits you, this cup was clean just a moment before. You notice your fingers wrapped around the handle have their nails painted a dark ruby red. You drop the cup as you quickly look for a reflection. You look in the toaster, but the warped reflection of your face doesn't tell you what you need to know.

You don't recall having red nails earlier this week. Your tiny feet seem to skip across the floor, until you get to your bathroom, leaving both doors open as you rush through them. Joey walks at a distance and leans against your bedroom door, as you gaze at the mirror.

"Make up. I'm wearing make up." you think in semi-horror.
Your seems slack jawed as you look in the mirror. Covering your lips is a crimson coat of lipstick, and a touch of rouge blush compliments the color. Your eyelashes are more curled than you ever recall them being, making your eyes look twice as big as before. Above them is some eyeshadow that gets lighter the higher it goes up. Until is gives a silver gloss just below your eyebrows. Your brows also look like they've been plucked. Trying desperately to look away from the attention whore you see in the mirror, your eyes focus back to your fingernails. Sure they looked like they were manicured the first day you woke up, but if their was any paint or coating on them at all, it was a clear one. These nails bring attention towards themselves, and it's the type of attention you don't want.

You look back at the mirror, hoping that this is some bad dream. Then through your hair you notice it, a metal gleam hanging from off your ear. A bright pair of earring to give people another reason to focus on your face longer.

"Joey, what happened?" you try and say. But all you can manage is surprised feminine grunts, coming off in an incoherent way. Fortunately Joey seems to get the gist of what you're getting at.
"Babe, it's okay. That look you're sporting is probably part of the package with your knew outfit." he says.
"New outfit? But Joey's seen this one me before." you think as you look down. Then you notice something. This skirt is four inches shorter than the last time you had it. Your top now provides little use other than focusing attention to your breasts and showing off your curvy sides. Your legs are bare today too. They look clean shaven and smooth as a baby's cheeks, but the cover than even the nylon gave you has now disappeared. You look at your toes. Not surprisingly, the nail polish on them match the color on your fingers.

"This was the outfit I wore Sunday!" you scream.
"Are you sure?"
"YES!"
"Did it shrink in the wash?" he asks.
"NO!"
"Maybe we just didn't notice the make up yesterday. My sister says it can be so subtle no one can know you're wearing it." Joey says trying to calm you down.
"I was as dressed up as a guy could be yesterday! You really think that if I had make up on when I transformed, you wouldn't notice?" you say, a but pissed at his arrogance.
"It doesn't look at bad." he says.
You look in the mirror one more time. He's right, once you get past the shock that you're actually wearing it, it at least looks tasteful and like something that's appropriate for the office. All things considered, you should probably be grateful for that. Still you're pissed at Joey for probably getting an erection looking at it. In fact, you're probably just made that he can still have erections. You give him a nasty frown for trying to defend the situation.

"Easy, calm down, babe. You don't look that good when you're mad." Joey says, trying to lighten the situation.
"Good." you say defiantly.
"So what's you're explanation of all this than?" he asks.

You piece together the clues in your head.

"The curse is getting more powerful." you conclude. "My clothes are getting more provocative, it's starting to change what I hold onto, not just what I wear. I look more like I'm trying to be someone's eye candy."

Joey is about to make a response, but stops, thinking better on it.
"Go get your shoes on." he says. "I'll get some pants on and drive you to work."
11111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The Curse Gets Worse

111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You were silent for most of the car ride. Pondering what could possibly happen to you if the curse became even more powerful. You don't like any of the possibilities that pop up in your head. "Did the Goth Chick mean for this to happen? Did she understand what she was doing?" you think. Ruining someone's life was a bit extreme for a simple act like slapping her ass.
You don't even bother looking in the mirror of the car as you shift forms. You just keep gazing at your nails. The damn things don't seem to change, even when you do.

As Joey pulls over in front of your building, you step out of the car, showing more leg than you're comfortable with as you leave the vehicle.
"Be here at 5:30." you tell him.
Joey gives you a salute and prepares to drive away.
"And try and be productive today." you add as you shut the door.
"I think Ben's got it covered." Joey seems to mumble behind the door window.

Ben. You almost forgot Joey mention that Ben wanted to see you tonight. Just another reason why you regret waking up this morning.
You walk towards the building. Heel-toe. Heel-toe. You hate heels, they're probably one of the worst trends that ever stayed in ladies fashion. The shoes just make your feet look smaller, as the movements you're forced to do to keep balance in them seem designed to show off your legs and your ass. Plus it might just be you becoming paranoid, but you're pretty sure the heels themselves are even higher than they were yesterday.

Looking down beyond the folder you're carrying in your hand, you notice something different about your steps. They're straighter, and there's more of a sway coming from your hips. You're walking different today than you were on Monday. "Is this the curse's doing to?" you think.
"Yes and no." you realize. Guys walk the way they do because they're protecting their genitals, it's why there feet point on outward angles. Woman don't need to worry about protecting anything hanging down there. It's why you're walking straight. You cross one foot in front of the other as you keep walking towards the elevator. You're not even sure why you did it. Probably just to see if you could while keeping balance in the stupid heels.

The elevator closes and you ride up it as a man. You look down to see that your feet have altered themselves accordingly.
As the contraption goes up, you realize that one of the benefits of getting Joey to drop you off is that you won't have to cross paths with Greg in the parking garage today. Maybe you might be able to catch another break somehow.

The door opens on Nick's floor and you realize you're still a man. Then fear strikes you as you see someone at the other end of the hall. It's Beth. And her eyes widen as she spots the guy who pushed her the other day.

"Shit. Shit. Shit." you think as you rapidly push the button for the 15th floor.
Beth sees your panic, and her walk towards you quickly evolves into an all out dash towards your position.
"Hold the Door!" she yells.

The doors close and the elevator starts to head upward as you hear her bang on the safety doors moving below you.
As you reach the button's destination, the door opens to reveal Robert standing there. He stands in the doorway's threshold, freezing the elevator in place as his eyes glance you over.
He, of course, sees Clair, who is holding a folder and looking particularly attractive today with all her make up on. Making her stand out even more than she did earlier this week.

"Hey, what are you doing on this floor?" he asks in seductive tone.
"I'm, trying to find Nick's office." you tell him.
"Oh, well, it's a few floors down. I think you might have passed it." he says, trying to sound smooth.
"Oh, I can be such a ditz sometimes." you say trying to laugh it off. Really you're just killing time, hoping Beth will lose interest in waiting for you to come back down.
"Ditz? No! I heard you're going to give a speech with Nick today for the Denver project. The boss wouldn't let a ditz do that."
The elevator lets out a ding as the doors try and close on Robert. The sensors quickly sense his presence and slide back, all the way open.
"Are you sure you don't want this floor?" he says.
"Why, what's up here?" you ask playing dumb. Realizing that Clair would have had no reason to visit this floor.
"It's the filing area. It's pretty quiet up here most that day. Between you and me, you can get away with having a quick nap in a few of the corners."
You snicker politely.
"Hey, if you ever want to let off some steam, I can show you little corner where I practice my techniques."
You laugh politely again. You have no clue what he is saying, but he's clearly hitting on you. "It's never going to happen." your mind assures you. You quickly sneak a peak at your analogue watch and realize that you've been semi-flirting with Robert for a full 45 seconds. There's no way Beth's lost interest in you yet.

"Can you show me where Nick's office is?" you ask in an innocent manner. You notice that Robert's been looking more are your face today than your breasts and legs, maybe he'll actually hear what you're saying.
"Sure, I've been there plenty of times. I usually drop by his place before we head out on our weekly lunches." he brags.
Weekly lunches?! Nick never invited you as Will to a weekly lunch. You feel more like you're out of the loop now than ever.
"That's so-- interesting." you manage to say as Robert steps beside you.

The doors open on Nick's floor, and Beth is there looking at you.
"Are you okay, you look upset." you say to her in a sweet but concerned voice that reeks on inauthentic concern.
"I'm fine." she says angrily, looking directly at you.
You try and look oblivious as you stand in front of her. You almost want to get into a staring contest, but realize it's more effort than it's worth. Plus you're blinking a lot today, and it's throwing you off. You've read that women blink more than men. Maybe you're just noticing it now, or maybe it's all the crap on your eyelids that's making them subtly heavier. Either way, you decide to turn and look up at Robert.

Robert takes your blinking as a sign that you're concerned about Beth and want him to step in. Either that or he's thinking that you're batting your eyelashes at him. It doesn't matter what he reads into it, his response is the same. He looks at Beth and begins to speak.

"Beth, if something is bothering you, you should tell us." he says, trying to look authoritative in front of you.
"It's nothing." Beth says, and her eyes move from his right back to yours.
"Fine, if you say nothing's wrong, I believe you." he says.
Beth looks at you and Robert, and realizes that it's not worth her energy to confront you both at once.
"Ugg." she grunts in frustration as she walks through a door on the far side of the hall.
"Nick's office is just through those doors." Rob says pointing to the main ones in the center of the hall.
"Thank you SO much." you say to him, as you walk out of the elevator, turning just slightly to your side to wave goodbye.
"Anytime." Robert says as the doors close on him.

In a second you're a man again, and can tell immediately by the feel between your legs as you walked like you did in the lobby. You stop, readjust your stance, then continue to Nick's office before Beth has another chance to spot you.
111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The Elevator Experience

choices: Make Up An Excuse To Console Him
Enough is Enough, Tell Him To Back Off
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You open the door to Nick's office as you feel the familiar change. You've probably spent more time looking like Nick's ideal woman than anyone else's at the office. Or anyone else's at all for that matter. At least when you're at home with Joey, you can hide in your room. At work there is almost no escape. The company consists of about 80% guys, and they're men that know what they like, and how to get it.

Almost instinctively you can feel Beth gaze at your figure from behind. Damn her. With her following you all day, you're forced to stay around guys to prevent her from seeing Will.

Nick is looking at his folders, drinking some coffee before he looks up at you.
"You look--good." he says.
Against your better judgement, you give a flattered little blush as you flip your wrist as to silently say, "oh you." You immediately catch yourself and refine your poise. It's too late, Nick sees his opening.

"So, I see you spent all morning prepping for the meeting." he says as he edges closer to you.
"Well, I was thrown into all of this, I kind of had to cram." you respond, trying to downplay his flattery.
Nick's too quick for you. His right hand goes down. You freeze, thinking he's going for the folder. He doesn't. With his palm, he tucks a loose side of your top into your skirt. Immediately leaving his hand flat against your hip for a full five seconds.
"You have to look your best for these guys." he says, as you slowly brush his hand away with the folder.
"Trust me, that won't be hard." you reply.
You know how Nick's mind works, in his head, he's probably making a joke about getting them hard. You pretend that he isn't.

"Clair, I'm going to be honest with you, and it might hurt."
"Okay." you say nervously. You have no clue were this could lead.
"You've spent all that time with me yesterday going over the facts, and preparing our speeches. Now you need to know that those don't matter."
"Don't matter?!"
"Yup, you can just forget about them. Look relaxed, sound confident, and if you mess up, just ignore the mistake and keep going." he says.
"Is that what you do?" you ask him.
"It's why I am where I am today, and guys like Nick are stuck in a cubicle."
"It's a corner cubicle. It's a tiny bit bigger than the others." you tell him.
"Still, it's not this." he says, spreading his arms to show the space.

You look at the open door behind you; you have a feeling that you don't need to be here right now. But as you look away, you see Beth doing some morning chores out there. Not a single other guy has entered the area yet. If you leave Nick's sites, she'll probably spot William...you.

Nick sees you're field of view, and moves around you to shut the door.
"We'll, we don't need to go over the report again. I think it'd do more harm than good to practice presenting." he improvises.
"We could help with one of the other projects." you say, trying to cover how nervous you are with fake enthusiasm.
"We could relax." Nick says as he puts his hand on your lower back and walks you towards the chair.
You're thinking he's going to sit you down in the chair, but instead he immediately swings you around and leans in for a kiss.



With almost lightning quick speed, you put your left hand up and block his face.
"Are you crazy?" you tell him.
"What?!" Nick asks. "You've been giving me signals since I first say you here Monday."
You think about it. Have you been? You have no experience giving signals to men. Are you going to break Nick's ego right before he needs to sound confident and ace the presentation on the Denver project?

What should you do?
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: 'Preparing' For The Meeting

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You want to yell at Nick, tell him to back off, that you're not interested in him, and never will be. You want to tell him that you're really his friend Will. But your mind instantly thinks of all the possibilities that could go wrong with that scenario, and how it could distract him from the presentation today. You really want this presentation to succeed. If it does, Mr. Gardner would probably not care as much at Will's missed work.

You try and think of a way to let Nick down lightly, but what excuse could you think of after you asked if he was crazy for trying to kiss you?

"It'll smudge the make up." you blurt out.
Nick sits back in surprise. Obviously he knows just about as little on the subject as you do. You decide to go with it.
"If you touch my face, you'll ruin it." you say, continuing your line of reasoning. "No woman can get up in front of a crowd with her lips all smeared."

Nick sees this as his way to back off while keeping his pride and takes it. The tone of your voice showed that you're not interested in his advances at the moment, but also nowhere did you outright say 'no' to them either.

You expect Nick to question you about your actions and if you like him. But instead he moves around you and sits down at his desk. In his eyes, you can see the realization that he's moving too fast with you. He's probably coming to the conclusion that you don't find his position of power an aphrodisiac like other women would. As you stare at him, you seem to understand his frustration. The way you dress does seem to indicate that you like the attention of men. If you were still a guy, and saw a girl dressed in these clothes, you'd probably hit on her too.

You brace yourself to what is sure to be an awkward half hour before you're supposed to set up.

To your surprise, the phone rings and Nick answers.
"Hello...ya, of course we're ready...Yes she's here...YOU WHAT?!"
Nick breathes heavily for a second.
"WHY THE HELL DID YOU AGREE TO THAT?!" he shouts.
You try and say something, but Nick just puts up his finger to shush you, he quickly writes something down on a piece of paper.
"Yes, we can do that, but it's going to be tight. In 20 minutes? We'll try." he says hanging up the phone.

Nick looks up at you in concern. "They moved the meeting." he says.
"Where?"
"The Central City Tower. At the heart of the city."
"There is no parking there." you say.
"Well, we could walk down there in 40 minutes...but we're supposed to start in 20." Nick says, sounding a bit pissed.
"A cab. We'll call a cab." you say, starting to panic too.
"I'll get Janice to do it." Nick says buzzing the secretary and requesting she call a cab for you downstairs.

"Why did it change?" you ask.
"The companies CEO wanted to take a 1pm flight out today. He decided to stay at his building and finish some stuff up. Said he'd give us a half hour to give the presentation."
This just gets worse and worse. You planned the presentation to take exactly 45 minutes.
"Shit. Shit. SHIT!" you repeat as you gather and drop some of the project papers.

"You're kind of cute when you say dirty words." Nick says.
You turn and look at him, pointing like you're going to tear him apart. You probably are kind of cute when you swear, but that's not the point. Nick (and you) need to focus.

You both race for the elevator, only to see Jerry already in it.
"I had Janice call us a cab." he says.
You and Nick look at each other. Janice probably told him that she called a cab, and he decided to take credit for it.
"Good thinking sir." Nick says sucking up.

A few floors later, the elevator doors open and Greg and Darrel come on too.
"We're joining you." Greg says.
"Why?" you ask.
"Time restraints, while you and Nick pitch the idea, they're going to go over cost projections with there accountants." Jerry says.
"Brilliant." you say, sucking up too.

The door opens in the lobby, and you feel yourself shift as all the eyes are watching four businessmen and you race across it. As you get outside, you see a cab pull up. Nick quickly takes your papers and throws them in the trunk along with the accountants briefcase.

They all pile into the cab, except for you. You weren't quick enough because of your heels, and there are no seats left.
"Maybe I can take another cab." you think, as you open your purse to an unexpected surprise. You have no cash. There is a credit card, but it belongs to some guy called William. Maybe you've heard of him. The cabby might not accept it.
"Where did the money go?" you think. Did Joey steal it? You don't want to believe he did, but you know he has been short on money lately.
Whatever, you'll figure it out later, right now you have more immediate problems.

You look up, horrified about what's going to happen.
"What's the hold up?" Jerry asks.
"I don't have any money for a fair." you say.
"I've got it covered." he replies.
"I think I'll go in a cab with someone else." you say.
"Damn it Clair, we don't have time for this..." Jerry yells out the rolled down window.
"Just sit on my lap." Nick replies, interrupting his boss. The door beside him still left open for you.

You close your eyes and shudder, thinking about all the mistakes that brought you to this part in your life.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Make Up, An Excuse To Reject Him

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
As the cab parks in front of the Central City Tower, you open the door and pull yourself off of Nick's lap. You're pretty sure that the trip here has surpassed last night's laundry incident as the most humiliating of your life. You've never wondered what it felt like for the woman giving the lap dance, and you never thought you'd ever be in a situation to find out.

Nick's hands holding your knees, to keep you balanced wasn't enough, every time one of your butt cheeks slid just a little, you felt an immediate and expected action from him. The other guys in the cab, just looked at you, envious of Nick. The whole time, you were trying not to to let out surprised yelps, in the slim hopes that they wouldn't know what was going in.

You also hate potholes even more now.

As Nick gets the papers out of the trunk, you and the boys make your way to the 35th floor of the building, where you are directly taken to a noticeably large presentation center.

"And I thought our place was impressive." Darrel says to himself. Jerry shoots him a strict look.

"Hi everyone, welcome to the Central Tower Presentation area." a bubbly brunette says, as she shakes the four men's hands.
She's attractive, and you could totally see yourself spending a night with her if it wasn't for your current condition, but as you put out your hand to shake hers, her eyes narrow, as she gives a cold and limp response.
"Are you here to help with the refreshments?" she asks.
"I'm here to present." you tell her in a defensive tone.
"Oh, you just look...never mind." she says.

"So were do I put this data-stick for the presentation?" Nick asks.
The brunette walks the both of you behind the podium, as she shows that there is a whole computer hidden inside of it. She explains the basics to the two of you, mostly focusing on Nick.
"It has everything you need." she says breathing deeply, as her left hand twirls her hair.
"Uh, gee...thanks." Nick says, clearly admiring the attention.
"Big Mike will be here in five minutes." she says as her right hand slowly lands on his shoulder.
"Big Mike?" you ask.
"Our C.E.O. You know, the guy you're here to impress." she says, turning only her head to look at you, and hardening her voice as she does so.
"Five minutes is enough time." says Nick, as the brunette turns back towards him to meet his eyes.
"Hmm, that's efficient of you. I can only imagine what you could accomplish if we had ten." she says as her index finger playfully touches the tip of his nose, and her left hand slips into his pocket, before she leaves the stage and starts chatting to your boss.

"I got her number." Nick says with a smooth smile.
"Don't get cocky, I could probably get that slut's number if I asked." you say.
Nick looks at you in mock surprise. "Don't tell me your jealous." he says, trying to put you on the spot.
"Don't flatter yourself." you reply, and you open the folder, and look at the papers you need to read.

You are surprised in how harsh you sounded; like a woman who had just been turned down for something. You don't know the brunette, you had no reason to call her a slut, or judge her for it if she was. The truth is you are jealous, but not of her, of Nick. You hate how most girls seem magnetically drawn to him, and how no girls you've seen so far this week seem more threatened or envious of you than in awe of your success.

Nick takes the hint of you looking at your speech and starts reading over his paper one last time. You find yourself eying that brunette, as she flirts up the boss. You don't like her. Maybe it's because she doesn't like you. But you can't figure out why she'd be upset. You're not a threat to her, she don't know your relationship to anyone. It could be she's jealous of your success.

You see Greg in the back seats, as a ditzy looking secretary rubs her leg against his. Darrel seems to uncomfortable with the girl he's been put with to really go over the statistics.

You look at your watch, as see that there is two minutes before Big Mike will show. You should be focusing on what you're going to say, but the woman's actions are bothering you. Then, in an instant, you figure out what it is. She's a brunette. Jerry likes brunettes, you know this because of how you looked when you entered his office. Jerry has spent time with Big Mike before. Mike probably figured out Jerry has a bit of a weakness for them. He's setting up something, but you're not sure what.

Just then, Big Mike enters the doors, with an entourage of 'yes men.'
"Evening." he says, shaking Jerry's hand.
"Ready for the presentation?" your boss asks immediately.
"I'm ready to be blown away." Mike says as he waddles towards the front row.

Big Mike is called Big Mike for a reason, and it's not because of his height. A bot belly hangs down to cover most of his waste. He looks up, seeing you, and you immediately change. You skin changes complexion a bit, and you shrink an inch. It's not too noticeable, since having your coworkers in the room keeps the curse of any one guy from altering your too drastically.

Just before you start, Greg and Darrel immediately leave with the women sent to distract them. Jerry sits a row behind Mike, as the brunette sits beside them. Nick doesn't seem to notice, but you can tell by Jerry's reaction that she is rubbing her leg against his. You can tell by her eyes that she knows you know.

The lights dim, and Nick starts the projector to create his background and begins to speak.
"Here goes nothing." you think, realizing how cliche the line sounded in your head, and being thankful that you didn't say it out loud.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The Presentation

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Despite your best attempts, you steal the presentation from Nick as they men have their eyes glued on you. You like to think that they were reading your lips, but then you shake that thought, as you had an idea about how they wanted your lips to interact with them. You just hoped that they listened to what you were saying, and were not too distracted by your looks.

The projector turns off, as the lights turn on, and there is a round of polite applause, before heavy whispering starts. Jerry leans over to Mike and the two exchange a back and forth that don't quite hear. At one point, both stop for a moment, to stare at you before they focus on each other.

Nick retrieves his data-stick, and politely escorts you off the stage. You're uncomfortable with his hand on your back, but say nothing in order to appear that you are a united front at your work. "Is touching a women's back the best way to lead us around?" you think. Yet another reason for you to hate your current body.

You and Nick go over to talk to your boss and Big Mike, but the brunette gets up and completely blocks Nick, semi-flirting with him. You ignore her as you try and go towards big Mike, but one of the better looking 'yes men' stands up and walks over to you.
"Hi, I'm Harold." he says, towering over you.
"Clair." you say shaking his hand. He has suck a caring grip.
"I liked your presentation."
"Thanks. But I wanted to talk to Mr. Gardner and Big Mike about it." you say.
"I can speak for big Mike."
"Are you...Do you have the authority to...make decisions." you finally say. Damn it, this guy is distracting you, and you don't know why.
"Mike is a bit busy today. But I can answer all questions for him, if you're interested, we can get together over lunch."
You're about to say "I'd like that." before you snap out of it.

"I really want to talk to Big Mike in person." you mention.
Just then Big Mike stands up, shakes Jerry's hand, and waddles away from you towards his office.
"There is my cue to leave." Harold says as he kisses your hand. You're upset, but your body involuntarily blushes.
Your words come out inaudible as Harold and the other 'yes men' leave the room.

Soon, you, Nick and Jerry are alone near the podium as the brunette stands by the door.

"I don't think he's going to give us the project." Jerry says.
"Why?" Nick asks, in a serious tone.
"He seemed so dismissive. I think he has another partner in mind." Jerry says.
"The shortened presentation, the relocation to here. This was all just a formality." Nick realizes.
"Sorry about putting you through all this for nothing Clair." Jerry says. "I want you to know I don't blame either of you for this. Still, this was supposed to be a major catch for us. Word gets out, there is a good chance out shares could drop."

You say nothing.

"Clair, are you alright?" Nick says, waving his head in front of you.

"No." you finally respond.
"No?"
"No. I'm not okay." you say in a paced monotone voice.
"Do you need to sit down?" asks Jerry.
"Yes, with Big Mike." you say.

"Not a good idea Clair, I know you put a lot of work into this, but he'll still work with us on future projects." Jerry says.
"I want to sit down with him."
"No, it'll seem like we're desperate." Nick says.
"I want to talk to Mike." you say, your heart beating faster as adrenaline pumps through your veins. You want to make a scene.
Jerry and Nick try and talk you out of going to see him for the next three minutes. Finally, they both start to give in a bit.
"Are you really sure you want to try and talk to big Mike?" Nick asks.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Mike Doesn't Seem Impressed

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You got hit on by Nick, embarrassed at the mall, hit on by Nick again, and again, had to flirt with guys, waste a good portion of last week, and let Clair take credit for Will's work, just so you could get to this presentation. Oh ya, and there is that cab ride you're trying to block from your mind.

Mike isn't going anywhere until you get him to work with your company.

You look at Nick and Jerry, both seem to be trying to comfort you, and it looks as though the only reason that they could possibly let you talk to Mike at this moment is because they don't want to ruin any chance they might get to sleep with you. You know how the male mind works, but at this moment you don't care.

"Nick, the slut by the door is probably going to keep us from Big Mike. I need you to distract her." you say.
Nick gives you a sly look, he knows exactly what you have in mind. "Fine, but you'll owe me." he says.

You never want to owe Nick a favor. No woman does.

"Once Nick gets her out of the way, follow my lead." you tell Jerry.
Jerry stays quiet. He looks like he's trying to distance himself if this goes bad.

You and Jerry pretend to talk as Nick walks up to the brunette, and starts giving her some of the moves that he's been trying to practice on you all week. Thankfully, she seems much more confident in her sexuality than you are right now, and leaves the area, with Nick's hand on her ass. "Seriously, why is is that if he does that he gets laid, but if I do that, I stop being male for most my waking hours." you think to yourself.

A minute later, you and Jerry walk down the hall, where Harold comes towards you.
"Clair, I'm so glad we have this chance to talk." he says.
Big Mike must have put him there to distract you if you tried to follow him. It was a well placed move on his part, a lot of women would be flattered to be around a man like him and lose focus. Thankfully, you're not that type of woman. Or any type of woman, at least in your head.

You stick your palm in his face, in an admittedly bitchy fashion as Jerry comes up from behind and forcibly shakes his hand, starting up a conversation with him. Harold is forced to take his attention off of you, and deal with the more powerful person.

You swing open the doors to Big Mike's office, and immediately shrink about six inches. Your hair turns black, falls down to your waste, and your skin color alters to a yellowish-tan. Your peripherals change too, as the type of eyes on your face alter to fit the facial features of a different race. You can't find your reflection, but your instincts tell you that look like you're from Singapore. You wobble in your heels a bit as you struggle to maintain your balance during the change.

"Mike?" you say. Your voice is higher than before, because of how small you've become.
Mike breathes heavily from behind his desk.
"I'm Clair." you say.
"Nice to meet you." Mike says as he struggles to stand up and reach across his desk with both hands. The way he rubs them as he touches is a clear indication that he wants you. You really don't want to lead him on, but you've come this far, and your determination will not let you stop now.
"Mind if I sit down?" you ask, as you lean back in the chair in front of him, and fold your legs.
Mike breathes heavily.
"I was so happy to hear our companies were going to do this project together." you say, leaning forward a bit to let your top do the work for you.
"Oh yes, I have the utmost respect for Mr. Gardner." he struggles to say.
"I understand the presentation is over, and that you have a trip to go on today, so I'll make this quick." you say in a voice that is equal parts enthusiastic and sensual. "I just wanted to meet you face to face and tell you what a big fan I am."
"Well, thank you." Mike says, looking a bit shocked. He's obviously not used to woman who look like you talking to him like this.
"I just wanted to tell you alone, in person, how much I look forward to working with you in the future." you say with a wink as you get up. "I just wanted to tell you like this so that my boss doesn't get the wrong signals from me." you finish playfully.
"Sure, anytime. We should meet later to discuss the project." he says as sweat starts to form on his forehead.
"Totally." you say in a submissive voice as you turn around to walk out.

The door shuts and you transform back into brunette version of Clair that the boss sees.
"Clair, did you..."
"I talked to him. I told him how much this project means to us." you tell Jerry.

You're looking more confident and recovered than ever. Feeling like you're just tapping into a new power that you have over guys. You should be feeling proud of yourself, but you can't, everything about this just feels wrong. You don't show it to the guys at work, but you're ashamed and just feel unclean that this is how you're getting things done. People aren't treating you at all like Will, and you can't help but feel that if it wasn't for your looks, you'd be in an office as Beth's assistant right now. This isn't your life, and it's not how you want to get things done. You get an immediate sense of regret as you a subtle urge to vomit.

Plus there is a gnawing presence in the back of your mind that the events that have been set in motion today can only end in disaster.
"I'm a guy." you repeat in your head, over and over on your way back to the office.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Your Big Chance With Big Mike

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
The day ends, as the boys and yourself wonder if Big Mike would go elsewhere, and leave you behind with the project.
You desperately wanted to go back to your cubicle and get back to your old, paying, routine. But Beth seems to be never more than 10 years away from you at all times in the building. Between her, Nick, and the presentation looking like a failure, you wonder if you should even bother returning again tomorrow.

Joey arrives ten minutes late to pick you up, and you sit in the car, wanting to pass out, as you turn towards him, your eyes begging him not to ask you how your day went. Joey was never the brightest guy, but maybe he'll pick up on this signal to ignore you.

"So how did your day go?" Joey asks.
"Horrible." you reply and you unload all of the problems on your mind to your roommate. Joey seems to be only paying half attention to you as you're talking, focusing mainly on watching the road, but taking occasional glances at your body.
At one point you see if he's paying attention by mentioning the cab ride you took on Nick. "Oh ya." he responds not looking at you.

"Oh my god, he's tuning me out." you realize, before you realize you don't want him to care. You're pulling the same garbage on him you hate when girls pull it on you. He doesn't want to hear about your problems, he knows your main one, and he's probably worried about problems of his own, like paying rent.

"I looked through some occult places today, some local goth hang outs." he says once you quiet down.
"And?" you say, your interest piqued.
"One, those goth guys dress a lot like girls. Two, no one at any of those places wants to deal with outsiders."
"So you found nothing."
"Pretty much. I also returned most the books to the library too."
"I don't care." you tell him. You're feeling a bit moody right now, thinking about what happened with Mike.
"I need you to get that book back from Ben tonight. Someone else put it on hold..." Joey says as you stop listening to him.

Your heart sinks. You forgot all about Ben asking you to his place for dinner tonight. You need to know what he found in the book, and find a way to stop this curse before it gets any worse.

As Joey holds the door open for you to enter the apartment, you head straight for your room, ready to close your door and revert back to being a guy. You stop just before entering as you see a pile of books beside the door.

"What are these?" you ask Joey, letting a bit of anger seep into your voice.
"Just some books I picked up to help you out until we solve this thing." Joey says with a wicked smile across his face.

You pick up the books, horrified at their titles:

Your Body and You: A Girl's Guide to Becoming a Woman
Cross-dress For Success: How To Pass As the Opposite Sex in the Workplace
How To Talk To Men ("Wait, this one could prove useful." your mind tells you.)
Beauty Secrets: How To Get The World's Attention
You're Not Gay, Really! Dealing with Attraction Of/From The Same Sex

The list goes on.
You laugh.
"What's so funny?" Joey asks.
"I'm just imagining the librarian's face when you took these all out." you giggle.
"I just told her they were for my gay roommate who is having trouble revealing his new lifestyle to everyone." he responds, with a face so cocky that you have an urge to punch it.

You look at him with an angry pout, as you march in your room and slam the door.

The door shuts and you drop the books, spreading them at your feet, as you turn over and fall back onto your mattress.
You want to sleep and get this day over with, but you look at your digital watch. You've got just under an hour to get ready to meet Ben.
You don't panic, at this point the curse will make it look like you put some effort into your appearance. You just hope that it doesn't make you look too forthcoming for the evening.

You look at the clothes hanging in your open drawers and closet. You should probably try some things on, and walk out in front of Joey to see what they turn into. On the other hand, it probably doesn't matter what you put on, any clothes you wear will give the wrong signals. You just need to get the information from him, and leave. Maybe you could bring your laptop and get him to write a quick email to that one site you found earlier this week.

Your mind starts to formulate a strategy to get through this.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: After Work

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
As you shut the bedroom door and return to your male self, you look at the clothes spread across your floor and try and find something that won't make you look like a total slut when the curse retakes its effect. You hold up different sets of pants and shirts. You're too scared to take touch any shirt that doesn't have a collar. At least then the curse will make you dress classy, right?

You hold up different shirts to yourself, and feel incredibly gay for doing so. You're taking your time, trying to pick out something to get the right reaction from another man. It's totally not what you ever expected to do in life.

Finally, after about twenty minutes, you settle on brown pants and a white shirt. There shouldn't be anything to provocative about that, right?

Take a deep breath as you open the door and have Joey look at you.

Joey stops whatever he was doing, and looks right at you, with his mouth hanging open.

"What?" you ask, feeling a sense of deja vu.
"I'm...your..." Joey murmurs, trying to make a coherent sentence.
You look down and see a white dress with tight straps that cling to your shoulders. You're wearing some sort of push-up bra, which make your breasts look much bigger and more noticeable than they were this morning.
Your pants have morphed into the one-piece dress, and you can feel a silky underwear ride up your crack.
You shuffle your legs a bit to adjust. Joey just stands across from you. His pants much tighter now than before.
Noticing your nails are now subtle shade of creamy white, you decide to head back to your mirror and see what the curse has done to your face.
Your reflection is sporting different shades of cosmetics than when you were at work. Blue eyeshadow, a darker shade of red for your lips, and your face looks whiter than before.
Your hair is all dressed up in the front and fallen down in the back.
You look like someone who just spent two hours to get ready for a date.
