You want to open your eyes in surprise, but notice that they can't widen more than two thirds of what they used to. You blink a lot to compensate. You're not sure if you look tired, or if you look like you want to take someone to bed.

Looking up at the clock, you realize you've got about twenty minutes before you're supposed to meet Ben.
You feel like closing the door and trying on something else, but your instinct tells you whatever you try on next will be worse.

You go to close the door anyways. You don't have to be at Ben's for a bit, you might as well be a dude until then.
As you step up to the door, Joey walks by and looks at you.
"What?" you ask him again.
"I...I..." he can't even think of an excuse, as he stares at your breasts.
"Take a picture, it'll last longer." you say in frustration as you shut the door in his face.
Then you realize, he probably was taking a mental picture for later.

You remind yourself not to underestimate how much your life is sucking at this moment.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Getting Ready For Dinner

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Fifteen minutes pass, and you decide it's time to leave. Grabbing your laptop, you put it in it's carrier bag and head out the bedroom door. As you enter the main living area of your apartment, Joey is nowhere to be seen. You see his bedroom door is closed, and figure it's best not to think about what he's doing at the moment. You slip on some shoes and head down to Ben's apartment.

Once there, you take a deep breath and knock on the door.
"Who is it?" asks the voice from the other side.
You remain quiet, you know it's just a matter of seconds before Ben looks through his peephole and sees you.
Sure enough, you feel the instant shift of proportions as you stand out in the hall. Your breasts now look huge in the dress, and the shoes have once again become heels, causing you to momentarily lose your balance as you lean forward.
"Hi." you say in an artificially enthusiastic voice as he opens the door.
"Oh hi Clair, come on in." he says.
You look at your laptop bag, it's gotten smaller and is now colored a dull pink.
You slowly walk in, trying to balance yourself, as shut the door behind you.

The apartment looks like it's been recently cleaned. The table has a cover over it, and the curtains are closed. Ben is a bit dressed up too, he's gelled his hair, and is wearing a buttoned up shirt, with the top four buttons undone.

You have a very bad feeling about this.

'Hey, sit down, make yourself at home." Ben says, trying to be friendly.
You notice his ass is stuck out a bit, and know from experience that he's trying to hide his erection.
You calmly pull a chair out from the table, and sit down, to pull out your laptop.
The laptop itself has changed since you last saw it. It's a hot pink, thinner than usual and has a sticker of a flower on it.
You try not to think of what interior changes are on this laptop and just prey it still works. Maybe starting off with talking about the 'Eye Candy Enchantment' will let Ben know you're here for business.

"So how was your day?" asks Ben.
"It was fine, nothing special, talked to some friends, did some research, you know, the usual."
"Ya, totally." Ben says, half listening as he takes some lasagna out of the oven.
"I hope you like lasagna." Ben says.
"It's eatable." you say nervously. It smells great, and Ben is a better cook than you'll ever be, but you don't want him to think you're impressed.

"So, Ben, I was thinking we could start out by you telling me what you found out in the book." you say in a tone that strongly hints you want to stay on this subject.
"Well, you'll be pleased to know I read the whole thing." he says.
"And...?"
"And there are some interesting facts in there."
"Like?"
"The Menhitians banned all magic before they were destroyed. They though curses and spells were sentient."
"Like self-aware?"
"Ya, like they were kind of alive. And unseen entity that adapts to situations."
"That's...um...neat." you say with a bad feeling in the pit of your stomach.
"Ya, little tidbits of info like that."
"Smells good." you say as he puts a slice of lasagna down in front of you. Causing you to move the laptop to the side.
"Ya, my dad used to cook this all the time."
"So what else did you find in that book? You know, about the enchantment."
"Oh the eye candy enchantment thing. It's basic tribal superstition. The enchantment was created for the sole purpose of getting a women pregnant."
You drop your fork, as that feeling in your stomach gets worse.
"WHAT?" you say, trying to temper yourself.
"The Menhitians were pretty primitive. Men were hunters, women gatherers. Men built houses, women birthed and nursed babies. All other functions were based around those simple concepts. They wanted to give the ugly young girls hope, so they made up a story about an enchantment that would make anyone who saw them think they were the most beautiful girl ever."
"That's so sexist."
"Blame the Menhitians."

You both stop for a bit to eat the lasagna.
"You're a very good cook." you tell him.
"Thanks." he says between bites.

"Oops. Almost forgot the drinks." Ben says as he goes to get a giant bottle of red wine.
"That's... big." you tell him.
"Normally, I wouldn't get this size, but since neither of us need to drive tonight, I figure we could go--a little nuts." he says as he pours you a glass.

"Does the book say anything about removing magic?" you ask him, trying to stay on topic.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Dinner At Ben's

choices: Make Up An Excuse And Leave Now
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"Well, it doesn't go into details, but ya, there are a few ways to get rid of a spell or curse." Ben says.
"A few? Like could an enchantment be taken away if the woman abused it?"
"Nothing was mentioned about the beauty enchantment you wanted me to look at, but basically there were two ways to remove a spell. One, the spell is removed by the person who cast it. Because the person who cast the spell always had some connection to it in the Menhitian culture. Or two, a spell was cast so a a person would learn a moral. Once the person learned it, their lives would return to normal."

You slowly chew your food, trying to digest to this information, and the dinner. Could the answer be just as simple as learning a moral?
"I'll never treat women as only sexual objects." you think. But you don't feel anything happen. "I'll never slap strange goth chicks in the ass again." Still, you feel no different. Crap. The moral thing didn't work.

"Are you okay?" Ben asks, as he scooches his chair closer to yours. "You zoned out for a bit."
"Sorry, I was processing something." you say with a smile, trying to be polite. As weird as you feel in this situation, Ben's information is at least being helpful.

"It's okay." Ben says as he leans forward a bit. He's probably checking out your rack. You're about to tell him that your eyes are up here, but you get a sudden shock of sensation on your leg. Your heart races as you realize that Ben is rubbing his sock up and down against it.

"I...uh..." you say, totally not used to people touching you in your current condition. You quickly take a sip of red wine to give yourself time to think. Ben did a lot of work for you, and it looks like he's expecting something for his efforts. Telling him to outright stop could jeopardize your chances of getting any more help from him. And you need him to write that email in that strange language.

"Whoa." you squeep as Ben's foot goes dangerously high up your leg.
"You think we can hold off until after dinner?" you ask.
Ben gives you a wink. "Fine, I'll try, but no promises.

For the remainder of the dinner, Ben always seems to direct the conversation away from the spells and magic. Forcing you to talk instead about food, and your fictional course at school. You try your best to seem interested in what he has to say. Thankfully, you don't have to try that hard, because it's clear Ben is into your looks more than your personality.

Once dinner is done, Ben takes the plates away as you start up your laptop. That's strange, it's not connecting to the internet.
"Ben, why isn't this connecting to the internet?" you ask.
"Oh, the connection sucks down here. The only place I can get a half decent signal is from my bedroom."
"Really?" you think.

You can feel in your gut that things might for south fast. Wait, you're entirely uncomfortable with that euphemism now. You feel like Ben will get the wrong idea if you willingly go into his bedroom. On the other hand, you'll have a hard time getting him to email the site if you can't get a connection. Is sending the email really worth the risk?

Ben walks over to his room and opens the doors.
This is it, make your decision fast.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Finishing Up The Dinner

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Cautiously, you pick up your laptop and walk towards Ben's bedroom. You really don't want to do this, but you want to follow every lead on this stupid curse. You cautiously walk through the doorway and into Ben's sleeping area.

"Where's your desk?" you ask him.
"Oh, my desk is in the other side of the apartment. I have 80 pounds of paperwork on it. Just work on the bed. Trust me, you'll be comfortable." he tries to reassure you.
"I'd better do this fast." you think to yourself as you sit on the side of the bed and open the laptop.
Ben sits right beside you and watches over your shoulder, as you navigate to the page.
It takes you a few minutes longer than it should because of the weak connection, and the distraction of Ben starting to rub your shoulders.
The site pops up. And you pull up the email link, just as you feel your hair lifted and a kiss planted at the bottom of your neck.
A chill runs up your spin.
"Whoa!" you say in a high pitch squeak, as you turn around to tell him to stop. As you turn around to object, you feel your shoulders get pinned to the bed as Ben hovers on top of you and plants a firm lock on your lips.
About 10 seconds later, you can feel his tongue retreat from yours mouth as he slowly pushes himself up.
"What was that?" you say, in a softer tone than you mean to.
"That was just the beginning." he whispers in your ear as he starts rubbing himself against you.
"We can't do this." you say.
"What?!" he replies in an irritated voice. You can tell he's about to go into a rant about you giving him signals all night.
"I have to get this done." you say, pointing towards the computer.
"Now?" he asks.
"Otherwise, my mind won't be in it." you lie.
"Fine." he says as he sits back up, and looks at the laptop.
"I need you to type in Menhitian and just ask if there is a cure for the Eye Candy Enhancement."
"Babe, there was no cure for that one curse. I read it in the book myself." he says.
"Just type it.---Please." you coo.
He types in a bunch of words you can't understand into the email. You realize you're leaning against his shoulder as he types.
"There." he says as he shows you the message.
You quickly reach around him and add 'P.S. could please respond in English if able.' before hitting send.
"Was that everything?" Ben asks, hoping to get back to his previous actions.

You stay silent, not knowing how to respond.

"Good." he says in a more seductive voice as he places you on your back, and goes in for another sloppy kiss. Another few seconds later, his head pulls back, and you realize it was a distraction as his hand begins to pull up your skirt.
You realize if you don't want Ben to make you his bitch, you'd better leave now.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: In Ben's Bedroom, On Ben's Bed

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Your body is experiencing sensations you never wanted to feel. Your being squeezed in areas you don't want to have. You need to get out of here right now. You need to say something, but your mouth has been unusually quiet since you showed up at Ben's. Maybe your just afraid of the ideas he'll get if you separate your lips.

Ben leans in for another kiss, and you make your move.
"I can't do this." you tell him.
"What?" he asks, acting surprised.
"Your breath, it smells like pasta. It's totally distracting." you say with a bit of a fake nervous laugh.
Ben holds his hand to his mouth, breathes on it and takes a whiff.
"It smells fine to me." he says.
"Well of course it does, to you. You're a guy." you say in a playful manner.
"So do I need to chew gum or brush my teeth, or something?"
You should totally brush your teeth. This is taking me out of the mood" you say sitting up.
Ben looks at you and sees trying to have sex at this moment would just be awkward. "Fine." he says, giving up. "I'll be a minute."

Ben opens his door and you hear the sink start to work. You've got maybe a minute to grab your stuff and leave.

You quietly get up, take your laptop and tiptoe to your bag, and even grab Joey's book. You lean down and pick up your heels. Then you silently shut the front door and sprint up the stairs towards your apartment.

You open the door and see Joey watching some dumb TV show.
"Hey, how was your date?" he says.
"I'm not here." you tell him.
"You're not here? Why?" he asks as you rush into your bedroom and lock the door. You hide the laptop and book under your bed, and then rush to take a shower.

Even through the running water, you here a heavy banging on the door.

"I'm not going to tell just anyone something they could hold against me for the rest of my life."
"No, you'd rather have close calls, and people dropping to their knees before you. Why didn't you tell Nick about the curse?"
"Because I'd never hear the end of it."
"Wouldn't you? Joey can be a bit of an ass, but he's done nothing but try and help you since this happened. What makes you think Nick is any different?"
"Because I haven't known Nick as long."
"But when you went to his house, last weekend, you still went inside."
"I was being polite!"
"All you had to do was drop off the papers and leave. But you couldn't have that. You needed Nick to pay attention to you. He wasn't at work, and you wanted to show him more about you..."
"I left when things got hairy." you say, justifying your actions.
"At work, when he was constantly coming onto you, you could have told him off at any time. You could have threatened a sexual harassment lawsuit, but you didn't. You just let him come onto you as you played hard to get."
"We needed to collaborate on the project!" you say. You feel completely on the defensive here.
"Oh, I'm sure you needed something. You could have stayed home and got the same amount of work done. Instead, you kept going into work, showing off your ass to everyone who looked at you. And despite your objections, you liked it."
"I did not!"
"You sat in Nick's lap, you took money from your boss. You think that's free? You know full well what he'll expect soon. No, you wanted success at work, and you wanted physical interaction from someone you knew."
"I did not!"
"When's the last time you talked to your exes? Did you even have a relationship that lasted more than three months? You took the girl and through her away, giving yourself no reason to stay with her."
"It's the lifestyle, those women knew what they were getting into." you protest. Feeling even more stressed.
"It's because secretly, you don't want girls. You want to be held by someone bigger, more confident and caring than you."
"SHUT UP!" you yell at the mirror. Sick of it's lies.
"Oh, did I touch a nerve? Face it CLAIR, most men in your position would just lock themselves in their room until they knew they'd see the goth chick again."
"But I'm not most men. I'm better than that! I had responsibilities, and I had to hold up my part in them. Even if doing it meant I had to go out looking like this!" you say pointing at her in triumph.
"And look at how well things turned out. You're in line for a promotion, Joey got his rent paid, Nick listens to your advice and shares his success with you. Even your entire office was better off just because Clair went to that meeting instead of William."
You stand back speechless. You hadn't thought of it like that, but your reflection is right. Things have been better for those around you since you started changing.

Still, it doesn't mean you have to like it.

"And Ben got shut stood up in his own apartment, and Eugene did something that could have gotten him fired. And Beth was humiliated." you say, trying to show that bad things could happen because of your situation.
"Oh, but Eugene wasn't caught, and Ben and Beth were hurt because you weren't comfortable enough with your sexuality. There's still time to fix there egos if you go and submit to them."
"Go away!" you should again.
"Go to your closet." the reflection says.
A strange force seems to force you to obey, covering its power with the feeling of morbid curiosity.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Reflection

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Your fear is realized when you open your closet, not one of your old clothes is left. On the rack are many strange and crazy outfits that look more suitable for whoring yourself than working. You pull out a black leather mini-skirt, it can't be anymore than 9 inches in length. You toss it back into the clutter of clothes, and take out a strange looking top. It has a boob window in it. There are a pair of sweat pants that say 'squeeze here' over where your ass cheeks would go. You go through the pile, desperately looking for anything that looks gender neutral, or failing that, at least doesn't make you look like a whore. As you dig through the pile of shoes, you find a school girls uniform. Sadly it seems to be the most tasteful thing in there.

Just as you are about to give up, you see a plain white shirt, and cargo shorts. They look tight, but they look good enough.
Squeezing into them, you go over to the mirror to see your result. It's not bad, you look skinny, but if you braided your hair and bought some guns, you'd be able to tell people you wanted to raid tombs for a living.

You quickly go through your purse and take out your drivers license. It still says William, and has a picture of your original face on it. Why hasn't this thing been transformed with anything else?

You throw on some shoes, all of which have unnecessarily high heels. They're a pain in the ass, but through experience, you are getting better at walking in them. Plus they make your legs and ass look great. Not that it's a good thing. Maybe you could just get Joey to carry you around everywhere. You immediately shake that idea out of your head, you never want to depend on Joey for anything.

Looking at your watch, you realize that despite all the extra steps you took this morning, you're still early. You must have been faster than you thought.

You open the door and through some act of random coincidence, Joey opens his door at the exact same time.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: At The Closet

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You suddenly feel an electric wave splash across your body, and you're almost driven back by the force. Joey looks at you, and you try to look confused.

"Hey." Joey says in a voice much more enthusiastic than usual.
"Hi." you say, trying not to let out a giggle.
Joey walks over slowly towards you. You can feel your own knees bending towards each other, touching together. Your hands are together in front of your waist, holding the purse. You're feel still like a statue, and you're having trouble, looking down, but figure you must be posing.
As hard as it is for you, you can't seem to break the smile, or move your gaze from Joey's eyes. For whatever reason, they seem hypnotic this morning.
Joey seems to pick up on this as he moves with more of a swagger.

"I love the bow." he says as he touches the object in your hair. "Bow?" you think "This curse has me wrapped up in a bow?"
Joey holds your hair for a second, and your heart races at the feeling of being touched by another human. You can feel your body blushing, totally against your will.
Joey smells the hair, which simultaneously flatters you and creeps you out. "Strawberries." he says. He moves his hand away and you find yourself able to look down. You're wearing a completely different outfit. It's a two piece dress, a tiny skirt with the slit going up the middle instead of the side. The top seems almost more like a vest then a shirt, with the opening going all the way down to your stomach. Your breasts are barely covered by them.
"Quit looking so happy, it's the curse, you perv." you try and say. "Do you like it? I picked it out just for you." you body says, betraying you.
"Ya, totally." Joey says, starting to look a bit suspicious, he probably thinks you're playing a joke on him.
You quickly flutter your eyelashes, like you're trying to get a piece of dust off of them. "Figure it out Joey." your mind pleads. "Why won't you kiss me?" another voice in your head says.

"Are you feeling okay?" Joey says,
"I've never felt better." your voice says in all seriousness.
"Oh, I see." says Joey as he moves around behind you. "So THIS won't ruin your day." he says as he slaps your ass.
You let out a 'tee-hee' sound. "Oh, that's bad, I should punish you." you say with a bit of a playful growl in your voice.
Joey stops and looks at you. "Will, is there something wrong?" he asks.
"THANK YOU! YOU NOTICED." the voice in your head yells in relief. "It's just like any other day this week." you mouth says with an eerie smile.
"Aren't you going to be late for work?" he asks.
Your body forces you to look at your watch. "Oh no, I'm going to be so late!" you voice says in a mock tone. A second later, your body is pressed up against Joey's. "If only someone would be able to drive me." you say, clutching onto his shirt.

"I don't think you should go to work today." Joey tells you.
"Please tell me what to think." your body says in the innocent tone.
Joey takes his phone and calls the office.
"Hi, yes, this is Joey, I'm Clair's roommate...I'll wait...Yes, I'm calling because Clair is incredibly sick today, and can't make it in...Yes...Yes, thank you...Maybe, she might get better by tonight...I agree, thank you." he says before hanging up.
"There you go, you don't have to go into work today." he says.
"Why?" you ask.
"I don't think you should go outside today either." he says.
"So it'll just be you and me all day?" you say biting your lip.
"Uh, I'm leaving to go get groceries, and other things." he says.
"Why?" you whine.
"Because I have a date tonight." Joey says.
"What?!" you say in shock. Both parts of your personality have the same reaction to this, but for two very different reasons.
"I have a life outside of this place you know. And spending time with a real women will actually make me feel normal for a change."
Although you don't want him too, his words hurt you. Is he mad at you for something?

"Joey, I need you." you plead.
"And I need to be turned on by a women who didn't used to be my best friend."
"Used to be?" your mind echoes. Does he really think of you that differently now?...Wait, did he just admit he got turned on by you?
Joey starts to walk towards the door. "Joey!" you plead.
He turns around. "Do not leave the apartment until I come back." he says pointing at you, he's trying to act stern and cool, but you can tell he's clearly embarrassed by admitting he got turned on.
"Oh, so I'm just supposed to walk around barefoot in the kitchen?" you yell. Joey rolls his eyes as he keeps walking for the door.
"Do you want me to walk around barefoot in the kitchen?" your body yells in an earnest question.

The door slams and suddenly control comes back to you. "WHAT THE HELL WAS THAT?!" you shout in frustration.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Your Clothes Transform Again

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
A moment later, Joey has moved far enough away from you that you revert back to your male form. You're wearing cargo pants and a loose fitting T-shirt. Any and all unwanted feminine thoughts leave your head and you sit down on the couch.

"What just happened?" you ask yourself. You behaved more like a doll than a person, producing a shallow vapid personality.
You lie down and think about it. Did you just start acting out one of Joey's fantasies? Was the curse really that strong, that just him looking at you put you completely at his mercy? It could very well have been. "How much stronger could this curse become?" you ask yourself.

You sit back up, and walk into your bedroom. Everything looks like it should in a singe guy's room. You open the closet to see all your familiar clothes, and even look in the bathroom to see all the feminine hygiene products and other unwanted cosmetic products have disappeared. Replaced with your old items.

You look in the mirror again. It's you. It's William. "Hang in there man." you say at your tired reflection.

So, you're male, but are trapped in your apartment. You try and think of ways to pass time. Watching sports seems too stereotypical, but your only other options are cooking yourself some breakfast, or cleaning up.

Before you can decide on an activity to pass the time, your reflection changes right in front of you. You feel the wieght of your chest start to pull on you a bit. Your hair is lengthy again. You look at the mirror and the word "crap." shoots through your mind. You're now in a nightgown, but your face and hair is all made up. You look like Ben's ideal women.

"You didn't think today was going to be easy?" your reflection says mockingly. This is quickly followed by a quick knock on the door.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Continue With the Morning

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"No, I'm not going to do it." you argue.
"Really, I don't think you have a choice in the matter." you reflection says as she twirls with a lock of hair. You feel you your horror that your body is doing the same.
You take a good mental image of yourself. There is no way that Ben is going to see your look as anything other than you wanting sex.
"I'm not going to answer the door." you tell the girl in the mirror.
"Aw, you honestly think that." she coos.
"I'm not going to be a slut like you." you struggle to say.

Suddenly to feel another change come over you, and you fall back for a second.
Something just happened, and if felt important.

You move towards the mirror again and look at it. You're still that woman Ben was into, but your clothes have changed. They're the top and cargo shorts that you originally pulled out of the closet this morning.
"Hello?" you say to the mirror.
Your reflection looks back at you. You look like you're dressed to walk the dog. There is nothing about how what your wearing that makes you stand out. At least when placed next to any other woman.

You lean in closer to the mirror again. You're defiantly wearing make-up. But it seems like the generic stuff that girls would wear when going to the office, not like what they'd wear when on a date.

You turn your head and see that your hair is in a bit of a ponytail. You look at your fingers and see your nails are painted a light pink which compliments your skin tone. Your shoes are even tennis shoes!

"I can work with this." you say.

The door to your apartment knocks again and Ben's voice says "Is anybody there?"

You stay quiet, not wanting to lose control like you did when you saw Joey this morning.
You don't move, if he doesn't hear anything, he'll leave.
Your head looks around the bathroom to pass the time. The colors are too warm from the male in you to feel comfortable knowing it's your place, and all the girly objects you saw when you woke up are still there.
'The curse must have altered all the objects I owned." you mind says, confirming it's suspicion from earlier. "But why didn't the walls or couch change?" you mentally ask yourself. "Because Joey shares the ownership of those." you tell yourself. Of course it might be because those objects are too big to alter. Only the smaller or lighter objects around you have changed. Nothing that you couldn't lift on your own has changed with you. Of course you prefer to think that it's the first answer that popped in your mind.

Suddenly, you hear footsteps walking away and your reflection changes into the William who is still on your drivers license.
There is a bulge in the front of your pants. An effect from all the blood flow caused by the transformation? Or maybe you were a bit more attracted to the girl in the mirror than you'd like to admit.

You think about it for a second, what would your perfect piece of eye candy look like? You don't think about it too long. You're afraid if you do, your reflection might give you an answer.

As you walk out of your bedroom, you head for the couch and turn on the television. Putting your legs up on the coffee table, you lean back and watch reality show about fixing cars. You sit back in thought, barely watching it. For the first time in over a day, you feel like you've regained control of your actions.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: A Small Recovery

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
About an hour later, your pants suddenly revert into women's shorts, showing off your smooth white legs, as two mounds swell in your chest, and the hair on your head falls down past your shoulders. You don't even need to examine yourself. You know that Joey is just about to open the door. You almost decide to open it and help him, but stop yourself. You need to know that you're in control of your actions and not feeling forced by magic to jump up and attend to his every need.

Sure enough, the door becomes unlocked as Joey comes in with his arms full of grocery bags.
"Some help." he says.
"Don't feel like it." you tell him.
"Bitch." Joey says in a deadpan tone as one of the smaller bags loses balance and spills on the floor.
You slowly walk towards it and pick it up. You put the hair gel, cologne, and condoms into the bag and silently put it on the counter.
You give him a jealous look. You're still uncomfortable that Joey can have sex with women as a man, while you're stuck like this.
"Expecting your date to go well?" you finally ask.
"You're just jealous they're not for you." Joey says in a matter-of-fact tone.
"You couldn't win me over if you tried." you say making a snarky expression as you fondle your breasts in front of him.

You let out a petite burp as you sit back down in front of the television.
"You feeling well enough to go to the business party tonight, Clair?" Joey asks as he starts to put the groceries away.
"Will. You'd better keep calling me William. And yes, I think I am going to go there." you tell him. Joey seems relieved that you're not acting like you were when he left.
"So you're not going to need the apartment tonight?" he asks.
"I'll be back before midnight. If you're going to sleep with her, go to her place, don't bring her here."
"I'm not making any promises."
"Please? I really don't want to deal with another complication." you say, widening your eyes, trying to elicit some sympathy.
"I can't say no to that face." Joey mocks.
"Screw you." you say throwing a pillow at him. It was the reaction you wanted, but you hate the way you decided to ask.
He catches the pillow and throws it back. It bounces off you, and you stand up.
"I'll be in my room." you say, trying to sound defiant, after you've lost the meaningless show of strength. There are too many traces of fun in your voice pull it off.
"Are you going to spend the next few hours trying on dresses for tonight?" Joey says.
You flip him the middle finger, and shut your bedroom door.

Looking at your analog watch, you realize you've got a few hours to kill before you have to leave for tonight.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Joey Comes Home

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Getting ready won't be much of a problem for you. One of the (very few) benefits of the curse is that you can walk up right next to any guy and look perfect to them. Still, you find yourself looking in the mirror, wondering that if the curse turned you into the perfect man for any women, if you'd get this much attention. You'd defiantly be more familiar with the outdoor plumbing.

Still, your parts do have their advantages. There is no way that you would have been able to go from an intern to a top player at your business in less than a week if you had just showed up as William. And it seems guys are much easier to manipulate to do what you want than girls are.

You gaze into your reflections eyes, entranced by the look they've created. At least Joey doesn't have bad taste in women. Or a secret fetish. You realize that you could have easily been overweight or anorexic, or deformed in some way if that's what he was into. And you realize you're especially lucky that Joey doesn't have Nick's libido.

You continue to focus on your eyes, looking at the amount of work that went into making them stand out like that. You defiantly wouldn't be good at being a female if the curse didn't automatically doll you up. Your mind starts to think about your hair, your breasts, the rest of your face, and all the other parts that are groomed more on women then men.

You've never really thought about it before, but how long would it take the average woman to get ready before she could hold her own standing next to you? You're guessing at least an hour, maybe two.

Getting ready for this party should be the easiest thing you've done all week. All you have to do is throw your bathing suit into your purse, and get Joey to drive you to your destination.

You lay on your bed, and think of how Joey used to argue with you all the time about who got the car, and how tough it was to get him to help with anything. Now he offers. But that might be because he realizes your in trouble, and not just because you're a beautiful female.

You close your eyes. You've got this.

Seconds turn into minutes, and minutes into hours. Something is happening in your mind.

You wake up in a panic. Are you late for the party? You quickly get up and rush out of your bedroom door.

"Joey? Joey?" you ask the empty apartment.
Suddenly, Joey's bedroom door opens, and a your doppelganger steps out.
"Okay, this has to be a dream." your mind realizes.
"Hey Clair. I didn't think I'd see you until later tonight." she says with a playful cruelty.
"Who are you?" you ask her.
"Me? Why I'm everything to secretly wish to be." she says with a very seductive swagger.
"Really? Because I just wish to be a man again." you tell her.
"Do you really limit yourself so much because of your sex?"
"I feel we've had this conversation before." you tell her.
"Then enough talk." she says walking up to you. "Prove your a man and take me!"
"What?! No."
"Why? Not man enough?" she asks.
"I don't want to give you the pleasure." you humph.
"Hey, it takes to to tango. Either you be the dominant one, or I'll be."

You stare at her in silence. You should be waking up soon. You're not going to give her the pleasure of playing her game.

"Follow me. I have something to show you." she says walking into Joey's room.
You don't want to go after her, but a strange pull makes your legs follow.
You enter the room, and find romantic peddles thrown onto the floor, as two scented candles surround the bed.
You see yourself before you as William, tied onto the bed almost naked, except for the ropes on your limbs and a gag for your mouth.
Joey is sitting next to you, smoking a cigar.
"Mmmphh. Mmph. Mm." William struggles to say.
Your doppelganger puts her arm around your and leans in, enjoying the moment.
"So, was it as good for you?" asks Joey to the tied up William, unaware of your presence.

"Oh, that's just wrong." you tell her.
"This is what's going through the mind of every guy who sees you. Even Joey is purposely trying to forget who you really were. He wants you as the trophy he sees."
"Joey's not like that. I don't even think Nick is like that." you say.

"We'll see." says the doppelganger as she walks over to Joey. She sits on his lap and starts stroking his chin.
"Ready to go again?" she asks.
"Am I?!" Joey says as he picks her up and lies her right on top of William.
Suddenly you blink and find yourself trapped in the doppelgangers position.
You scream a silent scream before you wake up.

You open your eyes to Joey looking down at you, gently shaking your shoulder.
"Wake up Will, you're going to be late." he tells you.
You look up at your clock, and see that it's only 25 minutes before you're supposed to be at the place.
"You okay?" Joey asks you.
You look at him. Something is off, and Joey knows it too. "He's probably reading distrust in my face." you think.
"I'm fine." you respond, in a tone much colder than you meant it to be.
"Okay." says Joey innocently, as he walks to the kitchen, and grabs the car keys.
As Joey walks away, you realize you're unsure about if you still completely trust him or not. He still sees you as a guy, right?

You grab your bathing suit, and stuff it in your purse. Looking at yourself in the mirror one last time before you head out.
You have 'bed-hair'.
The female part of you wants to panic and get embarrassed. Split-ends are such a fashion faux pas.
Thankfully, the male side of you remains calm. The next man to see you will cause the problem to fix itself. This curse just made you spend less time getting ready than you would of if you were still a guy.

"Are you coming?" asks Joey.
You quickly slip into some heels and move after him.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Before The Big Night

choices: Try And Find Something From Your Office
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You feel yourself starting to change less and less as the car moves off of the main roads and you head more towards the outskirts of the city. There is a light forest and you turn onto what looks like a back road. For a few minutes, it's just you and Joey driving in the quiet country road. He's dressed up to for his date. "He at least cleans up well." you mind tells you before you tell yourself that you don't care. For a moment, your mind imagines a scenario where he pulls over and fakes the car breaking down so that he has a moment to get fresh with you.

Your mind quickly dismisses that notion. You know more about cars than Joey does, he's smart enough to know he can't pull that off.

Suddenly, you reach a clearing and see a gate up in the distance. Joey slows the car and stops in front of it.

A camera on the gate post looks at your car. And Joey turns towards you.
"Last chance to back out. You know, if you're not feeling 100% in control."
"I'm fine. The more things I learn about here, the more I can use the information at work."
"You do know you're about to step into a den of alpha-wolves." Joey says.
"I'm a big boy, I can take care of myself." you say before you realize your hand brushed him off in a limped wrist motion.
"Okay." Joey says as he presses the buzzer just outside the car window.
"Hello, who is it?" a voice says.
"I've got this." you tell Joey as you unbuckle your safety belt and lean over Joey, pushing off his right leg to get your head towards the window.
"It's Clair." you say.

There are a few seconds of silence.
"Enter." the voice says, as you push yourself back to the seat. There is a buzz and the gate starts to open.

"Do you have my cell?" Joey asks as he goes down the huge driveway towards a fancy circular area right next to a giant garage. About a dozen other cars are already parked there.
"Oh course. But I'm not going to call you. You just worry about your date tonight." you tell him.

You step out of the car with a sexy leg reveal, trying hard to balance in the heels.

It probably would have been provocative if anyone was there to see you.
"Well, enjoy tonight." Joey says as you shut the door.
You motion him to roll down the window.
"Hey, don't worry about me. Tomorrow night, we'll find the bitch who did this to me, and we'll fix everything. You just have some fun tonight, just looking at me all week isn't healthy for you."
Joey seems to chuckle a bit, as he roles up the window and drives off.

You slowly walk up to the mansion The place must have at least 3 floors. You didn't know they made places like this anymore.
Big Mike opens the door.
"Clair, you little minx. Come on in." he says in a cheery attitude.
"Thanks." you say hesitantly as you put out you hand to shake his. He grabs it and pulls it up to his mouth to kiss it.
"That's how we greet beautiful women where I'm from." he says with a giant grin on his face.
"I bet it is." you think.

The door shuts and you see a room of mingling people.
"Can I get you anything? Some alcohol? water?" Big Mike says.
"I'm fine you assure him."
"Well than woman, this is a party, enjoy yourself." Mike says before walking off to talk to someone else.

You feel strangely alone in this crowd. Your eyes quickly dark around the room to see who is here. About three quarters of the people here are men. But there are a group of women chatting near the kitchen. You're not sure how much girl-talk you could handle, but you don't really want to get hit on by strange drunk guys either. Maybe if you went over to a person from the office you'd be able to control the conversation.

You notice Big Mike looking in your direction, if you don't do something soon, it might let on to how awkward you are, and he might come and introduce you to people you care nothing about. You'd better make your choice soon.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Entering The Party

choices: Oh, Look Who You Just Ran Into...
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You look at you heels, and feel a draft coming up your skirt. You defiantly, look the part, you might as well introduce yourself to the ladies in the corner.

You then quickly realize that other people aren't wearing shoes, and kick your heels into a pile with the others. Your ankles thank you, but you still find yourself instinctively walking on with the pressure on the front part of your feet. It still was uncomfortable, but it made you feel taller, and quieter. Hopefully you wouldn't draw attention to yourself.

As you get closer to the ladies, you see try and see all of them in a small group. One of the taller ones is leaning against the counter, and speaking as the others listen.

You slowly make your way around them, and try and listen to what is going on.
"And then I said Mrs. Choo, I love your company, but your no Jimmy." says the alpha queen.
The other ladies quickly give a polite laugh. Only one seems to genuine laugh at the joke.
There are a few more stories that are told, and in a second, you realize that they're talking about fashion. They just keep referring to the clothes by the designer brands, and most the stuff goes over your head. You realize that this is how most women must feel at comic book movies.

Finally, one of the ladies tilts her head towards you and the alpha looks at you.
"Why hello, why don't you join us." she says, beckoning you into the circle. "I'm Ann."
"I'm...Clair." you say nervously. A few of the women have stone faces as they look you over. You feel more eyes examining you now than when you were surrounded by men.
"So Clair, who are you here with?" Ann asks handing you a glass of clear liquid.
"I'm here by myself." you say meekly.
The women seem to murmur a bit.
"I love your hair. How do you get it that way?" she says.
"Thanks. It just happens." you reply. You self preservation instinct is telling you to give short answers and clam up.
"And she's modest. How do you like that girls?" Ann says to the other ladies in more of a rowdy tone.
The women let out a polite laugh.
"Clair, you must tell me where you got this bracelet." she says holding up your wrist and examining the jewelry on it.
Your eyes widen with surprise, you don't recall seeing this in the car. The curse must altering itself again.
"Oh, it was a gift, from my mother." you tell her.
Ann lets go of your wrist. She seems to have more good sense to roast you for that.
"So tell me, if you're not here with anyone, why are you here?" Ann says, determined to keep you in the center of attention.
"I was invited." you tell her.
"Invited? That's rare." she chuckles.
"I worked on the Denver project." you tell her, taking a sip from the glass in case she tries to ask you more things. "Holy crap, it's vodka." your tongues memory shouts. You can't really taste anything, but it's clearly not water.
"Oh, I know, you're that little harlot Jerry has working for him." she replies.
You keep sipping the glass.
"Well, we all do what we need to to get ahead." the woman says.
"Sure. I guess." you say, slowly stepping away.
"Hey, if you got it flaunt it." Ann says fondling your breasts.
"She's had a bit too much to drink." you tell the others, excusing her behavior.
The others laugh, and you notice the wedding ring on her finger.
She leans right into your face as she pasts your belly.
"Enjoy it while it lasts. The second you get a kid, you're stuck in whatever position you have." she whispers.
"Weren't women supposed to be supportive of each other?" you think, realizing that they probably see you as a threat, like Beth did.

Ann turns over to the other drunk ladies and ignores you. You slowly make your way through another room. Where there is a picture of her next to Big Mike. He didn't look so big then, and she looked so much younger.
"That explains it." your mind says.

You walk past a mirror, and even though the room is dimly lit, there is a giant mirror where you catch your refection. You hair is flowing and has some fancy locks fall down around your shoulders. The dress has a slit going right up to your waist, showing off part of your ass cheek. One of the shoulder straps is designed to keep falling down, and whoever did your make up looks like they spent an hour on it. Your petite mouth opens with a bit of shock, knowing that it's you in the mirror. You are overdressed for this. Your eyes keep blinking. Why has no girl ever dressed this way for you? You're clearly out to impress someone.

After the initial reaction, your mind starts to race, wondering how much farther the curse will go tonight. Will you relapse into losing control like you did yesterday or this morning? The fear starts to rise. Maybe you did make a mistake coming here.

You look in your purse for the phone to call Joey. You're not sure if you need to call him or not, but you just need to look at the phone. "The battery is dead, great." your mind yells after trying to turn it on. If the lights suddenly go out, you'll be convinced you're in a horror movie.

Then suddenly, you realize that you didn't think this through enough. You didn't have a solid plan for Joey to get you home.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Girl Problems

choices: This Is The Only Time You'll See Nick Like This, Have Some Fun With It
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Before you can break out in a cold sweat, you feel a squeeze on your hips.
"Hey." a familiar voice from behind you says.
You look up into the mirror, and see Nick standing behind you. Your hair has become blond once again. You were so focused on the phone and your ride, you didn't notice him walk up to you.

"Hi Nick." you respond in cautious surprise.
Nick has obviously had a drink or who, it's given him even more confidence than usual, but also doesn't seem as energetic.
"I missed you at work today." he says as he starts to sway his hips against yours.
"I was sick." you tell him in a matter-of-fact manner.
"Really? Because you look like a million bucks." he says turning you around to face him.
"How did he do that?" your mind asks, as your hips start swaying in unison with him.
"So you're saying it took me all day to look this good?" you ask him in a sly manner. Hoping he'll slip up, embarrass himself and leave.
"No, I'm saying to look like you have a healthy glow. And as far as beauty goes, it may have taken other girls all day to dress up like you. But you, I'm sure it took an hour, tops."
He starts slowly moving his feat from side to side, and you realize you're following his lead. Your heart starts to flutter a bit, and you realize how embarrassed you'll be if someone were to talk in on you right now. Your heart races and you feel excitement.
Nick's hands start to tighten around your back, and you realize that you're almost slow dancing.

"Nick, what are you doing?" you ask, stopping yourself.
Nick slows down his sway for a bit to. There was no music. There was no real reason for dancing. You can see his eyes refuse to focus on yours as he thinks of an excuse.
"I...I..." Nick tries to say something, but can't.
The swaying stops, and a small part of you misses the motion. He then leads you be the hand and sits you down in the chair.
You can see it in his eyes, there is something in Nick's mind that he's struggling to let out.
"I'm sorry." he finally tells you, breathing heavily as he does.
"I don't understand." you say.

"I don't know what came over me. I swear, I'm not usually like this. I just saw you all alone, looking like---that, and felt compelled to make your night magical." he says.
"Believe me, I have enough magic in my life." you want to say to him. But something stops you, you've never seen Nick like this, and you don't want to hurt him with a snide remark when he's letting out his feelings like this. You're not sure if that's the curses doing, or you just trying to be a good human being.
"Clair, ever since I first saw you, I thought that you were the most beautiful woman that I've ever seen. The first day in the office with you, I thought you were one of the best business women I've ever seen." he says. It's taking a lot out of him to admit this.
Your heart is beating hard. This is the first time in forever someone you respect is saying you're good at business.
Nick is there biting his lip, trying desperately in his head to think if he should say what's coming next. You can feel your folded hands on your lap, with one hand squeezing your other wrist in anticipation. It almost sounds like he's going to propose to you.
"I don't know how to put this, but Clair, I look up to you. Not just as a woman, but a person. And I want to know how to be worthy of you."

"Holy shit, is he proposing?" you mind races.

You star at him, almost unblinking for a minute.
"Nick, I..." you say, as he puts his finger to your lips.
"Please, Clair, just another minute. That way, even if whatever comes next is a disaster, we'll always have this moment."
"Wow, that was corny. But it kind of worked." your mind silently admits to itself. "I am a male, and totally not gay." you mind starts to repeat over and over.

A few seconds later, Nick pulls his finger away from your mouth. "Okay, now you can talk now." he says.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Nick Confesses

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
As flattering and creepy as his speech it, it does sound a bit rehearsed. Your heart is racing though, despite all mental objections, your body seems to be very much appreciating the attention.

"Nick. I think you're a nice guy..." you see in his eyes that his heart is tearing a bit.
"but I don't know how I feel about you right now." you say, finishing your sentence is a way you never meant to do. "I've only known you a week." you say. Pausing so the awkward silence can take effect.

"But you were all over me yesterday." Nick says.
"I...I was going through some things yesterday Nick. I'm sorry I hurt you."

Nick holds his head and walks to a nearby chair to sit down.

"I totally misread you." he tells you. "My job is based on my ability to read people."
"Are you okay?" you ask as you get up and walk over to him.
"I'll be fine." he tells you with a hurt smile.
"He'll get over it." your brain says.

"It's not you, it's me, I'm just not ready for this." you tell him, using one of the most cliched lines in breakups. Not that there was anything to be broken up.

"Clair? Can I just be alone with my thoughts for a minute?" Nick says.
"Sure." you say, slowly backing away and exiting the room.

You see your hair start to shorten and become darker as you walk back into the main living space.

"Clair." says a voice from behind you.
"Jerry." you say in false surprise.
"I'm so glad you could make it. Are you enjoying yourself?"
"Absolutely." you say with a straight face.
"Hey, Clair, don't let this go around, but a few of the higher ups will be talking business in Big Mike's hot tub. If you could join us, I'd appreciate it." he says.

"Of course." you say without thinking.
"Great." Jerry says.
"Oh, were can I change?" you ask him.
"There is a bathroom up the stairs at the end of the hall." he says as he turns and walks towards Nick.

You peek into your purse and see the two piece bathing suit still there. "Well, I'd better get changed." you say in your head as you turn around to see yet another office worker.
"Clair." a cold voice says.
"Beth." you say back with equal coldness.
"I'm surprised you came today. You know, after missing work and all."
"I was sick." you tell her.
"Oh, I missed school too the day of my prom. Of course I wasn't overdressed for that occasion."
"You found someone to take you to prom?" you say in disbelief.

Beth looks pissed at you but doesn't say anything. You honestly don't mean to be this cruel, but around Beth, you seem to lose control of your actions.
The two of you are in a stare off, until you realize you have nothing to gain by staying in it and head upstairs. With any luck, you can throw on the suit and sneak out the back before someone else recognizes Clair.

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You walk up the stairs, and walk into the bathroom, shutting the door behind you. You feel the instantaneous shift to being male again, and a look in the mirror confirms your present state. You're now wearing a pressed shirt and dress pants, with the wallet in the back pocket, and the two-piece bathing suit in the side.

You pull the suit out and take a deep sigh. It still felt weird knowing that you were going to put it on. You slowly take off your clothes and start to slip into the bottom half.

You look in the mirror and feel utter humiliation as it's currently WAY to tight on you, and your junk is partially hanging out.
With a squeeze of your eyes, you decide to throw on the top and get it over with.

Suddenly there is a knock on the door, and before you can answer, it swings open.

"Bit.." Beth stops halfway through the word.

Beth turns around to look at him, and you feel yourself instantly transform.

Beth looks back towards you and almost jumps back. She's looking at Clair, who is in the action of covering her breasts.

"Clair, wha..." she stops and she instantly makes the connection in her head.
"I can explain." you tell her.

Beth slowly shuts the door, placing herself in the bathroom with you.

You lick your lips a bit. They taste mildly like cherry.

"How could it possibly be what I think. How could you know what I'm thinking? One second I see an old co-worker in women's swimwear. The next I see the office slut."
"Trust me, I know it's a lot to take in." you say in a calm voice, but Beth doesn't seem to want to be rational.
"Yes, the woman at the office who constantly made me miserable this week is really a guy. The strange shallow creature that men flocked too in seconds is really a man. And not a feminine man, she's you. Guys prefer you over me." she says, starting to work herself up into a rant.
"I don't like their attention any more than you do." you try and tell her.
"And why are you dressed up to go swimming?" she asks, and then she stops herself, the answer coming into her head. "They invited you to talk shop." she says.
"Beth, please don't..." you say, but it's too late. Beth lets out one last burst of emotion.
"Fine CLAIR, I hope your little whore mouth does whatever it needs to to get ahead." she yells as she walks out of the bathroom, slamming the door behind her, causing you to turn back into a guy.

She wouldn't even listen to your side of the story.

"Women." you say is disgust. "She's probably PMSing." you convince yourself.

Suddenly you feel a jolt as your leg reflexes to something touching it. You look over and Nick is raising his eyebrows again. You look back at Beth again, who seems to smile in approval.

Everyone is squished.

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Blacking Out

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Still dizzy and exhausted, you slowly walk up the stairs and head towards the bathroom. Beth locks the door as you grab your clothes.
"Beth, what are you doing?" you ask her.
Beth leans over you.
"You liked that you little slut." she says.

"Because I'm not a woman. I have a man's mind. And all of William's memories." you tell her.

You look in the mirror, your hair is a dark drown.
"When I look in the mirror, my hair is dark brown." you tell her. You look sincere, but she might think you're putting on an act.

"You want proof? Look outside, if there are no men there, close the door with you on the outside. Then walk right back in." you tell her.
"And if there are men there, you want me to leave so you can pleasure them?" she asks harshly.

You really try your best not to hold this against her. She's obviously hurt, but she is getting on your nerves, and you don't know how much longer it'll take before you're hostile again.

She contemplates it for a few seconds. "Fine." she says, as she opens the door and steps out. Closing it behind her.

As the door shuts, you become William again.

She cautiously does.

"I don't believe in magic." she says defiantly.
"Fine, science that no one understands yet. I pissed of the wrong woman and this happened."
"So, how does it work?"
"I'm not 100% sure. Have you ever watched a werewolf movie?" you ask.

"No, but I know about werewolves." she says.
"It kind of works like that. Except I don't change in the full moon, I change whenever a guy is in the area. And I always look like whatever he wants his perfect woman to look like. But I think women always see me as they first see me. Even if another guy alters me." you explain.
"That's kind of messed up." she says.

You nod your head really quickly.
"Sometimes I don't have full control either. Like when you're around, my body sees you as a threat or something, and I say a bunch of shit I never want to."
"So, are you, fully operational, or is it just an illusion?" she asks. Her rage has significantly dropped, and her curiosity is taking charge.
"I haven't gone to the gynecologist yet or used a tampon, but near as I can tell, I've got all the plumbing."

You both sit quietly.

"Do you like being a woman?" she asks.
You stop for a minute wondering how to answer her. You don't want to insult her, but you don't want her to think you like it either.
"It, can be a pain." you finally let out.

"So do you know what caused it? Like an answer that is more than just magic."
"As far as I know, it's a hygiene spell some ancient tribe you never heard of used on ugly daughters so they could get rich husbands." you tell her.
"I see." she says, and her face changes to another expression.

"Can you answer my questions?" you ask.
She nods in approval.
"Why were you so upset earlier?" you ask.

"Not by choice."
"I know that now!"
"If you had listened, you would have known it then."

Beth is starting to pout. She'll probably do something stupid if you don't calm down the situation.
"What did you tell Nick?" you ask her.
"What do you mean?" she says, denial in her voice.
"I mean, after you left the bathroom the first time, what did you tell him?" you ask.
"He told be about how you rejected him. I told him you talking to me while changing and told me it was the biggest mistake of your life."
There is another awkward silence.

"Why would you say that?!" you yell.
"Because you hurt me, it seemed like vengeance." she says, here eyes avoiding yours.

You take a deep breath. That whole hot tub fiasco was set up by her. You feel like punching her. But will probably wait until the curse kicks in to do it.

You get quiet again. It's a fair question, but you know Nick would hold it over you forever. And probably not believe you, and probably send Clair to some stacking position where he wouldn't need to see the crazy lady again. And you needed to ensure the Denver Project was properly pitched to keep your job.

You both sit wait around in the bathroom for a minute. Beth keeps looking at your junk partially falling out of the swimwear.

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Q & A With Beth
