In all the other times, it was either the guy that initiated the kiss, or the curse pushing you to make lip contact. In this instance, the action seemed to be mutual. Was it the heat of the moment? Anne and Joey seemed chemically charged. Was that feeling contagious? Did you not want to be left out?

The fact that you weren't outright disgusted by it is also hurting your brain. If this happened a week ago, you're rinsing your mouth out with some sort of acid. Now, you kind of just went with it. Maybe this version of the curse was subtler at manipulating your libido.

So in thought contemplating the situation, that you're startled when Joey walks in on you.
"Knock next time." you yell, your heart racing.
"Door was open, and besides, it's not like you transform whenever I see you."
His comment brings back a flood of unpleasant memories. "Thanks for that Joey." you think to yourself.
"What do you want?" he asks.
"I called Anne, she has the night off." Joey tells you.
"And her brother..."
"...is visiting their parents." Joey tells you.
"Then why are you telling me about this? What's your angle?"
"Because I'd like the car, we're going clubbing."
"Clubbing?"
"Ya, to the same place we did last weekend." he tells you,
"So you want me as a third wheel?"
"Hey, I just wondered if you wanted another chance at confronting the Goth chick." Joey says.

You look down at yourself, you haven't changed into a girl in over a day. This (altered) curse is defiantly preferable to what you had last week. Especially now that Joey has got himself a girlfriend. "But how long will that last?" you think to yourself.

You probably should try and confront her, but you need some sort of plan. The last two times she saw you she toyed with you like you were nothing.
"Maybe Joey knows more about magic." you think.
"Joey when you looked up my curse, what did you find out about magic? you ask him.
"Not much." he shrugs. "Sorry, I wish I was more help."
"So if I go, I'm at her mercy, but if I don't go, she might think I'm fine like this and leave me. Or get bored and not show there in the future. Or a hundred other things that might go wrong." you say.
"What do we know about her? She cursed you twice, for all we know she's outright sadistic, and thought that this version of the curse would make your life harder, not easier."
"Maybe she has a moral center and will regret her actions." you suggest hopefully.
"Maybe, it's your call man."
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Saturday Afternoon

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Three hours later, you enter the club, right behind Anne and Joey.
Anne finally met you again, for the first time, in the car on the way over here. Funny enough, one of the first things she said to you was that you seemed familiar for some reason. You response was something along the lines of meeting her in another life. At least Joey thought it was witty. However, there are times when Joey thought watching Jello wobble was the height of entertainment. In other words, the bar was set pretty low.

In the bar, you wait to see if you can spot the goth anywhere. Nothing.
You manage to squeeze in a dance with one of the girls on the groove floor. It's great, you're the pole, she's the stripper. It feels so nice laying back and being the man in this situation. The young woman rubs herself against you, trying to impress.
You even offer to buy her a drink. She refuses, but you got what you wanted out of the exchange.

You try and keep your distance from Anne and Joey. You know that Joey can be a bit crude when he's around other guys he knows, and you don't want him disgusting Anne with inappropriate humor yet. An hour passes and you're on your third beer. The buzz just starting to come over you.

Then you see her. She is not wearing black, or make up, but it's clearly the goth chick that was the cause of all your problems in the past life. She walks by you, and doesn't notice you. Why should she notice you, she saw you as a man two weeks ago for a possible total of five minutes before turning you existence upside-down.

You take a seat in an empty chair, on the far side of the bar. Some slob comes towards her, and sits down beside her. She nervously talks to him before he whispers something in her ear.

A second later, you hear a slap over the music, as the slob is holding a red cheek, and he gets up to leave.
"That's it? That's all he gets?!" you mind shouts.
The slobs leaves, and the seat beside her opens.

"I'm going to have to play this cool." you think, realizing you probably got one shot at her while her guard is down.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Your Target At The Club

choices: Amber/Aaron Will Be Around In The Future
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"Hey." you say as you walk up beside her and take the free seat.
"Hello." she says in a nervously annoyed tone.
"I hope you don't let that slob ruin your evening. Some men are just pigs." you tell her.
"It's fine." she says, her hear facing the floor. She clearly doesn't want to talk.
"Are you okay?" you ask her, with a fake bit of sincerity.
"It's not you're problem." she says.
"I don't know, I might have more experience in certain areas of life than you think."
"I'm fine." she says.
You can tell by her looks and actions that she's not.

You stay quiet, not knowing what to do next.
"Can I buy you a drink?" you ask her.
She looks are you, unsure of anything.
"Trust me, it's not a pick up line." you say.
"Alright. I could really use a drink." she says.

You then order two drinks, one for you, and one for her, she gulps it down incredibly fast.
"I've never seen a girl drink that fast." you tell her.
You can't tell, but you think her face is getting a bit red as she looks down at her feet.

"How's your magic going?" you ask her.
"WHAT?!" she says, surprised.
"You honestly don't remember me?" you tell her.
"I'm sorry." she says.
"You put a curse on me, twice."
"Seriously?"
"Yes."
"THAT BITCH." the girl finally yells.

You stay quiet, that's defiantly not the answer you were expecting.

"Okay, can you explain to me what's going on?" you ask.
She just looks at you. Thinking if she should reveal the information. Finally she decides to share.
"Last Tuesday, I met this girl amber. We hit it off, I took her back to my apartment. She said she was into some kinky fetish sex thing, using chemicals, she takes some sort of stone out of her purse. The next thing you know, I'm laying on the bed, as she does some rain dance. The next minute, she asking me if I want her. If I want her breasts and body, I squeeze them, say yes, and and the next thing I know, my own body is holding me down."
"I'm confused." you tell him.
"My name is...was...Aaron. I'm a football player.
"She switched bodies with you." you say.
"She...she..." Aaron starts breaking down crying and leans over to hid her face in your arm.
"This explains what she was doing at the club the last two weeks." you think. Realizing that she was looking for a man to switch with. She probably just learned that skill. Or was really picky about who she wanted to be.

You look at Aaron, and embrace her.
"I know you're feeling better than you think." you tell her.
"You have NO IDEA." she says.
"My curse was turning into the perfect looking woman for any guy who looked at me." you say.
"Really?" she says sobbing.
"My newer curse is connected to one person."
"But you're a guy now."
"Yes, until the person decides he needs a woman for anything."
"Why are you telling me this."
"Because Aaron, I need you to cure me." you say, wiping a tear off her face.
"I don't know magic." she says.
"Can you just think that you can cure me, or go back to Amber's apartment, and we can look through some books."
"When I realized what just happened wasn't a dream, I broke into her...my apartment, it was empty." she says.

"Aaron, why are you here?" she asks.
"I found a note, saying I would meet someone here tonight, you would explain everything." she says.
"I hope that person isn't me." you think.

You wait until closing time, Joey, Anne and the rest of the people have left. It's 2am, and you're both waiting for any sign that someone would recognize you.

"Do you want to come to my place?" you ask her as the bar begins to close.
"Not really." she says.
"I swear I won't touch you." you tell her.
"I honestly don't feel safe around any men right now." she answers.

"You two will have to leave." the bartender says.
She grabs her purse and starts heading towards the door.
"Do you want to split a cab?" you ask her.
"I was going to walk home."
"2am, in that body, in this part of town. You're taking a cab." you tell her.

The cab ride is awkward, you let her say her address first. You make a mental note of her location before the cab takes you to your building. You give Aaron your number, but she refuses to give you hers. She probably doesn't even know what it is.

Maybe, just maybe, the connection to the curse is still connected to her body, and she can cure you, you hope.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Amber/Aaron

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Two weeks pass, and despite your best efforts, you're never able to find Aaron again. Her apartment was empty. She never called you, she just vanished, like she never existed. With her gone, and Amber in a male body, you've lost faith in trying to get one of them to cure you.

Unfortunately you're internet and library research have come up empty handed. Unlike the original curse, there is nothing about this one, and how you change based on the needs of one man. Your best guess is that it is the current curse is some sort of alteration of the Eye Candy Curse.

The only saving grace is that Joey is seemingly getting better at controlling the transformations, you've only changed once at work, and managed to sneak out until you reverted. The situation isn't ideal, but it's workable, something the first week of life as Clair was not.

Your only real changes come from when Joey needs your help cleaning. (Although you're beginning to suspect he just has a thing for women in maid uniforms.) Although you have no hard proof, you're convinced you transform when you're sleeping. It may just be paranoia, but you're dream distinctively take different turns halfway through the night.

Tonight after a heavy night of drinking, you awake on your bed to find that your fears were confirmed. Two breasts push down against your chest as you seem to be dressed as some sort of cowgirl, or buckle bunny, or whatever they were called now. You stand up to see Clair dressed up as a hot rodeo gal, a lasso around her hip, light cut off jeans clinging her her thighs, and a t-shirt, which is tied around your breasts.

You walk into the bathroom, and sit on the toilet, which was the whole purpose of why you got up. Was Joey really thinking about this scenario this late at night, even after he promised you he wouldn't.
After wiping your ass, you pull up remains of the jeans, and in your boots, walk across to his room. Ready to rip him a new one.

As the door creaks open, you see that Joey is snoring on his bed.
"He's dreaming about me." you mind realizes. He didn't break his promise, but you just realized how much more complicated this curse has become. You're a walking wet dream.

"This is bad." you realize. If you change every time Joey dreams of Clair, keeping the secrets of your transformation might become impossible. You're now at the mercy of Joey's sleep patterns. If he or you travel to another continent, your routine is screwed. If he's had a late night and passes out while your at a meeting, it's all over.

As you lay back on your bed, you realize how hard it is to sleep with this clothes on, yet, no matter how hard you try, you can seem to take off any of the clothes, except the hat. They're stuck to you, as long as Joey dreams of you having them on. Thankfully, you can move them around a bit, as long as they're touching your skin in the appropriate areas, but it's still a small comfort.
Then slowly, one by one, all the clothes except the boots disappear.

You feel a sinking sensation in your heart as you realize what this means in Joey's dream. At least laying down on the mattress is more comfortable, however, the new found disgust you feel towards your body, and your best friend, stops you from being able to sleep.

Two hours after the sun rises, you revert back into Will. "I probably should have woken him." your tired mind realizes.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Two More Weeks Pass

choices: Skip To The Next Big Event
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"Hey Joey." you say as he comes out for some coffee after his shower.
"Hey man, you look tired." he says.
"I couldn't sleep last night." you tell him.
"Really? I had a great sleep." he tells you.
"You must have had a pretty good dream."
"I honestly don't remember dreaming."
"Really? Think harder. Did it involve a rodeo?"
Joey actually contemplates this for a minute before he realizes what you're getting at.
"Oh shit." he says.
"No, hey, if I had a hot babe like Anne, I'd still cheat on her in my dreams." you mention in an annoyed yet casual manner.
"I CAN'T HELP WHAT I DREAM!" Joey yells in his defense.
"I'm not blaming you. I'm just hoping, probably beyond hope, that you show some self constraint in your dreams. Especially if you see a woman who looks like Clair.
"How? How can I do that?!" he asks.
"Figure it out, for the sake of my sanity."

You suddenly feel a draft as you look down and see yourself in skimpy clothes, and a model's body.

"WHY?!" you ask Joey.
"I don't know, all this pressure you just put on me. My mind wanted to look at a pretty woman. You know, get it out of my system."

"Dammit, Joey was doing so well." you think. This was probably his way, subconscious or otherwise, to tell you to back off.

You slam your door in frustration. The rest of the morning is relatively boring.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Joey Learns About Another Effect of The Curse

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Two months pass, and you still have no idea on how to get rid of the curse. With a few hiccups, you're office work has gone smoothly. You've been promoted to Nick's position, as Nick has left for a rival company. Beth has become your personal assistant.

"More coffee?" she asks as she places a cup down on your desk.
"Thanks." you say as you take a sip.
"You haven't changed for over a week." she mentions. She's helped you stay out of trouble in the office when the curse takes effect before. And each time, you could tell she reveled in the adrenaline she got when you transformed. You've slowly got her up to speed on how the new curse worked and what triggered it.

She really saved your ass when Greg walked in to find you as a naked woman under your desk. It turned out that Joey had been sleeping, and well, the transformation happened. Greg just thought you were a prostitute Will was testing out for a party. Beth got him away from you, and kept the situation under wraps. Of course, Greg will occasionally ask you when you're holding your next party.

"Don't look disappointed." you tell her, as she seems rather bored with her daily routine.
"Sorry, I'm just tired today." she says.
"How are the other girls doing?" you ask her.
"The same, always the same. Most have figured out they'll never get promoted here."
"Ya, sexism sucks." you tell her.
"Hey, it got you this job over me."
"Hard work, and connections, and a longer term working here got me this position."
"Clair would have got it over me." she sighs.

She's right, but you don't comment on it.

"You ever think of starting your own business?" you ask her.
"Doing what?"
"I don't know, computers and stuff. Be your own boss."
"Why are you getting bored of me?" she asks.
"I just don't want someone unhappy working for me. Plus you don't really seem to have a life outside this office. Go on a date; have fun."

You see Beth thinking about it. She's got five years max, before he best-before-date expires.
"If you were in my position, would you do it?" she asks.
You think about Beth's lack of children and social connections. She's got little responsibilities, but little connections too. Plus she has a tendency to rub people the wrong way. And you're pretty sure she suffers from penis envy.
"I'd say no, but that's because I just don't want to lose you." you tell her.

"Thanks." she says leaning over towards you. You know the body language, she's attracted to you. You don't show signs of interest back.

"Can you look over these findings, and get back to me in 15 minutes?" you ask.
"Sure." she says, as the playfulness erodes from her face.


The rest of the business day is even more unremarkable than your conversation with Beth. And when a conversation with Beth is the highlight of your day, it means you didn't have a productive day.

As you drive to your apartment, and shut the door, you see Joey ready to greet you.
"What now?" you think.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Two Months Later At Work

choices: Skip To The Next Big Event
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"Dude, I'm engaged!" Joey shouts.
"To Anne?"
"Of course."
"That's great." you say.

The excitement ends surprisingly fast.

"What?" Joey asks.
"It just seems, soon. I'm not complaining or anything. But are you sure you want to spend the rest of your life with her."
"Have you seen her?! She's gorgeous. She's pleasant. If I don't get her now, she might realize she's too good for me."
Your about to try and comfort him, telling him he's worthy of her, but don't. He's probably right. She could do better than Joey, Joey couldn't do better than her.

"Ya, go for it." you tell him.
"So you're behind this?" he says.
"Totally. You should get her."
"Thanks, dude." he says as he gives you a hug.

"So am I the best man?" you ask.
"No, my brother will be. No offense, but it's what my parents want."
You feel your heart sink a bit with the news.
"No, that's fine, family first." you say, but you can't hide the disappointment in your voice.
"You'll defiantly be a groomsman." he tells you.

There is some celebration for the next two minutes as you open some beers.

"What?" Joey asks you as he sees you contemplating something.
"This means that you'll be moving out." he says.
"Ya, eventually. But we're not getting married until at least a year from now."

"And how are you going to pay for the wedding? You don't even have a job."
"Anne's parents are surprisingly rich, her dad is getting me a job at his company."
"So she's gorgeous, kind, likes you, and has money."
"She's good in the sack too."

For some reason, you hate the universe at this moment.
"Does she have a sister?" you ask.
"She has a brother."

You take another drink. There are memory cells about that date which need to be destroyed. Actually, it was a pretty innocent evening, but you want that stage of your life forgotten.

"So I probably need to look for a new roommate." you say to Joey, changing the subject.
"In about six to eight months."
"So this is the beginning of the end?"
"Naw, it's more like this is growing up."

Your beer glasses clink. Anne has been nothing but good for Joey. And they probably would have never met if it wasn't for your curse. At least some good came from your misery.

You look around at your apartment. You're probably making enough money upgrade to a better place. One of the main reasons you moved into a two bedroom apartment was to have fun with Joey. But in the past two months, you've been working too much to have any real fun, and Joey has been spending most his free time courting Anne. Both him and you are moving in separate directions. This stage of your life is probably coming to an end.

"Maybe I should start dating again." you think to yourself.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Joey Announces He's Engaged

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Dating is harder than you thought it would be, after looking at hot women sitting across from you, you can't help but feel the shame you'd get from being in their position. It seems to be an post traumatic effect from your curse. Despite your best attempts, you can't help but think that there is a small probability that the girl has been cursed into liking you. You're now on a date with the forth girl you've met this month.

"That bitch ruined my life." you think, as a beautiful young woman flirts with you from across from the table.
"What's wrong?" she asks.
"It's nothing." you tell her.
"You seem a million miles away."
"Sorry Janice, it's just been a tough day at work. We've had a few big decisions to make. Some people are getting laid off."
"That blows." she says as she leans over, making her cleavage impossible to ignore.
'Ya, totally. Did I tell you how pretty you look tonight?"
"Twice."
"Is that all?"
"Hey, I don't mind, you can tell me that all night."
"All night, huh?" you say as your eyebrow raises. She raises hers in turn and takes a sip from her drink.
"So why don't you tell me about yourself?" you say with a gulp as her foot touches yours under the table.
"Me? Oh, there isn't much to tell. I'm just a girl looking to make her way in the world."
"And you're looking for a man to make it with you." you say, half playfully, half jaded.
"For tonight at least." she says as she snaps a bread stick in her mouth.

Two hours later, she's given you her whole life story, and despite your reluctance, you're having a good time. You can't remember the last time you went out and had this good of a time.

After dinner, you drive up to her building.
"Thanks for dinner." Janice says to you.
"Thanks for the fun evening." you say, as you unlock the car door to let her out.
"The evening isn't over, yet; that is if you don't want it to be." she says biting her lip.
"Holy shit, I might get to sleep with someone as a man again." your mind thinks.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Dating Janice

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"What's the point of being a man if you can't have fun with a willing woman every now and then?" you think as you accept her invitation to head to her bedroom.

She grabs you by the hand and guides you through her halls until she unlocks the door at the very end of the fourth floor.
"Here is my home?" she says, proud to show off her simple lifestyle.

She has a crappy computer and television. Not even your local donation center would take them.
The kitchen looks like it's trapped in the 1980's. In fact, the only decent looking area in the whole place seems to be her closet, which is overflowing with dresses and shoes that look like they haven't been worn more than once.

"At least it's clean." you think, and feel guilty for doing so. This girl probably didn't plan on inviting you back to her apartment, tonight. She must have felt something click, and was showing a side of herself that (hopefully) very few people got to see.

It doesn't look much like a woman's place, the colors are too cool, and there is nothing frilly in sight.

"Do you have a roommate?" you ask her.
"One bedroom apartment." she says.
"I hope that's a no." you respond in a dickish manner.
"You can be my roommate tonight."

She heads towards the bedroom.
"I'm going to change into something more comfortable. Make yourself at home on my bed."

You quickly strip off your clothes as you lie back on the bed and look up at the ceiling. "Tonight will be amazing."

Fifteen minutes later, Janice comes to the door, dressed in a pink translucent nightgown. You can totally kind-of see her nipples.
"I hope you're ready for a good time." she says as she licks her index finger.
"Oh baby." you say.
Janice gets on the bed and starts to crawl on you. She's eager to do most of the work, but you're wondering how much dominance you should show. You don't want to insult her, but being on top is preferable.
"So tell me just how powerful to are." she whispers in your ear before tugging on it with her teeth.
"As powerful as a pretty thing like you needs me to be."

The foreplay lasts for a few minutes until the grinding starts. She starts moaning prematurely and it throws you off for a second. You're not THAT good.

"It's been so long since someone made me feel like this!" she shouts. You're leaning right on top of her. Her eyes clothes and so do yours. In your head her imperfections disappear.

Fifteen minutes later, you role over, exhausted and spent. "I'm out of practice." you think.
"You've got more than that." she says.
"Janice..."
"It was a factual statement."

She roles on top of you and slithers towards you legs.
"Janice..."
"Relax and shut up. I want too." she says as she starts to massage the area between your legs.
Your member starts twitching again, you're not as spent as you thought.

Janice leans down, taking her plump pink red towards you.
Seconds before making contact, the pressure you felt ready to explode is replaced by a warm moistness.
Janice lets out a quick scream and tumbles backwards off the bed.
"WHAT THE FUCK!" she says, almost in shock.
You look down and see Clair's naked body, which you're stuck in.
"I can explain!" you tell her.
Janice stumbled backwards to the door.
"How can you explain this?!" she yells, breathing heavily.
You sit up, your exposed breasts jiggling a bit as you do.
"It's a condition." you say softly.
"A condition?" comes her skeptical response.
"It's a curse, and before you ask, it's not contagious."
"So you pissed on a voodoo Aztec's graveyard or something?"
"Something like that. I got drunk and slapped a girl in the ass once." you tell her.
"So she thought making you a girl would be a curse. You think being a girl is a curse." she says.
"Being this one is. In my condition. Ya."

Janice shuts the door behind her and walks to the closet. "Put this on." she says as she tosses you her pajamas.
They feel great on your skin.

"You know they'll probably rip when I change back." you tell her.
"I plan on burning them after you leave." she says.

"So how often does the 'curse' take effect?"
"As often as a person I'm connected to needs a woman."
She looks at you piecing together the situation in her head. "And you turn back..."
"When his need is satisfied." you tell her.
Her eyes open cartoonishly wide.
"I don't have to be the woman that satisfies him, hell, he can satisfy himself." you explain.
Her eyes still remain wide open.
"I should have worded that better." you admit.
"And you're okay with this?" she says in disbelief.
"Well, it's happening less frequently, This is the first time in over a week I've changed. But I can't find a cure." you tell her.
"I have so many questions." she says.
"I wish I could answer them all." you tell her.

Over the next hour, you do your best to explain to her what's going on, and answer all of her questions.

"So knowing all that, are you willing to go on another date with me?" you ask.
"Ask me next week." she says as you grab your clothes off the floor, and head into the hallway.
"Thanks for the evening." you tell her, and shut the door before she can respond. It's better if you leave her alone to figure things out.

Walking to your car in your date's pajamas was defiantly one of the weirder moments in your life.
"I think she likes me." you realize.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Will Finally Gets A Girlfriend (Maybe)

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
As the seasons pass, you and Joey are driving up to the mountains for his last big vacation as a unmarried man. A nice ski lodge, where his brother and other best men will meet you.

The snow is falling thicker than you thought it would be as you drive. It's pretty empty this late afternoon, so full attention doesn't really have to be paid to the road, as you talk to Joey.

"So, is your sister coming?" you ask.
"No, she's staying over with my parents for some reason. How's Janice?"
"Janice, is Janice, she's getting more energetic recently."
"And she knows about your condition, right?"
"I think she's cool with it. In fact, she's bought a strap on in case she's already riled up when it happens. So PLEASE, PLEASE, call me to warm me if something is going to happen."
"Is the strap on for you or her?" he asks.
Then it hits you, you just assumed she'd use it on you, you never thought that it was for you to use on her. Strange how your mind always goes to you being on the receiving end of things as a woman. There's probably more than a little sexism in your ideas about what you're expected to do as a woman.
"I don't know." you say in a dumbfounded manner.

There is silence in the car as the wipers brush off the onslaught of snow.
Joey doesn't want to distract you as the snow gets this thick.
"At this rate, it should only take us two more hours." you tell him.
You pass a truck which is now stuck in a ditch full of snow.
"Should we help him?" Joey asks.
"Nothing we can do. Look, he has a cellphone. He's calling for some pick up truck now."

You drive on to see a number of people trapped at the side of the road. There must be black ice. You slow down. Your car isn't designed for this type of weather. "See if they need help." you tell Joey, as he looks out the door.
"There is a woman hanging up her phone in disgust." Joey says.

You slowly pull the car to the side of the road, and Joey gets out. You both immediately regret opening the door. An ice wind blasts Joey as he walks down to the woman's door. For a minute the snow is so thick that you can't even see him. You just hope no one swerves and hits you.
"Her cell phone is dead." Joey says as he gets back.
You open your phone and see if you can get any coverage. "Either the snow is too thick, or we're out of range."
"So, we can't help her?"
"Throw her a bag of snacks, and we'll call for help once we get out of this storm." you say.
Joey does, and you begin to drive in the snow once more.
"She said thanks." Joey tells you.

You have your low beams on, but it's pointless, you can't see anything.
"I'm going to pull over." you tell Joey.
"Sure, it's cool. I'll just call the guys to let them know we're late." Joey says as he opens his cell phone.
"Right." he tells to himself, remembering why the woman didn't call for help.
"SHIT." you yell as you hit a patch of black ice.
You try and swerve, but you're going a whole 360 before feeling a bump and drop in elevation.
The car falls into a giant wall of snow, cushioning your fall.

Like all the cars you had passed, you're now in the ditch at the side of the road.
"Are you okay?" Joey asks.
"Are you?" you ask him.
You both give nods to show that you don't have whiplash.
"Can we back out?" Joey asks.
You push the gas for fifty seconds. First in reverse, then forward.
You turn off the engine.
"I need to check something." you tell Joey. You open the door, and some snow falls through the side as you open it. You close it again.
