"Magical." he corrects you.

"Think I need a moment to sit down and rest." you tell him.
"Sure." Matt says, although in his face, you can see he's ready for more.
"It's these shoes, they're a killer on the feet." you explain.
"Oh sure," Matt says, as he goes off to get a drink.

Actually, the shoes didn't bother you that much, which itself is concerning you a bit, but you figured Matt would have no clue about how much pressure women could take in heels and believe your lie. You just wanted to talk to Janice.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: How Matt Got His Groove Back

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You sit down next to your date.
"Hey." you say in a very feminine voice.
"You look hotter than me." she says.
"That's not possible." you lie to her as you feel her foot brush against your leg under the table.
"No, I think I'm getting jealous." she jokes.
"Believe me, I look much better dressed down." you tell her.
"Oooh, how about undressed?"

You both stop for a moment. Feminine intuition is telling you this conversation is being overhear. You and Janice both look over to see Ryan staring at you in disbelief.

All three of you remain silent.

"I didn't see you come with another dance, and thought you might want to dance." Ryan says very quickly and too the point.

There is another awkward silence. Janice face is smirking as you can tell she's holding in a laugh.
"I'm sorry honey, my dance card is full for the next hour." you say trying to let him down easily.
"Oh sure, maybe after that." he says as he walks away.

You forgot how much you have to lie when you're a woman.

Janice covers her face in her hands as she lets out a laugh.
"It's not that funny."
"Yes it is." she snorts.
You let off a smirk yourself. "Okay, from your view, I can see why it might be funny." you say as you let her hold your hand.

"Wow, who did your nails?" she says, tongue firmly planted in her cheek.
"Shut up." you retort.

"Clair!" a voice from behind you cheers.
You turn to see the bride coming to give you a big hug.
"Anne, I'm SO happy for you." you say as you embrace each other.
"Oooh, I haven't seen you in ages. I had no idea Joey invited you."

"I thought it might be awkward, I heard Matt was dating someone else and didn't want to cause a scene." you lie.
"Oh, he was married to his job, now he's looking for 'other' pursuits." she says with a wink.
"He looks happy." you say, as you look up and see him sitting by himself, drinking right out of a wine bottle.
"It's the happiest I've seen him all month." Anne says ignoring his action.
He looks up at you, and you and Anne both wave cheerfully at him.

"Trust me, seeing you was just what he needed." she says.
"Well, it's nice to be needed." you say, trying hard not to let out a sigh.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: More Girl Talk

choices: Go Back Home And/Or Do Another Time Skip
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Anne's attention is diverted from you as one of the bridesmaids wants to talk to her. Looking around to ensure Ryan is nowhere in earshot, to continue talking to Janice.

"So when are you transforming back to your sexy manly self?" she asks.
"I was kind of hoping that would have happened by now."
"And Joey is the one that makes it happen?"
"Kind of. Joey is the one that initiates the transformation, he needs something done, and I change until it gets done, remember, I told you all this before."
"So what did Joey want done this time?"
"I think he just wanted Matt to have a good time at the wedding...what?" you stop talking as you see her analyzing your face.
"Oh nothing, it's just that that's a great make up job. You're going to have to give me some pointers."
"I hate having to constantly stop my hand from touching my face." you tell her.

Another silent moment later and you realize that Janice is sizing up your boobs.

"I'm going to go find Joey." you tell her as you leave the table.
As you walk into the hallway, Gus, the groomsman stops you.
"I know you." he says.
"I don't need this." your mind thinks.
"You're the stripper!" he yells, pleased he matched your face to that occupation.
"Well tonight I am Anne's guest." you lie.
"That's awesome man. Takes balls to be the entertainment at a bachelor party of your friend's fiance."
"You have no idea."
"You look great by the way, really high class tonight. You want to go to the open bar over there? I'll get you a drink."
"Actually, I just want to talk to Joey." you tell him.
"Oh, he's right down that hall. He's a bit drunk though."
"Thanks."


As you see Joey, you quickly pull him away from the other men around him.
"Joey, I did what you asked, why haven't I changed back yet?"
"I don't know." Joey says, passively."
"Joey, this is very important, what where you thinking would happen when you caused the transformation?"
"I just wanted Matt to have a good time."
"Joey, what were you thinking a good time was? We had a slow dance. It was humiliating, he felt better about himself. Now I want to dance with my date, and can't." you tell him.
"Look, Matt feels like a bit of a freak, and is afraid people are only talking to him out of pity. I just thought that your last date went well enough, that, you know, he'd feel..."
Joey loses his train of thought after that.
"Make Matt feel normal. Is that what you're telling me?" you ask.
Joey points his finger at you in a way that says you got it.
"Now babe, I'm back to my adoring public." he says as he swaggers back towards the group of alcohol filled men.

"Hey, where did Will go?" one of the guys in the group says.
"I'm sure he's close by." Joey answers before giving a wink at you.
You almost smile at how corny that line is in context, but then stop and convince yourself you're mad at Joey.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Can't Change Back Yet

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You sit down next to Janice, who is taking another sip of a girly looking drink.
"Want a sip?" she asks.
"I don't drink like this." you say, shutting up immediately after. Your mind flashes to the night you and Joey both got drunk and he forgot you were a man.
"More for me." she says.

"Janice, the curse isn't letting me change back until Matt over there feel attractive again."
"Oh." she stops as she realizes what that means.
"Judging by his mood, it seems..."
"I get it, you'll be stuck like this until around midnight." she says.
"If you want to head back, I understand."
"It's alright, it's an open bar, and I enjoy watching you squirm." she says with a playful hint of seduction.
"Thanks for making this, less awkward." you say.

"Your not getting up." she says.
"This isn't natural for me. I have to build up courage to do this."
"That's not going to make Matt feel very attractive." she says.
"Shut up." you say as you finally stand up and walk to the back corner of the room again.

"Hey Matt." you say is a playful tone.
"Ready for more dancing?" he asks.
"I never wanted to stop." you lie, as he gets to his feet.

A few minutes on the dance floor, one of the songs slows to a crawl, and you're pressed up tightly against Matt, as he leads.
"Hey Clair..."
"Yes?"
"I was talking to Gus while you were gone."
"Who?"
"Gus, one of the groomsmen."
"Oh."
"He said you had a sister that strips, is that true?"
You feel the blood rush to your head. You didn't want to be called out on this, especially by Matt.
"No, I don't have a sister. I'm the stripper." you whisper.
You feel the bulge in his pants get longer as it erects further.
"You don't mind, right?" you ask, already knowing the answer.
"Personally, I think you're too pretty for that type of lifestyle." he says as he whispers in your ear.
"Well I'm glad you're taking this so well."
"Maybe you can show me some of those moves on the bedpost tonight."
"Can't wait." you whisper back as you break eye contact with him.

There aren't many people on the dance floor right now, both the Bride and Groom are in separate areas. Janice seems to be the only person really focusing on the two of you.

"You're a great dancer." he says.
You remain silent, if you respond, he'll just keep hitting you with compliments.
"Clair?"
"Yes?" you ask looking up at him.
"I..." he starts to say before you feel his lips press against yours. You close your eyes and imagine you're kissing a woman. It doesn't work.
As you both pull back, your heart is racing along with your mind. Too many contradicting thoughts and feelings are in motion. Matt looks at you like he did something wrong.

"Shit. If he thinks this was the wrong move, he'll feel like a failure again and I won't change back." you think.
Looking up at Matt, you go in for the second kiss.

As it ends, you spot Janice out of the corner of your eye. Her jaw almost hitting the table.

Another dance ends, and you use the excuse of your heels killing you to go sit down with Janice.
"Why don't you ever kiss me like that?" she asks.
"Why don't you ever kiss me like that?" you repeat.
"We are at the point where I'm counting this as you cheating on me."
"Seriously?! You're going to hold this against me?" you ask, hoping that she's joking.
"Only one thing to do..."
"Fake an emergency and leave?"
"I'm going to ask Matt to dance."

You shut up. If two hot girls asked you to dance, you'd feel great again. In her own way, Janice is helping you.

You watch her as she goes to Matt and tells him that her asshole boyfriend disappeared and left her here alone.
They get up and dance.

Two songs later, you're back to having a penis.

"She's a keeper." you think.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Back To Matt

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"Joey, What did you do?" you ask as you fall back into a chair.

It's been a year since Joey got married. He's since had a kid, a baby girl named Jane. You've obviously spent less time hanging around him, but stop in to check up on him every once and a while so that he doesn't forget that the curse is connected between the two of you.

He invited you over today, which wasn't unusual, but right now you feel like you're in a state of shock.

"Look Will, I'm sorry, I couldn't think of any other thing. I'm desperate man." he tells you.
"WHAT DID YOU DO?!" you scream. Your heart is racing. Something feels very off.
You look down at your body. You're wearing a very loose sundress. Your hair is down to your shoulders, and you're in flip flops.
Your breasts feel more sensitive than they usually do when you're a woman.

You feel mad, angry, sad, unsure and want to cry.
"Joey? What did you do?" you say in a much meeker voice.
"Look, it's not to bad, I promise it's just for today."
"Joey, what did you do?!" you ask as your hand instinctively holds your stomach.
Your stomach looks a bit larger than you;d expect Joey's ideal girl's stomach to look like.
Joey stays quiet, he doesn't need to answer your question, you know.
A tiny nudge is felt beneath your skin. You're with child.

"WHY DID YOU THINK THIS WOULD BE A GOOD IDEA?!" you yell.
"Hey, Anne's been depressed ever since the pregnancy. She's got no friends that have children, and her family is keeping a distance for some reason. I can't stand it, Will. I can't stand seeing her like this."
"WHY THE FUCK AM I PREGNANT!"
"Hey, I just wanted Anne to have someone to relate to for the day. All the rest of this isn't my doing."
"It's completely your doing!"

Joey thinks a second before talking. Being a father is clearly having an impact on him.
"Just give her someone to relate to, then the curse will change you back."

You are mad, but you want to get this over with as quickly as possible. "Fine. Where is Anne?"
You're about to stand up, but realize that you need some help. Joey grabs you and pulls you up.
"Anne's at the corner store, buying diapers. She'll be home in five minutes.

Every minute you're like this just feels wrong.
"Why didn't you just change as she came in the house?"
"I didn't think you were going to be pregnant." Joey insists.
"I need to pee." you say.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: One Year Later

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Ten minutes later, Joey's wife, Anne, pulls up in the driveway. She walks to the back door of the car and undoes the baby from her car seat.
"Won't she be surprised we have a guest." Joey says as he gives you an evil smile. You suddenly feel like eating a pickle.

"Hi Honey." Joey says as Anne walks up the stairs. "Would you like me to hold Jane for a while?"
"It's fine, I think she needs to be fed soon." She stops for a second as she spots you, her mind starts to try and picture who you are.
"Hi, Anne." you say meekly.
"Oh wow, Clair." she says with a pause. "It's so good to see you."
"I had no idea you had a kid." you lie.
"I had no idea you were having one." she responds.
"It was a bit of a surprise." you reply honestly, trying hard not to give an evil stare at Joey.
"What brings you here?"
"Oh, I was in the city for today, and you know, wanted to catch up with my friends."

Jane gives out a petite yawn.

"She's SO precious." you say in a completely maternal way. You're already coddling your unborn child in your mind.
"She's thirsty." Jane says as she sits across from you at the table. Anne than pulls down her dress, exposing her right nipple, and moves Jane's lips to it.
Joey gives you an harsh stare. You just got to see his wife's nipple. The idea of breast feeding isn't get pleasant to you right now. Your body already feels alien enough to you.
"Should I go into the living room for a bit?" you ask her.
"Stay girl. You'll be doing this soon enough. It's nothing to be ashamed of."

You sit still, Joey walks into the other room and turns on the television, leaving you two to bond. It's one of the most uncomfortable situations you've ever been in.

"Who is the baby's daddy?" she asks you.
"I'll let him tell you when he sees you again." you tell her.

There is another awkward moment of silence.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Table Talk

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
After about two hours of 'mother' conversation, both Anne and yourself feel exhausted. You can't wait to leave and get 'the thing' inside of you out. You wonder if it actually is its own life and will still be inside you when you change. The thought horrifies you and almost makes you cry. The stupid hormones in you also are jumping all over the place. You don't know if you'll punch the first guy you see or kiss him. It's infuriating. Who would want to go through this?

"You look like you enjoyed yourself." Joey says as he helps you out the door to your car.
"Never do that again." you tell Joey.
"Dude, look, I didn't think THIS would happen, I just wanted Anne to talk to someone she could relate with. I figure you'll change back once you start driving."
"Joey, Anne can never see Clair again. Clair won't have a kid, she'll ask questions. The spell just effects me, it's not going to create a child and a father for all your needs."
Joey remains silent.
"Feel this." you say forcing Joey to touch your stomach.
"It Kicked!" Joey says gleefully.
"Joey, this baby will never be born. It will never have a chance to grow old, it will disappear like it never existed."
"Will, it doesn't exist. It's just your body mimicking the actions of a pregnant woman."
"CALL ME CLAIR!" you shout, before suddenly stopping. The hormones are really confusing you. "You felt it kick!"
Joey takes a step back. "Just go home, it will be like this never happened." Joey says.
"Joey, we can't pretend this never happened. You made me pregnant!" you say, holding your huge belly.
"Just go." Joey says softly as he backs up the driveway.
"Joey, you know I'm never going to see you again." you tell him.
A bit of sadness comes over Joey's eyes, the thought that the baby he accidentally created for you will disappear is messing his his head, as a new father, too. "I'm sorry." he says.
"Why did you do this to me?" you say meekly as Joey closes the door to his house.

You struggle to get into your car and place the seat belt around you. Once successful, you back out and start driving into traffic, the tears finally being released from your face. Stupid hormones.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Leaving Anne and Joey

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
After the house disappears from your rear-view mirror, you (thankfully) return to your normal self. Something tells you that if you went home pregnant, Janice would freak out. With a sigh, you convince yourself that if you can't be cured, you should never see Joey again. The pregnancy thing was the final breaking point. He HAD to have known that that was a possibility, and he had gained enough control over his connections with the curse that it couldn't have been accidental.

You fart an amazingly numerous amount of times on your way home. And there is a hollow feeling inside of your gut, like you've just lost something that can never be regained. Clenching your fist and drying your tears, you swear never to mention this incident to Janice.

And with that, Joey is gone from you life for the next six decades.

From time to time, you hear of what's going on with him through neutral friends. You even stop yourself from going to Anne's funeral. You're not sure what killed her, but six months after, you were stuck in woman's form, and no matter how hard you tried, you always seemed to look way too much like a prostitute.

That six months absence cost you your job. And Janice.

Thankfully, you invested your money well in the stock market and were able to do a lot of work out of your house, thanks to new computer advances. Two decades after the pregnancy scare, you noticed one of the advantages of your curse. While your male body aged, when you turned into Clair, you never looked older than 30. Your bones and muscles seemed more limber too.
Once you reached the age of fifty, and were unable to maintain a healthy relationship because of your curse, you through respectability to the wind and even made some web videos as Clair. Selling them online for a nice little profit. Enough to live on, anyways.

It was only after you turned 80 that you got a hand written letter placed at your door.

It read:

Dear William,
I do not have much time left in this world, and before passing into the next, I'd like once more to see you and make amends.

-Joey

From other information left at your door, you realized that Joey was just a bus ride away and was expected to go any day now.
With a sigh, you wonder if you should meet him. You still felt an almost instinctive hatred for you, first for making you pregnant, and second, for destroying the baby in you. It was a maternal instinct to be sure, but it's one that hit you on a genetic level. You never liked how much control he had over your life. You were almost tempted to go down and see him, just to tell him off.

Your eyes get heavy, even thinking about the subject. You haven't turned into Clair for years. Maybe the curse has faded away. Maybe today really will be your last chance to let Joey make amends.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: About Five Decades Later (Time Skip)

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
The hospital smells sanitized as you walk down the hallways. There is still the lingering feeling of death behind the closed doors here, but it's hidden though the clean sheets and bright lights.

A young nurse smiles at you, and you give her a wolf-like grin that only old perverse people possess. You look at her the way men looked at you the week you became everyone's dream girl. Not that it matters, you are no threat to her, you can't even get erect without medication now.

Eventually you get to Joey's room and see him hooked up to all kinds of new age machines that do things your perverted old brain can't even comprehend.

"Joey?" you ask at the man in the bed, his eyes closed, old age blotches covering to much of him, and hair that is almost non-existent.
"Will?" he asks, as his eyes slowly open, and his head turns in your direction once more.
"You look like hell." you tell him.
"I can't even tell what you look like anymore." he says.

There is silence.

"I hear your a grandfather." you say.
"That's all I am. A ton of debt, and my daughter won't even see me."

There is more silence.

"I was never a good father. I was almost a good grandfather."
You don't respond.
"How are you living?" he asks.
"I'm living." you tell him.
"Single?" he asks.
"Stupid curse made it hard. It messed me up more than I realized."
"Sorry." Joey says.

It's what you wanted to hear. A legitimate apology.

"Do you think I could see Clair one more time?" Joey asks.
"Joey, you can't even see me." you tell him.

"So, when are they letting you out of here?" you ask, knowing full well he isn't going anywhere.
"I'm too stubborn to die. I've got at least another week in me. But no one to go home to." he says.
You want to respond, but don't know how.
"Do you need a roommate?" he jokes.

You laugh a polite laugh, but it takes to much energy to be anything other than somber. Too many of your friends and colleagues have passed away recently. And your beginning to feel like you won't hit 90. You're not even sure if you want to.

"So, do you want me to forgive you?" you ask.
"Hell no. There is nothing to forgive." Joey says cockily.
"You bastard."

"I actually wanted to ask you a favor." Joey says.

Without giving you a chance to respond, you feel your body change. You look down to see your wearing some sort of fancy dress. Your nails are painted and you have the perky breasts of a 17 year old girl. You can taste some sort of lip-gloss on your mouth. And you feel your heart race at a pace which it hasn't worked at in years. You're wearing heels again.

"I want you to take my grandson to prom." Joey says.
You look down at yourself in disbelief. You were never this young as Clair. You quickly move to the bathroom mirror. You're Clair all right, and look like you just got back from the beauty parlor, but you look a decade younger than when you first became her.

"How did you do this?" you ask Joey.
Joey looks too tired to respond.
Your wallet has even become a a tiny purse to match your outfit.
"Joey! JOEY! Answer me!" you shout.
"Is everything okay in here?" the nurse asks.
"I don't know." you say, surprised to hear her voice.
She walks over and does a quick check over Joey.
"He's fine." she says. "He's been fading in and out like this for months."
Joey has some new medical condition of this culture, which first got discovered five years back. You can't remember what it's called, but a lifetime of over-stimulation, and a poor diet, causes the effect when the people get elderly.

Without meaning to, you breathe a sigh of relief.
"You look amazing." the nurse says. She's the hot nurse you grinned at earlier.
"Thanks, it's prom night." you say, faking enthusiasm.
"Well I'm jealous of whoever did your hair."
You're blushing. Not that the nurse can tell under all your make up.

As the nurse finishes up and walks out, a young man walks into the room, he looks remarkably like Joey did when he was 19 years old.
"Hi, you must be Clair." he says.
"Damn you Joey, you set me up!" you think as you look at Joey lying on the table, probably unable to hear you, but sporting a huge smile.
"I'm Dan." the youth continues as he guides your wrists to him mouth and kisses it.
Your heart rate increases to a speed that would probably be bad for you if you were an 80 year old man.
"I'm Clair." you tell him.
"How did this kid not get a date?" you brain responds. Then you realize, you have the brain of a 16 year old girl, which just happens to have an extra lifetime of memories in it.
"My Grandpa said he was friends with yours, and that you were a classy lady who'd like a good time."
"I...I...ya, I'll want to go to prom, if you're asking." you say, and want to die.
"Hey, I'm not going to let a girl dress up for nothing." he tells you.

Your arms lock, and you're being escorted out. Joey's smile still glowing behind you.
"It's not so bad, right? One more night of youth. One more chance to dream and have fun." you think as you walk out.

You have no idea what kids are into these days, but if it's anything like your prom, it's going to be a wild night.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Your Final Talk With Joey

choices: A Note From Wanderer0426 (If he so wishes it)
Whatever Anyone Wants This to Be.  Questions, Comments, Whatever.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
And so the tale ends.

<insert credits here>

The following is some information from 'no one of notice' to anyone who cares enough to read it:

I hope you've enjoyed reading this tale as much as I've enjoyed writing it. I never thought that I'd write over 150 entries in this interactive story when I first started to continue the fun set up Wanderer0426 created, but the characters were enduring enough that I kept coming back to continue the story.

If you've noticed a major tonal shift from chapter/option #96 to this one, it's because there was. Major character's disappeared, there were major time skips, characters disappeared. The reason for this is because I wanted to do a sequel to the original concept, but didn't want start a new interactive story, and I wanted to do a Cole's notes type pacing, picking what would have been the highlights out of a fully realized story and showcasing them for any readers who were interested. In fact anything after Will/Clair meets the Goth is the club, after a week of the having curse, should be treated as a sequel or a spinoff. If you treat it as such, you should be able to have more fun reading the options and watching Will/Clair 'suffer' in creative ways.

So at nearly 175 entries (as I type this) do I plan to abandon this project? The answer is no. While I've completed all I intended to do (and more,) with this story, there are still bits that I believe could be improved. Now that the core story is finished, there are smaller scenes I'd like to add in alternative chapters, kind of like deleted scenes on a DVD (because they won't go anywhere).

If anyone wants to add to this, all I ask is two things;
1) Be inspired, and keep within the core rules set up at the beginning. Try and keep up the the quality and tone found throughout this interactive story.
2) Finish what you write. Don't leave an interesting plot hanging. Wanderer0426 & myself have done all the hard work, setting up atmosphere, characters, locations, and rules. Give your shot at how you'd end the story by choosing an option close to the end of the story and see where it takes you.

So that's about it, if you have any thoughts, constructive criticisms, ideas, ratings, whatever, please don't hesitate to contact myself of Wanderer0426 and let us know!
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: A Note From The Writer To You (Yes, YOU!)

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You’re not going to give Joey the satisfaction. He wants a deathbed forgiveness session with you to make himself feel better before he dies. Screw him! He had an incredibly hot wife, a beautiful daughter, was somehow successful at work, and had a better friend in you than he ever deserved. When he dies, hopefully your connection to him will be over, and you’ll never have to worry about this stupid curse again.

You make yourself some lunch, and sit down to watch a holographic computer projection that replaced television, and the internet. You may not be young anymore, but you feel young playing this. A device scans your eye and plays the program. You’re fighting dragons as a 21 year old version of yourself, back when you’re at the height of your physical power.

Next comes your favorite part, when you save the princess, and she is about to reward you. They did such an amazing job with mimicking the sensations of her touch. But before you can put your digital hands on her, the computer says ‘error’ and shuts down.

You are disconnected from the system, and all your physical senses return to you. You look down, and you are completely naked. Not just that, you are not you anymore. You see large breasts, and other feminine body parts, as your straight dark hair falls down to your elbows.

You run to the mirror, your naked feet slapping against the ground as you do so. You look into the mirror, and see a youthful face looking back at you. You’re not even sure you’re 18 years old.

“Joey!” you curse, as you race to pick up the phone and called the hospital. The hospital puts you on a runaround as they keep transferring your call from one department to the next. Finally, you hear a voice of a female doctor.

“You’re looking for your friend Joey?” she asks, and you confirm the last name, and birth year.
“Joey died last night.” she says, and your heart stops.
“Thank you.” you say, your hormones overtake you and you begin to sob.
The call ends abruptly, and you realize that this change occurred after Joey’s death. You’re connected to someone else.

As night comes, you realize you’re not changing back. It’s been years since you’ve remained a female this long. Sleep is hard as you toss and turn, trying to get into the perfect position, but it’s no use. Your mind overflows with concerns and worse case scenarios.

It’s only the next day, when you get a call from Joey’s lawyer about him leaving something in the will for you. You order instant on the hour clothes to wear for the funeral, and try and hide in the back, as a boy your own age can’t stop staring at you.

“What?” you finally confront him at the reception.
“Nothing. It’s nothing. You just look exactly like a woman I dreamed about the other night.”
“Is that supposed to be a pickup line?” you ask disgusted.
“Mayb…no.” he says gaging your reaction.
“I’m William.” he says shaking your hand.
“I’m…Clair.” you say defeated. After all this time, it still doesn’t feel right referring to yourself as Clair, but you can’t for the life of you think of a better name.
“How do you know my Grandpa?” he asks.
“Oh god.” Your mind thinks, as reality seems to crash down around you. This is Joey’s grandson, his closest living male blood relative. If anyone is effecting your curse, it’s probably him.
“I’m here to represent his friend William. Who was too sick to make it.” you say.
“Oh, I’m so sorry to hear that. That he is sick, not that you’re hear.” he corrects himself. “I was named after that guy.”

You take a close look at William. Against all odds, he does look a bit like you when you were a teenager or early adult. Was this some sort of twist of fate, or a side effect of the curse? Joey never looked like you. Of course you for large parts of your life, you didn’t look like you either.

The day after the funeral, you are gathered in the layers office for the reading of the will. It’s mostly boring speech, about the splitting up of his estate, until it comes to your part.

“And to my good friend William, who I have asked my daughter to name her only son after, to you I leave a box of artifacts that I have collected throughout my lifetime. Including my rare Menhitian books, which I have spent many countless nights translating.”

Your heart skips a beat. Maybe, just maybe he found something to cure you.

In the lobby, you look through the box provided. And start frantically flipping through the pages. Inside one of the pages is a note:

William. I never intended to make your life miserable, but I know I complicated it. I am sorry. Forgive me. To make it up to you, I have provided this ancient cleansing amulet. It will break your curse and return you to normal.

You sit down and think about this. You look at your body, and see the changes that had been made to it. Your nails are painted. You don’t recall that happening. You take a compact mirror out of your purse. You don’t recall buying that either. You open it to see that your make up looks like it was done by a professional to get ahead in an office setting. You quickly close the compact and slip it in your purse.

The curse is changing you again, but this time you’re not noticing it.

“Can I sit down?” asks William.
“Free country.” you say without thinking.
“Why did my grandfather leave yours that?” he asks, assuming you’re your own granddaughter.
“I don’t know.” You lie.
“It’s weird, he never liked reading or other languages, but my mother says that he’d spend four nights a week studying those books.”
“Today, we’d just get a computer to translate them.” you respond.
“Ya, this world we live in is amazing.” he says, as his eyes meet yours.

You stop for a moment, lost in them. Then snap out of it, and realize that he has a point. You’ve just got six decades of your life back. Well, maybe not your life, but six decades of youth. This is a new adventure, a new chance. You could could live life again, with the wisdom of your life as Will, but you’d still be effected by the curse.

You look at the amulet in your hand, all you have to do is squeeze it, and you’ll be rid of this curse forever, but then you’d also be an old man.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Stay Home

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You slip the amulet back into the box that Joey left you. William is not Joey, and if he is the one controlling your curse, maybe you’ll have better luck than you did in your past life. You’ve saved up enough money, and made enough contacts that you can get a new identity, if that’s what you want. And if the curse gets worse, you can always cure yourself later, assuming the amulet even works.

“This is an amazing time to be alive.” you tell him.
“Ya, I think my grandfather would have loved this decade.”
“He probably would.” you admit.
“Say, I know that this is a bit soon, and maybe not even appropriate so soon after the funeral, but I was wondering…”
“Yes.” You interrupt him without thinking. “I will go out with you.”
William seems taken back. He’s probably not use to girls being so forward.
“I…you’re not like other women.” he says.
“You have no idea.” you respond.

There is a silent moment of excitement between the two of you.

“Tomorrow night at eight.”
“Tonight at eight.” you demand. William blushes and shakes your hand. Then leans over for a small kiss.
“Just a small taste of what’s to come.” he says with a wink, and leaves.
“He reminds me of myself at that age.” you catch yourself thinking, panic at the implications, and then just shrug your worries off.

Joey may be dead, but today is the start of a new life.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Accepting Fate

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
The drive home is terrible. The baby is acting up, your eyes hurt from the tears, and your breasts feel more sensitive than usual, and not in a good way. Plus you’re hot. Why is it so hot? It’s the stupid sun going on your skin.

If that’s not enough, you have a craving for pickled ice cream chocolate.

The thought of the poor pickles makes you want to cry more.

“What is happening?” you scream through the sobs.
At a red light, you adjust your rear-view mirror, and catch your reflection again. Your lips are redder and fuller than you remember. Your skin seems to glow.

The baby kicks you again, and you feel a sudden urge to kick it back, before breaking down crying at what a monster you are for thinking that.

After what seems like an eternity of drivers honking at you, and giving you the middle finger, you finally make it back to your apartment building, where you find it much harder than you remember to walk up the stairs.

When you finally make it into the apartment itself, you quickly run to the bathroom.

After getting up from the toilet, you look at yourself in the mirror, and see what a hot mess you are.

“This will go back to normal any second now,” you promise yourself under your breath.

You then eat the remaining ice cream in the fridge, after topping it with pickles of course.
Looking down at yourself, you feel fat, and worthless, and just want someone to hold you and tell you that everything is going to be okay.

At the night goes on, things don’t get better. You take a bath, humiliated by how you look, and then try and get some sleep, although it is impossible to find a good position to lie down in.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The Pregnant Man

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
A sudden jolt passes through your body, before you're even done celebrating. You shut your eyes for a second, and open them to see that you're now a bit taller than Joey.

"What happened?" you say in an artificially soft voice.
Joey looks up at you, his eye both analyzing you and telling you that he wants nothing to do with this.
"What?" you ask.
Joey motions that you should look down. You slowly do. You have long pink hair, you can tell by the feel of it that it's a wig.
Your nails are a bright red, but your hands are clearly those of a man, although it looks as though all the hair on you has been waxed.
You're wearing a some sort of shirt that covers your chest, you're not sure what's under it, but its defiantly something artificial which mimics the appearance of boobs.
You're wearing a knee high skirt, with some nylons underneath, running down to your high heeled shoes.

You try moving, but it is difficult with your center of gravity, and no matter what you do, you can't help but feel your sack move around with every step you take. You shuffle your way over to the bathroom mirror.

What you see is not pretty. It is a face slathered in make up in a desperate attempt to hide any masculine features. It looks artificial.

You start running some water, and splash your face, figuring all the cosmetics will wash off. To your surprise, you notice no difference in your appearance after trying to wipe your face.

You tug on the wig, it doesn't hurt, but no matter how hard you try, you can't seem to take it off. Same with your shoes and shirt.

Thankfully, you can pull down the nylons and skirt, but it won't do you much good for anything other than sex or going to the bathroom.

"You're still a man at least, right?" Joey asks. You see his reflection behind you in the mirror.
"I guess so." you say, in your fake feminine voice.
"Maybe it will wear off."
"Maybe." you say quietly. You're not sure, but think you feel more self conscious now than at any point last week.
You take one step forward and fall as you twist your feel.
"I could you a hand Joey!" you yell.
Joey looks at you for a bit, before responding "Sorry, I can't."
"Joey!" you yell, in an almost soprano voice.
Joey is gone.

You look at your twisted ankle on the tile floor, every attempt to move hurting you.
"In some ways, this is worse than the other curse." you think to yourself.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Clothes Make The Man

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"Um, no." she says in an annoying fashion.
"No? NO! WHY THE HELL NOT?!" you ask her, trying hard not to punch her out.
"Because I enjoy watching you squirm." she says, with a sly smile.
"I did nothing to deserve this!" You say, almost chocking on your spit.
Her smile fades, she remains silent.
"Nothing." you say, almost bursting into tears.
"It's not that bad."
"You've seen my memories of last week, you've seen how this is progressing." you tell her.
"Well, then the good news is, in a week, you won't care." she says, taking a sip of whatever glass is in front of her.

You can tell in her eyes that she's hiding something. Your intuition tells you what you need to know.

"You can't cure me can you?!" you yell out, making sure she can hear you over the music.
The bass in the bar seems to pump louder as she looks back at you.
"I couldn't cure myself." she says, looking defeated.
Then it hits you, this woman must have had the same curse. But she doesn't look like your ideal woman. Something happened that she's leaving out.

Still, you've only been in this situation for a week, she spent a lot longer getting unwanted attention from men. No wonder she snapped when you slapped her ass.

You let out a giant sigh, trying hard not to let the tears flow. Without her being able to cure you, you're not sure how you could possibly get back to normal.

You get up to find Joey and leave. But before you get too far, you feel her cold hand on your shoulder.
"Wait..." she says.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Bad News

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"...There is another option."
"Another option?" you ask.
"I could freeze the curse." she tells you.
"Freeze the curse? What do you mean, Freeze the curse?"
"I can stop the curse as is." she says.
You look down, your breasts seem pretty large, you don't want to be stuck in this shape forever. Something tells you you'd get back pains.
"I don't want to be stuck like this." you tell her.
"It has a five minute delay." she says.
"I don't get it." you say.
"Five minutes, if you get out of the range of every dude, you'll return to normal, and stay that way." she says.
"What's the catch?" you ask her.
"Whoever you look like at the end of this, you're stuck as. You'll age, over time, like a normal person. But you won't change shape, or sex, or anything like that." she says.
"So, if the five minutes passes, and I look like this..."
"Then you're stuck like that, even when you're alone." she says.
"But if I'm a dude..."
"Then you'll never change back into someone's eye candy."

You think about it for a minute.

"That sounds fine, I'll just get my friend Joey to drop us off in a farmer's field, and we'll cast the spell." you tell her.

"I didn't think you'd agree to this so quickly!" she says, a look of dread coming over her face.
"What's wrong?" you ask.
"Once you agreed to it, the spell caused the countdown to start." she says.
"Wait? What?!" you yell.
"You've got less than five minutes to find a place where you'll turn back into a guy!" she shouts.
"Uh..." you let out.
"RUN!" she says.

You quickly try and shove your way through the dance floor.
"Sorry, I need to run." you tell people as you push them.
"Hey, watch it!" some guy says as he grabs your hand.
"I..I'm sorry." you say as you try and pull free. The guy isn't letting go.
"Not until you apologize!" the guy says.
"I did apologize." you tell him.
"I want you to apologize with your lips." he says as he starts to undo his fly on the dance floor.
"I don't have time for this." you think, and knee him as hard as you can in the crotch. It's a risky move, but the pain causes him to loosen his grip as you sprint as fast as you can in your heels, towards the stairs.
Once you reach the top of the stairs, you just kick off your shoes and throw yourself to the bottom.
You can feel yourself constantly change with every guy who looks at you.
"Please let one of these guys like athletic women." you think, hoping the curse will give you some muscles to make you run faster.

You cross the street. Almost getting hit by some driver as you do.
The bars and clubs are open, and there isn't anywhere you can really go without being seen by a guy.

You look around frantically, and see an alley.
You're hesitant to go in it. There could be thugs, or druggies or homeless people in there. But then again, it could also be empty, and right now that's you're only chance.

You sprint towards it, hoping no one sees you go in there.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Freezing The Curse

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You turn from one alleyway into another, and look at your watch, you've got about a minute left. You realize you're still female, and keep moving, hoping that in a few seconds, you'll never have a need to wear a bra again.

Thankfully, you're not seeing any pimps, drug lords, thugs or bums, or any of the other people society tells you to look out for in alleys.

You look at your watch again, thirty seconds left.
Panicking, you take two more steps, and that's when it happens. You become a man again!

You quickly hide behind some trash cans and pray they nothing happens in the next minute.

You count your watch as it counts down. 5...4...3...2...1...cured!

You stand up, but as you do, you notice something very wrong.

Long blond hair seems to fall to your elbows.
"No." you whisper in horror.
Something feels very different about you. Your clothes are still the provocative club clothes, but your heart is beating stronger than usual.

You take out the compact from your purse, and use the mirror to see your face.
It's hard to tell under all the make up, but it's clearly the face of a younger woman. You guess you're probably around 16 or 17 years old.
"This is not good." you think. As you start walking further down the alley.
Maybe the goth was wrong and you still have more time to make the curse freeze.

You walk down until you see a group of high-schoolers walking towards you.
"Shit." you think. One of them must have been within range to trigger the curse.
At least two of them are carrying skateboards, and they're talking about some video games until they see you and shut up.

"Damn." one of them says.
"Um, hi." you say, slowly trying to back up closer to the streets.
"Hey girlie, what you doing out here?" the larger one says.
"I'm, uh, just getting back from clubbing." you tell them, trying to keep your distance.
"Damn girl, don't you know these alley's aren't safe." says one of the guys.
"I'm beginning to figure that out." you tell them.
"Where your shoes at?" the fat one says.
"I...was mugged." you tell them.
"And the guy took your shoes?"
"Said he wanted them for his girlfriend." you say.
"Hey, do you go to our school?"
"Maybe, what school?"
"Central."

Your mind goes over if you should lie to them or not.

"Yes. Technically, if I ever attended class I'd go there." you tell them.
"A girl after my own heart." says the smaller guy.
"Can't you see the girls' been through a rough night." the tall one says to the others.
"Here girlie. We'll get you a cab." he says lifting you up off your feet, so that you don't have to walk on the pavement in your bare feet.

You're surprised at the amount of ease this guy picked you up. You stay silent, he must have been on the football team.
You blush like a school girl, thinking about how helpless you are.
Not only do you look nothing like Clair, but you're pretty sure you're under 17 years old, and the law will make you go back to high school.
That's roughly 10 years of your life you'll have to re-live, all the previous accomplishments in your life seem like they'll no longer help you.
On top of that, it seems you became the perfect looking girl for one of these bozos.

The next decade is not going to be fun.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Alleyway

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content: (Author's Note: This path is one of the most popular paths in the original stories, so I am letting people branch it out if they wish)
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Choices

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You rush into the alley. Your feet sorer now than they've ever been in your life. You don't care.
Looking around, you hope that desperately, you'll be able to change back.

You look at your watch. One minute remaining.
Your heart beats like it's never beat before. You look back and forth, desperately trying to see which area is the farthest from the street.
You take a left and go down another alleyway, praying that you'll change back into a male any second.

You look at your watch.

There are twenty seconds left to go.

"Just change." you think.

You look around. There is no one here. Why aren't you a guy?

You run past some trash cans and suddenly, you're a man again.

You look at the watch, there are only five seconds left.

Four seconds. Three. Two. One.

You look up and breathe a sigh of relief. You did it. You've beat this curse.

You decide to stay still for an extra few minutes in case the goth was mistaken, and you change back before it freezes.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Alleyway

choices: You changed at the last second, leaving you trapped.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You run out into the street, moving as fast as you can in your heels. You see an alleyway, but all the movies tell you that a pretty girl alone in a dark alley at night is a bad idea. Instead, you run down the road.

As you near the edge of town, you feel different. You look down and see that you're a dude again! You keep going, just to be safe.

As your internal timer is almost up, you feel a strange tingling within your body.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Out on the street. Like Bruce Springsteen.

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content: Unfortunately, a guy saw you just before the time ran out, causing your final transformation. But whose perfect woman have you become?
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Get used to it, CLAIRE.

choices: You're a cute but somewhat nerdy freshman girl.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content: This young boy saw you, sealing your fate as his perfect girl. But what kind of girls is he into?
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Back in time!

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"I'm sorry." she says in an earnest voice.
"You're sorry?! YOU ARE SORRY?!! If you hated your life so much, why did you try and give it to anyone else?!" you explode.
"It's not what it seems." she says.
"Really? Because it seems exactly what it looks like. How many other men did you do this too?" you accuse her.
"None. Just you. It's complicated." she says.
"You know what complicated? BEING A WOMAN WHEN YOU SPENT YOUR WHOLE LIFE LEARNING TO BE A MAN!" you yell at her.
Some guy who was walking towards you stops mid step and turns around.

"It's what I wanted to tell you..."
"Make this good." you say clenching your fist.
"I was trying to transfer it to you." she says, almost crying herself.
"What? Why do you think that will make me feel better?" you ask.
"Because, I can't cure myself, and transferring the curse from me only doubled it. But it could work on you." she says.
"Why, what makes you think this will be different?" you shout.
"Because I was born with this. The curse is entrenched in my DNA, but you, you've had it for a short time. I could probably give it to someone else!" she yells over the music.

You unclench your first.
Your mind races with the possibilities. You could be cured of it, but someone else's life would be made miserable.
"Could we give it to a girl?" you shout.
"It's random!" yells the goth.
"What do you mean it's random?!" you shout back.
"Within the next eight hours, the curse will jump to someone you've met over the last three days. That is if you want to try." she shouts.
"Like a stranger or someone I know?!"
"It's random, but they need to have made physical contact with you." she shouts.

You take a deep breath. You want to know more before doing this.
"I need to know now. You've been like this for a week, soon every hour will make the transfer harder and harder to do."
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: A Solution?

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You feel guilty for putting this on someone else, but you know you don't deserve it, and there is a decent chance that the curse will go to a woman. You decide that you're going to chance it and let the Goth transfer the curse.

"Fine. Do it." you tell her.
She looks into your eyes. "Last chance, are you sure about this?" she asks.
You look around, maybe one of the over muscled douche-bags dancing on the floor would get the curse.
"Yes." you tell her.

"Let me grab your arm." she says, almost looking disappointed in your decision.
You feel get grab it, and all of a sudden, the world feels blurry. You stagger back like you're drunk.
The Goth's words seem muffled. "Vhen you vake urp, it'r be drone." she seems to say.

The Goth then seems to disappear into the wavy blur encompassing you.

"<unintelligible>, <unintelligible>, I'm taking you home." comes a voice from one of the blobs around you.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Agree To Transfer The Curse

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Your eyes open, you mouth feels dry and drained. You start to wiggle you fingers and toes, scared that when you open your eyes, the Goth's words would have been a lie.

Eventually you become sick of not knowing and open your eyes. You lift up your covers and declare: "I'm a man again! I'm back!"

Quickly you jump out of bed. You're in your clubbing clothes, and smell like you need a shower. You don't care! Male hygiene is so much easier anyways, and the world seems to be more forgiving if you neglect it as a man.

"Joey! Joey!" you exit your room shouting.

You walk about half way across the apartment, with no response. "Joey?!" you ask.

All of a sudden fear grips you. Maybe he's not home. Maybe that's why you didn't change back!"

"Joey?"

You knock on his bedroom door.
"WHAT?!" Joey says behind the door. He sounds a bit hung over from last night.
"Joey! Don't you hear it?" you ask him.

There is a silence and then he pieces it together.

You hear him stumble out of bed as he makes his way towards you.

As the door knob turns...

(Who answers the door?)
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Wake Up In Your Apartment

choices: The Curse Changes Someone At Work
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
As the door knob turns, Joey stumbles out of his bedroom.
"Hey, you're cured! That's great!" he says, his eyes barely open.

You look at each other like you're both going to get a hug, and then decide against it. You're both carrying some morning wood, and don't really want to be near each other at the moment.

You go to the kitchen and eat some serial while watching cartoons on the TV. It feels good to unwind and not worry about the curse ruining your life.

"I wonder who got the curse?" you think to yourself. Hoping that it was one of the scummy strangers that hit on you whenever you were in public.

The idea haunts you a bit, as you fear it may have happened to one of the people who was nice to you, and respectful of your boundaries. You head starts wondering if you've made the right choice transferring the curse. That other person won't even know what caused the change. They'll have probably woken up this morning to a huge shock, with no way of figuring out what's going on.

Oh well, you try not to let the thoughts ruin your return to full manhood.
Despite it being Sunday, you go on the internet and check out some XXX rated websites.
You have a lot of catching up to do.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Joey

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
As you park your car, you walk towards the elevator, You notice Greg's car is there, but there is no one in it.
"I hope he's not waiting for Clair." you think, with the satisfaction of knowing he'll never hit on you again.

You enter the elevator, and head towards your floor.
Three guys enter it with you.
"Morning." you say, cheerfully. They give you no notice.
"Back to normal." you think,

You walk past Janice.
"Morning Janice." you say.
"Good Morning Will, I hope you're feeling better." she says as she multitasks.
"I feel like a whole new man." you tell her.
"That's nice." she says in her nasally voice as she goes back to whatever she's doing.

You walk to your cubical and sit down as your monitor boots up.
With a deep sigh, you feel like things are more or less back to normal. But something seems off. Now that you know how the people in this office feel about you, you're not sure if you're heart is still in this position.

"Excuse me." says a voice from behind you. You turn around to see a gorgeous woman standing tall behind you.
"Hi." you say enthusiastically.
"We need to talk." she says.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The Curse Changes Someone At Work

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"I'm sorry. I don't think we've met." you tell her.
"I've noticed." she says sounding a bit pissed off.
"Do I know you?" you ask.
"Well, walking into the office today, seven people called me Clair."
"My assistant, Clair?" you say with a lump in your throat.
"Beth called me Will." Clair says.

You stay silent, looking up at her. She's the more beautiful woman you've ever seen. No wonder all the guys kept trying to get with you.

"I realized that you and Clair were never seen together, and pieced two and two together." she says.
"I don't know what you're talking about, Clair." you say, playing innocent. In the back of your mind, you fear that whoever Clair is, she'll probably try and unload on you or screw you over if she thinks you did this to her.

"WHAT DID YOU DO TO ME?!" she says intensely as she leans down and grabs the shoulders of your dress shirt.
"Who are you?" you ask her.
"Don't you recognize me?!" she asks as she catches you looking at her breasts.
"You're Clair." you say, trying to smile, knowing full well that she might try and punch your teeth in. You can't resist though. Maybe you are as much of a dick as everyone says.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Clair And Will Finally Meet

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"I'm Nick!" she says intensely. Her eyes tell you that her words are no lie.
You're about to say something, but burst out laughing instead.
"Stop it. It's not funny." she pleads.
Your mind is going over all the garbage that you had to go through avoiding Nick's advances, and not you office's ultimate ladies' man is going to be on the receiving end of those.
After about a minute, you manage to control yourself.
"Sorry." you tell him.
"So you did do this to me!" she claims.

"No, it's nothing like that. The curse was random." you tell her. It's a half truth, but you don't want to give her an excuse to kill you.
"Curse?! What?!" she yells. At this point, you're sure someone else in the office is looking at Clair.
"It's a long story." you tell her.
"I'll make time."
"I bet you will."

She just stares at you.
"Will, if you were Clair, all last week, why didn't you just tell me?" she asks.
"Do you want to shout out to everyone in the office that you're really Nick?" you ask her.

She looks around, but doesn't answer. Embarrassed about her current situation.

"Relax, I know what to expect, we'll get through this." you assure her.
"Get through this, can't you just fix it?" he asks.
"Nick, if I could fix it, do you think I'd be putting up with your advances all last week?" you ask him.
Clair holds her forehead like it's in pain. "I think I'm going to be sick." she says.

"It's not that bad. Just reject everyone's advances, and keep praising my work on the Denver Project. The office knows she's not a slut." you say, neglecting to mention that one day last week when you somewhat lost control of your sex drive.
"Will, how can I even prove that I was in the office today?" he asks.
"I'll help cover for you." you tell him. "There are some tricks I picked up on."

Before the conversation can go any further, Jerry walks into view. Nick/Clair is looking at herself, and although she looks unchanged to you, you can tell Nick isn't used to being a combination of guy's fantasies, and the transformation catches her off-guard.

"Hi Clair." your boss says to Nick.
"Um..Hi, Mr. Gardner." she replies.
"For the hundredth time Clair, call me Jerry." he says as he puts his hand on her back.
Nick makes a little gasp, at the contact. This is the first time anyone's made physical contact with him as a woman.
"Oh, hi Will, I didn't see you there." Jerry says looking at you.
"I'm back." you say.
"Good, I hope you're feeling better."
"I am, Clair here was just filling me in on whatever I missed."
"Is she done debriefing you?" Jerry asks.
"Yes." "No." you and Nick both say in unison.
"I can figure things out from here." you tell him, giving a wink to Nick/Clair.
"Good, Clair, I think it's time you come down to my office. I want to talk to you about some favors I need done in return for that advance last week." Jerry says, looking at Nick with a wolf-like stare.
Jerry begins talking as he guides Nick towards his office.
You peek your head out and see Nick/Clair looking back, giving you a death stare, like she plans to kill you.

You sit back in your chair and burst out laughing for the next two minutes. Thinking about what the 'favor' is Jerry will ask of her.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Nick Caught The Curse

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"I'm Jerry." Clair says as she grinds her teeth.
"Oh crap." you think. Jerry was never the nicest guy, but for the most part, you were under his radar. Now he, or rather she, had a reason to make your life miserable.

"Am I being set up for some sort of joke, Clair?" you ask, hoping Jerry will fall for the lie.
"Cut the B.S. I got on the elevator today, and noticed that my size, suit and sex instantly changed. And everyone kept calling me Clair." she tells you.
"That's quite the story, Jerry." you say, hoping to plead ignorance to the whole situation.
"Beth was talking to me, she was calling me Will, and asking how I was dealing with the changes. It doesn't take a genius to see that you're involved with this." she says, trying to be intimidating.

"So what are you going to do?" you ask her.
"Do?"
