1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Jerry keeps his eyes on you the entire ride back. What you pulled was risky, but it could pay off. It's just to bad that you feel like you had to prostitute yourself to get it.

"Well, we tried." says Nick.
"I gave it all I got." you admit.
"Want a drink?" Nick says as he grabs a bottle of something from his office desk.
"Don't feel like it." Your mind is thinking too much about how much the office had riding on that your business proposal being accepted.
Nick closes the curtains. "You know what would cheer you up?"
"What?" you ask hesitantly, dreading the answer.
"Me." he says taking a swig from the glass he poured.

"I'm not that type of woman." you tell him. He takes another drink.

"That's okay, I'm not usually THAT type of man." he says suavely as he makes his way over to you.
You freeze in place, your mind is hoping that if you stay still he won't be able to see you. Plus if you run now, it might set off his instincts to chase you. You stay silent, you mind is picking up tricks to use on women when you get back to normal.

"Look Nick..." you try and say.
"Clair, I know you're not stupid, you can tell that I like you. You know I am not stupid, I know that if I don't take this opportunity, some guy is going to grab you up." he says just inches from your face. You can smell the alcohol.
"Trust me Nick, I'm not going to hook up with any guy."
Nick stops, in his head, he's thinking if you just admitted to being gay. He takes another drink and refills his glass. He needs more courage for this.

"Clair, if you don't want me. If you don't find me attractive, just say so. I'll stop coming after you, send you back to being Will's assistant and we'll never talk about this again."
"So if I tell you to back off you will?"
"Clair, I'm in the business world, I see time as money and everything as a potential investment. When I look at you, I see a great catch. A smart beautiful woman who is business savvy and doesn't seem as petty as most girls I come across. But time is money, and if I know I have no chance, I'm not going to waste my time. But don't give me this maybe bullshit. If you're not interested in me, and don't think you ever will be, just say it. Say it now and I'll be off your back forever."

A moment passes, and to your horror, you realize you have not said anything. You're actually thinking over his offer. You see a smile spread on Nick's face as he takes another drink, in his mind, this actions are paying off.

Before anything else happens, the phone on Nick's desk starts to ring.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Nick's Offer

choices: They're At A Booth Near The Kitchen
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"Hello." Nick says as he answers the phone. "Yes, she's here. Just a second." he passes the phone into your hands. "Clair, it's for you."
"Will." You hear Joey's voice say.
"Yes, hello." you reply in a dignified manner. Joey's voice sounds out of breath.
"I...I..found her." he says.
"Found?" you ask, both cautiously and optimistic."
"The goth chick you described."
"WHERE?" you voice says, at a level much louder than you meant it too.
"She's at this diner with me, the one with the purple sign, just two blocks East of your building."
"Are you sure?"
"Well, as sure as I can be, since, you know I never say her that night."
"What's she doing?" you ask.
"She's just eating some fries I bought her."
"Joey, listen, she's dangerous, do you understand? Remember what she did to me. Try and keep her there, but if anything feels off, get out!"
"It's cool." Joey assures you.
"I'll be there as soon as I can." you promise as you hang the phone up.

You look at Nick.
Nick doesn't need to say anything, he can tell by what he heard you say that this is serious and takes priority over whatever you have left today.
"I'll be back in an hour." you promise.
"I'll cover for you." he says.

You dash down the hall, getting into the elevator, your mind making everything seem slower than it really is. You keep thinking of the danger Joey is in, on what you're going to say to the Goth, on how you're going to bargain with her, or even threaten her.

You rush as fast as you can in your heels across the room, thinking that one might break at any second. There is a cold wind in the street as you pass by all the strangers. You're changing rapidly as you're running, and it feels like it is taking more energy out of you than it should.
Ten minutes later, you arrive at the diner that Joey described on the phone.
You stagger in, tired but determined. You take a look around trying to see here they are.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The Goth Chick Has Been Sighted

choices: Follow Her As She Finds A Cure
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"Will." Joey says to you, as you head towards him. Sitting across from him at the table is goth. It is defiantly her.
"Hi." she says sheepishly as she waves at you.
You can feel your face turning red, you're mad. You give her the harshest glare you can manage, as you go to sit down beside her, blocking any chance at an easy exit.

"You have A LOT of explaining to do." you say as you sit down.
Her eyes examine your face and then move down to your breasts. "It really is you." she says.
You clench your fist.
"William, this in Amber." Joey says trying to introduce you. "Amber, tell Will what you told me."
Amber pokes your breast. "HEY!" you yell in protest.
"Incredible." Amber says.
"Ya, they're great, now get rid of them." you tell her.
"Oh, sorry. I mean it is incredible, that spell was only supposed to be an illusion."
"What?" you ask.
"The one I cast on you last Saturday, it's just a simple illusion spell. It doesn't actually change you, it just makes you look like a woman. It should have worn off by the morning."
"Should have? SHOULD HAVE?!! First of all you had NO RIGHT to do this to me. Second of all, you messed up! Fix it!"
She touches your hair. "I don't know if I can."
You're clenching your teeth, you want to scratch her eyes out, with a knife.
"Why not? You told me you could have." Joey says.
"I thought maybe I could, but now seeing this, it's a whole different thing than I though. I cast that spell two dozen times before, nothing like this ever happened. Something must have been different."
"Figure out what it is and solve this." you say slowly, showing a surprising amount of restraint.
"Don't rush me, I don't want to make it worse." she says.
This stops you cold. You know the curse is getting stronger, you don't want it to get any worse.
You can see the Goth is thinking and trying to pinpoint something in her head.
"Okay, I might have an idea, but I need to do some research with my books, she says.
You and Joey look at each other, you don't want to let her go alone, but if she did this to you, she might be able to do something worse if you give her the chance. However, she does seem sincere is believing it was a mistake. Maybe if you demanded her to do something now, she could solve this problem and you could go on with your life.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Finally Meeting The Goth

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"Look, I could get this done a lot quicker if you weren't following me all day." she says as she goes through her books.
"I don't care. I'm not losing sight of you." you reply. You're still mad that she did this to your life. Joey sits in the corner of her apartment silently.

After coming here from the diner, there really wasn't much for you to do. Stacks of old books littered the place, and your eyes seemed drawn to the pentagram and unlit candles in the back. On top of one of her shelves was (what you're pretty certain is) a human skull.

Amber slowly read through the books, going over the illustrations and examining every little detail. You're not sure if she was just stalling for time, or if she really did want to get this right.

"If you want, you can help." she says to you.
"What would I do?"
"You could go through some of these books, and tell me if you see something important. Just be careful, and whatever you do, do not read anything out loud."

You grab a book as start looking through the pages. There are transformation spells, but most of them come with a price of some sort, a bit of the caster's looks, a piece of their soul, it's all heavy material which your mind tells you not to get involved in.

After a few minutes, even Joey picks up a book and starts looking through the spells. Part of your mind is terrified about what Joey might learn and try on you. He was into pranks. But you stay silent, hoping that he is smart enough to see the struggle you are going through because of magic and not get involved.

An hour passes, and you're starting to get into the more complex material.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Research Into Magic

choices: She's Going To Teach You Magic
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You are suddenly interrupted from your research by Amber's voice. "I think I've got it!" she yells.
"WHAT?" you yell excitedly without thinking. Feelings of hope seep into you.
"You're a sponge." she says.
"What?" you repeat, this time in a more annoyed voice. She sounds like she's insulting you.
"Um...okay, how do I say this? Most people are like an apple, water seeps in a bit, but most just runs right off it. But some people are like a sponge, they soak everything up."
"And?"
"And that's what you are. You absorbed the spell, and when you were around magic, it must have been feeding it." she explains.
"So she's like a magnet for magic." Joey explains to himself.
"He, he's like a magnet." you correct him.
"That makes sense. Okay, so, maybe, this will let us know what type of magic we're dealing with." Amber says.
"Wait, I was nowhere near you, how am I absorbing magic?" she asks.

Amber shuts up for a second. Thinks before talking again. "I think someone in your life is using it." she says.
"Someone in my life is using magic?"
"That's my guess. Magic causes energy, leftover energy hangs around, like a half-life. So, um, the magic is being converted by the spell and making it stronger." she explains.
"I swear I'm not using magic." Joey says before you get a chance to ask him.
"I know Joey, you're too stupid to." you assure him.
"Okay, going by this theory, all we need to do it drain the magic out of you." she says.

Your mind races with excitement for a second. Could you actually do magic? But you calm down a bit after you remember what you read in the books about the price magic has.

"We'd have to be very careful. You're not born or trained for this, the results could be random." Amber adds.
"Is there a safer way, you know, to drain me?"
Amber sighs. "Not really, and the truth is that this could do more harm than good."
"And if we just wait this out?" you say.
Amber sighs again. "Your body isn't just absorbing the magic, it's purifying it and ingraining it into your system."
"What's that mean?"
"It means that the spell is actually making you a woman. Did you notice yourself changing more over the past few days?"
"Yes." you say, not going into details. The skimpier clothes and make up are embarrassing enough without you having to relive it by explaining them to her. Plus Amber seems to have an idea about what's going on.
"But you still turn into a man when no other guys are around, right?"
"Yes."
"Okay, that's good, once that stops, the curse is almost irreversible."
"What do you mean ONCE that stops?"
"The magic is still doing its initial spell, it made you look like a woman to other men, but it is going one step further. It's building on the initial spell, and for lack of a better term, evolving it."
"So that means?" you ask panics, a large part of you doesn't want to know the answer.
"It means that in another few days, you'll only be able to pee sitting down, and start to plan your calendar around your menstrual cycles."
"But, you'll fix me, right?"
Amber sighs again.
"I have a few ideas that could work."
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: You're A Human Sponge

choices: Just Cast A Spell On Joey
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"The safest way to get to squeeze the magic out of you is to cast a spell. We'll squeeze you dry, so to speak." she says.
"That looked kind of dangerous." you tell her.
"It'll be safe, believe me." she says. "See that blue vase over there?"
"Yes."
"Raise you palm at it, and repeat after me: Voutlas das te au vertous."
"Voutlas das te au vertous." you say, but nothing seems to happen.
"Hm, that was supposed to levitate it." she says.
You lower your palm, feeling stupid for trying. Of course you couldn't use magic. You feel really childish. A woman of your age should know better.

"I've got it." she says. "You were hit with my illusion spell. You can probably only put off similar types of energy. Raise your palm and say this: Voutlas das te au femme."
You repeat the words and there is still nothing.
"Okay, imagine a more delicate vase, with wavy patterns." she says.
"Voutlas das te au femme." you repeat and to your surprise, the vase wobbles a bit, before a slow pinkish color overtakes it, and flower patterns appear.
"Wow." you say, stepping back in excitement.
"Fun isn't it?" Amber says.
"So I just need to redecorate your room, and I'll be cured, right?"
"Something that weak, you might be cured in a month doing spells like that. Do me a favor and touch the vase." Amber instructs.
You walk over and touch the pink, slimmer vase. Almost immediately the flower patterns begin to fade.
"Just as I though, you're already reabsorbing some of the energy."
"So I have to cast a spell and keep on moving? you ask.
"We'll just cast bigger spells." she says.
"I don't want to hurt anyone, or lose a piece of my soul or anything."
"Don't worry, there will be no harm, what we're going to do is cast another illusion spell, just a more powerful one."
"Like the one you hit me with?"
"Yes, very much like that one. But you need the spell to wrap around a person, otherwise the energy is just going to spread out, and gravitate back to you."
"So can I cast it on you?"
"No silly, I've already got a spell like that on me, you hit me again with it and we'll have feedback, and trust me, you don't want feedback."
"Then who?" you ask.
Amber nudges her head towards Joey, who has been watching you from a distance, like he'd watch someone shooting a gun on a firing range.
"Joey?" you whisper to her.
"It won't affect him like it did you, he'll be back to normal in an hour."
"Are you sure? I mean you still don't know what went wrong with me."
She gives you a look that says she's confident that she's right, but that you also have a point.
You don't want to put Joey what you're going through, but at the same time, you need to get rid of this magic, or you might just start lactating in the future, and you're pretty sure you don't want that.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: A Simple Magic Trick

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
It's not fair to cast a spell on Joey without his permission. It happened to you and is ruining your life, you walk over to Joey.
"Hey Joey." you say in a soft and sweet voice.
"Hey Will."
"Joey, um, I was wondering if you could let me cast a spell on you." you say.
Joey looks at you, he sees you're blushing, and its hard for his eyes not to stare at your breasts.
"What kind of spell?" he asks.
"A glamor spell." you say.
"And what does that do?"
"Its an illusion, it will make you look irresistible for an hour." Amber yells behind you.
"It won't turn me into a girl, right? Because that's the sort of thing I'd need to get therapy after, if it happened."
You force your mouth to stay shut, and give him an unknowing look.
"Please, it will help cure me." you finally coo.

You hate doing this, it always makes you feel like less of a man. But using your feminine wiles seem like its the best way to get Joey to let his guard down and help you.

"Please." you beg again.

You can see Joey pondering this for a moment.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Asking A Favour Of Joey

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"Fine, I'll do it, but you owe me big time." Joey says.
"Thank you, thank you, thank you." you say hugging him tightly. It causes him to have an erection, but at this moment, you don't care. If he doesn't get a chance to think things through he'll have less of a chance to change him mind.

"This is a completely controlled environment, for magic at least." Amber assures him.
"So what do I do?" asks Joey.
"Stand by the door." Amber says.
You walk Joey to the door, until Amber motions at you to stand next to her.
"Now what?" you ask.
"Just like the vase, raise you palm, imagine something feminine, and repeat after me."
You raise your palm, and start thinking of lipstick and embroidered frilly dresses, high heels, nylons, long curly hair, breasts and anything else stereotypically feminine.
"Got it?"
"Got it."
"Okay, now say: Quizelle throughtoua gottas femme ilusio."
"Quizelle throughtoua gottas femme ilusio." you yell as you squeeze your eyes closed.

You open your eyes and look at Joey, nothing changed about him.
"Oh thank god, I was having second thoughts about this." Joey says as he looks at himself.
"It didn't work!" you say to Amber, she's obviously a horrible teacher.
"Didn't it?" Amber asks.
You look at Joey again. "No!" you reply.
"Look at your nails William." Amber says.
You hold them up to your face and examine them, they're no longer painted. You quickly feel your earlobes , you're earrings are gone to.
Running towards a mirror, you see that you have no make up on your face, but you're still wearing the same clothes as this morning, and more importantly you're still female.

"What? What happened?" Joey asks in earnest.
"I'm not wearing any make up!" you tell him.
"Let me see." Joey says, before Amber holds him back.
"Joey, you need to stay away from your friend, or she'll absorb the magic again." she explains.
Joey stops half-way across the room from you.

"So what did you do to me?" Joey asks her.
"The same spell I did to your friend." Amber answers.
"But nothing has changed."
"Joey, the spell only works when another man can see you." she says. "Look around, how many men do you see here."
"Will is a man."
"Have her lift up her skirt to prove that." Amber says cruelly.
"So I just wait here for four hours?" Joey asks.
"No, the magic will just start dissipating from you and heading back to your friend.
"So should I go back to my apartment?" he asks.
"Just hang at the mall for a few yours, or go see a theater or something." Amber orders.
Joey looks at you and sees that the exorcizes are having some effect, but you can tell his heart is racing. He's terrified of having another guy see him. You can tell regret is starting to form on his face.
"I'll be fine." you promise. It is a hollow one, but he doesn't have to know that.
"Fine, I'll be back in three hours." Joey says.
"Don't go to your apartment." Amber adds. "If the energy leaks around there, William will just suck it up again.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: You Place The Spell On Joey

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Seconds after Joey opens the door, he is replaced by a beautiful woman standing in the hallway. She has a low flowing skirt, that compliments the movement of her curly hair.

"Excuse me mam." a voice says as she takes a step back.
A tall thin man knocks on the open door to Amber's apartment.
"Amber, are you here?" she asks.
"Oh god, it is you." the woman beside you says.
"Over two years now, and I see that you're here with company."
"Girl's got to have some friends."
"Indeed. May I come in?"
"Yes, of course. Would you like something to drink?"
"No, I'm fine, I'll take a seat here beside your lovely guest." The man says as he prepares to sit down beside you.
"I'm Charles Edward Thomas III" he says in a gentlemanly manner, reaching out to share your hand.
"Clair." you say as you reach out to shake, although he takes hold of your hand and leans over to kiss your wrist.
"Charmed Clair."

You don't know what to think of this. You feel as though he just violated your personal space, but your body is responding warmly to the attention. You feel your heart beating faster, which is not something you're proud of as this guy is more than twice your age. Maybe you have daddy issues.

"So Clair, tell me what you are doing here." he says, taking your pause in thought as a opening to speak.
"Amber is my friend. She invited me up here to talk about, uh, girlie stuff."
"Well I hope I'm not interrupting anything important."
"Only if you find tampon statistics and make up tips important." you say, trying to disinterest him in further questioning.
"Not really." he says, looking at the open door to the hallway.
Joey is still standing there, giving you a confused look. The arms are around his sides, subtly feeling the outlines of his, or rather her, new form.
"Is the girl in the hall alright?" asks Charles.
"She's just resisting the urge to dance." you lie.
"What type of dancer is she?"
"Exotic." you blurt out, and want to punch yourself as soon as you do.
"Really?!" Charles looks at you in disbelief. Your eyes tell Joey to leave and she does so.

"So what brings you here?" asks Amber as she returns from the kitchen with some tea.
"Strangest thing, luv. I was just in the area, and felt like checking up on you."
"Really?" she asks.
"Well, if I had known you were entertaining, I would have brought friends."
"I'd love to chat, I mean LOVE to Charles, but as you can see, I have company over, and I'm not sure their mortal minds could handle out topics of discussion." Amber replies, the last part of her sentence said under her breath.
"You mean she's not like us?" he says as he looks at you.
"Yes."
A bewildered expression forms on his face.
"I could have sworn I've felt some energy radiating from her."
"NO." Amber answers defiantly.
Charles takes a quick whiff in your direction and then stands up.
"Very well then Amber, I suppose we should talk in two days time."
"Perhaps."
"It is not a request, be prepared to greet me the day after the next." he says as he stands up.

"Sorry if I have inconvenienced you at all." the man says as he kisses your wrist goodbye. In your stunned state you let him, not knowing how to respond.
As he shuts the door, you have a feeling that Joey is going to get some unexpected attention the second he leaves the building.

"Sorry you had to see him." Amber says.
"Who was he?" you ask.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: A Strange Encounter With Charles Edward Thomas III

choices: Agree To Help With The Gliffe
Just Get Cured And Go Home
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"He was the man that gave me magic."
"Gave you magic?"

She smiles.
"Yes. And despite looks, he's not quite human." she adds.
"Then what is he?"
"He's someone who I have not seen for two years."
"So?"
"So, I think it is more than coincidence that he showed up at the same time you are here."
"This is the sponge thing, right?" you ask, almost deadpan.
"I think you might be more than a sponge, I think you might be a conductor. Magic seems attracted to you."
"I'm a magic magnet then."
"Probably, yes. Which makes you more useful than you know." she smiles.
"Useful?"
She looks at your breasts, and legs.
"It's probably better that he didn't see you as a male."
"Why?"
"One, he's the jealous type. Two, he sensed magic from you, and he might pursue you like he did me now that he's seen you. You get yourself cured, and you're just some dude who doesn't know he's special. He might sense the magic, but he'll think you're some guy he's never met before and will leave you alone."
"Wait, so if you cure me today..."
"...All your problems from this vanish." she finished.
"There is a catch though, right? There is always a catch." you add before you allow yourself to hope once more.

Amber's eyes avoid yours for a while, as she lets out a few 'ums' and 'ers.'

"Just say it!" you yell.
"There is a chance here, for you to do something to help us."
"US?"
"The magic community."
"You have a community?"
"And if you help us, you'd be in our debt."
"Bitch, you're already in my debt." you think, but allow yourself not to say it. You just stand silently, giving her an uneasy glare.
"If you are a magical conductor, and attract magical beings, we can use you to catch a chaotic entity." she says.

She stops, expecting you to speak, you don't say anything, letting her dig own hole with the explanation.

"It's a creature called a Gliffe. It preys on instability and chaos. It usually starts slow, breaking up couples, turning business partners against each other, but if left unchecked for a few months, it can topple economies and start wars."

You look at her like you think she believes your some kind of idiot.
"What is in it for me?" you ask.

She smiles, before answering. "Power beyond what you can imagine. If you want, you can get your old life back and then some, with some safeguards I put in place so nothing like this will ever happen again." she says as she pokes your chest.

"And if I don't help?"

"I'll cure you, although it will take longer. You go home, and it is like none of this ever happened. Although now that your magic sponge ability seems to be activated, who knows what will happen if you walk into a place with the discharged energy. And don't think I'll be eager to help with something that is not my fault. Tracking down the Gliffe and things like that, keep a girl busy." she say smugly.

You think about it. You really don't want to get any deeper into this, but it almost sounds like Amber will keep your manhood hostage unless you help.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Amber's Offer

choices: Go To The Office Building Garage To Get Your Car Back
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"Fine, I'll help you." you tell her.
"Good." she says smugly. She's acting like she's got you by the balls, and in a way, she does.
"So what do I do?"
"You just have to show up when we tell you to, and the Gliffe will come to you. Then I'll do the rest."
"It's that simple?"
"It's that simple."

You then both shut up and eye each other. There is a bit more hostility between you than before Charles Edward Thomas arrived. Maybe she thinks you won't live up to the challenge and run. Maybe she'll stiff you. You start to see angles being played here that you hadn't before.

"Do you want to try another trick?" she asks.
You look down at your breasts, you wouldn't mind getting rid of them. "Sure. you answer.

Amber goes to her fridge and takes out an ice cold beer.
"Why does a single woman living alone have beer?" you ask her. It just looks kind of pathetic.
She takes a bottle and places it on her table. "Focus your energy on it."

You close you eyes and try and envision the bottle in your head. You get a tingling feeling at the tips of your fingers and envision the bottle being hit by your energy. As you open your eyes to see if anything happened, you notice the wold going dark.

"Will? Will? Clair?" Amber's voice says and you regain your sight.
"What happened?" you ask her.
"You passed out." she says as she offers you her hand to pick you up.
"Did it work?" you ask.
"Kind of." she says as she points to the table.
Instead of a bottle full of beer, you see a bunch of dead flowers that have been stuffed in a beer can.

"I don't think you can safely cast more than a spell a day." Amber says.
You look down, you're still female, and still have long hair, but you're clothes look pretty butch. You're now wearing a plaid shirt with skin tight jeans, you're still wearing high heels though.

"You should probably call it a day." she tells you.
"You're right, I need to get back to work." you respond without thinking. "WORK" the word hits you.
"Hate to tell you this babe, but you were out for a good five hours. Your work will probably be closed by the time you get there."
"CRAP, CRAP, CRAP!" you mind races. Your car is still at the garage, and now Nick is going to be all over you for a favor because he had to cover for you.

"Go home, I'll contact you tomorrow." she says.

You meekly walk out of the house, feeling defeated.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Finishing Up Todays Lessons

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You're kind of disappointed that you won't see what type of woman Joey will end up as, but you're more interested in becoming a full time man again. As your roommate shuts the door behind him, Amber looks at you.
"There are two things you need to figure out." Amber says.
"Why are you able to soak up this magic, and who is causing magic around you?"
"Is it possible that it is some guy that I never met? Like someone doing magic on the floor above or below me?"
"In theory yes, but not very likely at the rate your transformation is going."
"So it is likely that one of my co-workers or fellow apartment tenants is doing magic."
"It could be."

Amber stops and thinks for a bit, her face telling that her simple spell on you has revealed that there are other powerful magic users in the area.

"So can I cast spells on strangers I see in the window until this curse is gone?" you ask.
"In time. If you cast too many spells too soon, there are usually some consequences."
"Like?"
"You don't want to know. Just follow my instructions and by tomorrow, you should be back to normal."
You sit yourself down.
That's a big promise, and if she can pull it off, you're willing to wait.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Cured In A Day

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"I'm not stupid, I know you know how to cure me." you tell her.
"I only know what I told you." she says.
"I don't trust you!" you yell.
"Okay, there is a small chance that you can cure yourself." she says.
"Myself? How?"
"Have you been kissed?" she asks.
You mind shudders, as you remember Ben kissing your neck.
"Yes." you say very slowly.
"Have you been kissed on the lips?"
You think about it. "No." you answer with caution.
"The illusion spell I put on you, it was altered a bit years ago, kind of as a practical joke. There is a safeguard that was added to it. Imagine if you're drunk and the girl you kiss is suddenly a guy. A kiss on the lips was a safeguard that was added and let the spell know it was over.
